results.description:
Meet me at Central Park for a guided meditation. That means you don't have to do anything except for show up and be ready to leave feeling happy and peaceful! Bring something to sit on if you mind sitting directly on the grass.

I will lead you through a meditation which will bring awareness to your body, mind and soul. We will release any limiting beliefs and practice diaphragmatic breathing. We will work through the 7 chakras and raise your energy, releasing any blockages in your energy field. 


We will meet at the southern end of Sheep Meadow, by the giant rock. (See map). You can't miss it. If you need help finding us, please call me at <a>[masked]</a>. Please leave a donation after the meditation. It helps me keep the group going. Average donations are $10-$20.

***classes start at 6:15-6:30 the latest and last about 45 minutes. We do some stretching after the meditation to get the blood flowing and our bodies moving. Wear something stretchy and comfortable. If you are coming straight from work, don't worry about it, just come in and join us. After the meditation we usually chit chat and share our experiences. Classes are small, usually around 5 people or less. 

Love,

Rina
results.name: Meditation at Central Park

results.description:
Challenge Yourself!

Better than the gym Thursday!

This is not a beginner hike.  We will be hiking in the dark and moving at a brisk pace.


We're not calling this a Sunset Hike technically because the sun setting around 7pm makes it hard to get in a good hike and still make it to a look out but we'll see it and it will be very nice.


[masked], [masked] are the exact GPS Coordinates for the trail head.  The lower lot is technically right across the street from 64 Skyline Drive address.

Fast night hike.  7 ish miles, with about a 900 ft elevation gain

We will meet at the LOWER lot of skyline drive in Oakland at 6:15pm on Thursday evening. This will be approximately a 2 - 3 hour hike.

We will take the blue trail to Ramapo Lake and left on Lake Shore Drive Carriage Road around the lake to a brief meetup with the Cannonball trail but headed to orange.  Once on orange we will cross over the pipeline and head to overlook view points and then follow the orange on a beautiful loop back to the pipeline.  We'll then head up the pipeline to the top and make a right on the white trail that leads us to some nice views of a perhaps fading sunset and NYC skyline.


We will walk through the Van Slyke Castle. http://theoaklandjournal.com/oaklandnj/hike-into-history/">http://theoaklandjournal.com/oaklandnj/hike-into-history/</a>;  and descend down most likely we'll take the white back to lake shore road with a probable detour through an unmarked shortcut.  Once on lake shore we can run, jog or walk back to the dam where we'll get some pics and hang out a bit before descending blue back to the parking lot.


This route may change from week to week depending on group so please have a map or gps.

http://www.state.nj.us/dep/parksandforests/parks/maps/NYNJTC_NJParkMaps-RamapoMtn_2015-85x11.pdf"></a>" class="linkified">http://www.state.nj.us/dep/parksandforests/parks/maps/NYNJTC_NJParkMaps-RamapoMtn_2015-85x11.pdf;

Bring headlamps, maps and water. Have fun!

FYI...Very good information about ticks available from the website link below. Helps to take away some of the mystery and scare tactics.

http://www.tickencounter.org

--------------------------------------------------------------

You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. 

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers. 

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability. 

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader- This is YOUR hike.

results.description:
We are teaming up with the NYC BigApps Zero Waste Challenge to host a live Data Analytic at Civic Hall.

We are reaching out to this Meetup group’s members with an opportunity to apply your skills to help the City of New York. We need skills to pick apart highly relevant datasets to make the city more efficient. This is an opportunity to dig deep into data and actionable information and implementation strategies that could help solve some of the toughest waste problems in the City.

Participants will be distributed into app teams to analyze a dataset relevant to waste. As that team’s analyst, you will be responsible for visualizing the data, analyzing it, and helping the app team form a strategy to utilize what you’ve learned. The app teams will assist you with the analysis and help provide creative ideas on what the data tells us.

Come help create an app that could make New York's waste behavior more effective and efficient.

If you are interested in participating in a specific role (eg data cruncher), please message any of the hosts on the meetup page!!!

You can find example projects here: http://bigapps.nyc/p/challenges/zero-waste-challenge/ and datasets here: http://bigapps.nyc/p/resources/zero-waste-data-sets-other-tools/

Quandl.com has some interesting sets on cpi for sewer & trash, home values, waste rail traffic, etc.

NYC polygon files and buildings database: http://www.nyc.gov/html/dcp/html/bytes/applbyte.shtml

Use http://mesowest.utah.edu/ for weather data sets.

A special thanks to Energy Vision for their assistance in organizing the event. Energy Vision is an industry leader in the advancement of waste to energy solutions.
results.how_to_find_us: 2nd floor, front elevators or stairs

results.description:
Please join us for a fireside chat with Thomas Clancy, President of Valiant Technology on Thursday, September 24th from 6 - 8pm.

Founded in 2002, with 25 engineers actively supporting over 75 businesses in Greater New York as a Managed Services Provider, Valiant believes that the right technology can help every small and mid-size business achieve its goals.

Tom has been providing technical support and training to businesses for over 15 years.  His support and advice goes beyond the technical into the realm of true consulting on a company's business processes.

He is also a frequent speaker at industry trade events including Google's New York Headquarters, Autotask’s Comm Live, Business Solutions Magazine’s Channel Pro event, and others.  Last but not least, he's written three books (The Mac OS X Bible, Panther, Tiger and Leopard editions), and contributes articles to a number of trade journals.

Fireside chat format:


• 6:00 - 6:30 pm: Open Networking

• 6:30 - 7:15 pm: Fireside Chat using a Q&A approach, (35mins between speaker and organizer, and 10mins between speaker and audience)

• 7:15 - 8:00 pm: Open Networking

Contribution - $5 with your RSVP online; $10 in-person

Wine and snacks will be served.  Can't wait to see you there!

Have a great idea for a guest speaker?  Please let us know!
results.how_to_find_us: In SoHo off of Prince Street, right next to Armani Exchange (A|X). First closest train is Prince St (N,R). Second closest train is Broadway-Lafayette (B,D,F,M).

Walter Weissman is a photographer of New York and Hamptons artists and art events, and is also a sculptor. He will be joined by Chris Byrne, and Eunice Golden.

Chris Byrne is a curator and the co-founder of the Dallas Art Fair. He serves on the Dallas Contemporary’s board of directors as well as the American Folk Art Museum’s Council for the Study of Art Brut and the Self-Taught.

Eunice Golden, a pioneering, internationally known feminist artist. Since the 1960s, she depicted the male nude in her paintings, performance, body art, photography and film. A recipient of the 2015 Pollock/Krasner Foundation Grant, her work has been exhibited in numerous galleries and museums that include the Whitney Museum, MOMA, Brooklyn Museum, National Academy of Design, Hudson River Museum, Indianapolis Museum, Museum of Fine Arts Santa Fe, et al.

This panel will be moderated by: Douglas I. Sheer, ATOA Chairman, and Governor Society of Motion Picture & Television Engineers, New York Region

results.description:
The number-one question we hear from founders is...how do I get investors for my startup?

Getting funded requires preparation. 


Many good ideas don't get funded because the founder doesn't know enough about how investors think.


This presentation will provide insider info on:

• The most important factor in getting an investor

• Types of investors...how they categorize founders and choose who to fund

• How investors rank startups

• The hidden rules of investors

• How to improve your place in the entrepreneurial hierarchy 

• What investors don't want


• How to convince investors...pitching mistakes to avoid and things you should not say!

Agenda

We're happy to announce that WeWork is the new home of the Brooklyn Startups Meetup!


• 6:00pm - networking and refreshments

• 7:00 - presentation with Q&A

• 8:30 - more Q&A and networking

If you'd like to get funding for your startup or business... attend this event.

Speaker

D.K. Smith is Managing Director at the Brooklyn Innovation Center. D.K. has heard and read over a thousand pitches and business plans from both the investor's and founder's  perspective.


He began helping startups raise money after years of providing due diligence services to angel investors and venture capital firms. The founders he's worked with have collectively raised tens of millions.


D.K. is a judge for the Brooklyn Public Library’s PowerUP! business plan competition. He's also a startup mentor for the NYC BigApps civic tech competition.


Our Sponsor

WeWork provides small businesses, startups, and freelancers with the workspace, community, and services they need to make a life, not just a living.


From weekly events, personalized support, flexibility, and access to thousands of other members around the world, WeWork is the perfect place to grow your business in 2015 and beyond. Their core values and commitment to Brooklyn make this an excellent collaboration! 

Click here for info on joining WeWork's community of creators in downtown Brooklyn.

results.description:
Join us at NYC ACRE, http://www.nycacre.com/ to discuss Digital Empowerment, Personal Online Security, and Women in AppSec (WIA) with our special guests Jensine Larsen and Juanita Koilpillai Moderator, Michael Lightman, Program Manager, NYC ACRE and Clean Start, NYU Poly.

This meetup will be held in collaboration with WIA @ AppSecUSA www.appsecusa.org in San Francisco during the same time. 

Twitter Chat: @AppSecUSA #WIA @OWASPBrooklyn @OWASP

About NYC ACRE and Michael Lightman, Moderator:

Mike Lightman is a cleantech entrepreneur on a mission to make New York City the leader in profitable environmentally friendly systems. He is currently the Program Manager for NYC ACRE and NYU’s Clean Start Program.

Environmentally conscious businesses have been Mike’s primary focus for several years. As a graduate student, he led a team of other MBA students on a tour of the entrepreneurial culture in Israel and functioned as the project lead for a global consulting project there. As a Project Consultant for the Peace Corps in Morocco, he worked with cleantech entrepreneurs and community leaders to create sustainable economic growth opportunities, such as designing thermal solar panels made from local materials. He went on to develop bigger projects in wind energy technology at Apex Clean Energy in Virginia. At Excell Partners, a seed stage VC fund in upstate New York, he rose to the position of Senior Analyst. Currently, he is the Program Manager for ACRE, New York’s top cleantech incubator, and NYU Clean Start, an advanced certification program for the cleantech future.

ACRE is one of three incubators owned and operated by the NYU School of Engineering. These work with hardware and software startups with business models ranging from cleantech to smart cities. Besides providing many traditional incubator services, ACRE is also able to leverage relationships with NYSERDA and NYCEDC to help startups communicate directly with city infrastructure leaders, as well as identify, train, and employ the university's best talent to work alongside ACRE members.

Mike holds a BA in marketing and CIS from James Madison University. He also holds an MBA from the University of Rochester.

Mike is fluent in Arabic and is also an Eagle Scout.

About OWASP WIA

OWASP’s Women in AppSec (WIA) program

The purpose of the Women in AppSec Program is to increase the participation of women in the field of application security. The program was successfully launched in 2013 at AppSec USA NY, and the aim is to run the program at every OWASP Global AppSec going forward. Most recently, at AppSec EU in Amsterndam in May 2015, a program with the theme "Women in AppSec - Making it Happen" was launched and both a panel and a workshop were included at the event.


The Women in AppSec program is for any OWASP member who believes that diversity is important to the success of the organization, as well as for women looking to learn more about AppSec or who want to make career connections with like-minded colleagues. This includes female undergraduate and graduate students, instructors, and professionals who are dedicated to information security or application development.

About Jensine Larsen

Jensine (Yen-See Nah) Larsen is an award-winning social media entrepreneur, international journalist, and speaker.  At age 28 she founded World Pulse – a digital communication network connecting women worldwide and bringing them a global voice – after working as a freelance journalist covering indigenous movements and ethnic cleansing in South America and Southeast Asia. Today World Pulse is powered by tens of thousands of women from 190 countries, many who are using internet cafes and cell phones from rural villages and conflict zones, collectively improving the lives of 2.2 million people.  www.worldpulse.com

After successfully launching a print version of World Pulse magazine, in 2007 Larsen turned her eyes to the future of communications technology in the developing world.  She pioneered an interactive global women’s newswire where women worldwide – including those using internet cafes and cell phones from rural villages and conflict zones– can speak for themselves to the world and solve global problems. 

Most recently, Larsen has launched a new program that is training women in digital empowerment that is fostering a network of vocal women leaders from some of the most forgotten regions of the world.

Today women from virtually every country in the world are connecting through World Pulse and producing a multiplier effect of change. Women previously unknown by the global public are having their stories picked up from World Pulse by the BBC, CNN, the UN, and the Huffington Post and beyond.  In addition, by networking through World Pulse’s website grassroots women leaders are finding job opportunities, starting new programs and businesses, launching women’s cybercafés, and finding international speaking opportunities that are changing their lives and lifting their communities.

With her finger on the pulse of women's voices globally, Jensine is a Huffington Post columnist and sought after for inspirational keynotes, current affairs lectures, and radio programs. She has appeared on NPR and PBS and presented keynotes and panels at TED, Clinton Global Initiative, Social Good Summit, Nobel Women’s Initiative, Skoll World Forum for Social Entrepreneurship, Bioneers Global, Digital Earth, WebVisions, Women in Technology International, the Women’s Funding Network, NetImpact, and the Conference on World Affairs, to name a few.

Jensine has been recognized with several leadership awards including being honored as a contemporary woman spiritual leader by the Auburn Seminary with a <a>"Lives of Commitment Award"</a> following in the footsteps of Alice Walker and Jane Goodall.  In addition, she was selected as a <a>"Woman Who Inspires"</a> by Donna Karan alongside such luminaries as Susan Sarandan, Fatima Bhutto, and Uma Thurman. Morgan Stanley-Smith Barney has selected Jensine as one of six "Next Generation Changemakers" under 40 in 2011, and a “Young Visionary for Tomorrow” by the SciFi Channel. The University of Wisconsin-Madison selected her as one of the top 10 social change leaders under 40 in 2012.  In 2013 she was recognized as one of Rockefeller’s Top 100 Next Century Innovators.

Holding a degree in Comparative International Studies from the University of Wisconsin Madison (1999), Larsen is also a Young Leaders Fellow with the National Committee on United States-China Relations. She was appointed to Portland, Oregon’s Vision Committee, which was established by Mayor Tom Potter to chart the city’s 30-year vision by listening to the visions of its citizens. She serves on the Advisory Board for the Nobel Women's International Campaign to End Sexual Violence in Conflict, Women Have Wings, Katerva International Sustainability Prize, and Ripples to Waves: A Stanford University program on Social Entrepreneurship and Development.

About Juanita Koilpillai 

https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/OJfqnALTV638UbUn3TlZOM_0sKDFX11FdJcsP4cjbV1fXAJwmrt0ialMesj__khNWo0b__KGDOMAmCtxKVkIoLReyH-JIh88ZkEvfSFzq05Gxc3HIO1ez9LaKNdafNECN9om5xB7iTpL2gdf

Juanita Koilpillai is Founder & CEO of Waverley Labs a cyber risk engineering company. She has spent 30 years developing systems in computer security, network management and distributed software. She is currently pioneering the field of digital risk management and is the technical advisor to the Digital Risk Management Institute. As part of that effort, she is leading the open source software-defined perimeter (SDP) effort for ‘black’ apps in the cloud with the Cloud Security Alliance. The SDP is a prescriptive five layer security model that stops all network-based cyber attacks.

She is an active contributor to NIST and led the creation of a security risk index system for moving apps to the cloud (NIST[masked]),  She was a key member of FEMA’s  Enterprise Security Management Team and has served as Principle Investigator for several Department of Defense initiatives. She co-founded CyberWolf - one of the most  advanced automated attack sensing and warning systems that was deployed by government and later acquired by Symantec.

results.description:
The number-one question I hear from founders is...how do I get investors for my startup?

Getting funded requires preparation. 

Many good ideas don't get funded because the founder doesn't know enough about how investors think.

This presentation will provide insider info on:

• The most important factor in getting an investor

• Types of investors...how they categorize founders and choose who to fund

• How investors rank startups

• The hidden rules of investors

• How to improve your place in the entrepreneurial hierarchy 

• What investors don't want

• How to convince investors...pitching mistakes to avoid and things you should not say!

Agenda

• 6:00pm - networking and refreshments

• 7:00 - presentation with Q&A

• 8:30 - more Q&A and networking

If you'd like to get funding for your startup or business... attend this event.

Speaker

D.K. Smith is Managing Director at the Brooklyn Innovation Center. D.K. has heard and read over a thousand pitches and business plans from both the investor's and founder's  perspective.

He began helping startups raise money after years of providing due diligence services to angel investors and venture capital firms. The founders he's worked with have collectively raised tens of millions.

D.K. is a judge for the Brooklyn Public Library’s PowerUP! business plan competition. He's also a startup mentor for the NYC BigApps civic tech competition.

Our Sponsor

WeWork provides small businesses, startups, and freelancers with the workspace, community, and services they need to make a life, not just a living.

From weekly events, personalized support, flexibility, and access to thousands of other members around the world, WeWork is the perfect place to grow your business in 2015 and beyond. Their core values and commitment to Brooklyn make this an excellent collaboration! 

Click here for info on joining WeWork's community of creators.

This meetup group tends to play medium and some light weight modern strategy games. We are happy to teach new games to anyone who is open to learn.

The group is more for those who like to try new games, as we play different games depending on number and level of attendees. It's not for those who like to play particular games only, repeatedly and competitively, or not for those who don't like to teach and play with beginners.

Some ideas are:
https://boardgamegeek.com/strategygames/browse/boardgame?sort=rank&sortdir=asc

1. No reserved seats. Arrive/leave anytime but first come, first served. Not everyone shows up at 6pm, however we prefer to keep start time 6pm because The Uncommons is pretty busy by 7pm and we have better chance to get seats early.

2. Feel free to play with others from this group and others. There will be many more game lovers at The Uncommons and often people jump into games asking if there are extra spots.

3. Please pay $5 per person table charge including game use directly to the casher. This meetup group and organizer(s) do not get any money from the event.

The Uncommons have 500+ games on shelf.
http://www.uncommonsnyc.com/

4. Come anytime but if some games are in progress, please wait (do not interrupt - save big introduction chat for between games), look around if other games have a spot to join, or feel free to start new game by yourself and ask around if others are interested.

This is not the type of event that someone greets you at door and walks through. If you can not find us, ask at the casher. (If you post "I'm here, find me", we may not see it until the game ends or even until the night ends.)

5. If you want to play particular game and start at particular time, please post message to ask if anyone else is interested.

results.description:
Updated March 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside as a backup.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
Greetings, STSANY members and friends:

RSVP deadline for this meetup has been extended to Wednesday, 9/23, at 10:00 p.m.  That's tonight! There is NO fee for this meetup.

Holiday Booking Update:

I booked Sunday, Dec. 27 at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center at 3:00 p.m. Please confirm ASAP. I would like to do another one, there, for a different group of patients, during the 2nd or 3rd week of December. I'll get back to you about that. And please let me know your available dates in December. The space is very large, and they have a grand piano!

Also: Looks like we'll do a program at the Kravis Children's Hospital at Mt. Sinai on their closed circuit, interactive TV program, "Kids on TV," for kids from 1-22. Sounds really cool!, and they will video it for us, which is good for our PR. Still waiting for them to confirm a date and time.

Also: I've left 2 messages at the NYU Hospital for Joint Diseases for Children, but haven't heard from them, as yet. That's the Langone Medical Center. I'll keep you posted.


NOTE: When you volunteer you make someone happy, you feel good about yourself, you work with and socialize with fellow STSANY members, you network, and you have a lot of fun. 

Thanks to those who have already RSVPd to perform with us. Others who would like to participate in the events should RSVP on the posting page, immediately. Professionals as well as non-semi professionals are welcome to volunteer. To be included, EVERYONE MUST DO THE FOLLOWING:

1) Attend this planning/performing meetup on Thursday, September 24 from 6:15-8:15 p.m. to review your material and share ideas about the informal "script" we will create;

2) Send me the name(s) of a holiday song or duet (in any language), poem, story, instrumental piece relating to Christmas, Chanukah, Kwaanza, etc., and bring it with you to the meetup. Your material should reflect how holidays are celebrated by various cultures, whenever possible;

3) Attend one-two workshops for singers and actors (TBA soon) to work on your material between now and December. Workshop fee is $20.

4) Send me the days and dates you will be available to volunteer for these events, and those days when you will not be available, ASAP! That includes weekdays, evenings and weekends. You do not have to commit to all the bookings, but knowing your schedule is absolutely essential to booking events.

IMPORTANT: Booking takes a lot of time and energy as contacting folks at hospitals, etc., is not an easy task. So, we are counting on your quick replies to our emails and questions so we can successfully organize these events to everyone's satisfaction. Again: NO-SHOWS AND LAST MINUTE CANCELLATIONS FOR EVENTS ARE NOT ACCEPTABLE. Be sure of your schedule before you commit to a particular event. You need not commit to all of them.

NOTE: STSANY is a cooperative creative arts meetup. We all have to work together on this and all volunteer and other events. We're all busy, but we can always find time to do something worthwhile. 

Please read my original posting below for more details.

I look forward to seeing you on Thursday, September 24, and thank you for volunteering!

Best wishes,

Anna

www.annabartos.com

VOLUNTEER! 

Would you like to make someone happy during the December holidays? You can sing (solo and in the ensemble), act, read a poem or story, or play an instrument in a fun holiday event, replete with costumes, make-up and lots of good spirit. 

We are encouraging new members or those who have not volunteered at our previous events to step up and be counted!


STSANY would like this year's volunteering to be mostly for kids and seniors in hospitals, shelters, schools (concentrating on kids in need who don't get to see live performances), community centers, etc. 

"Looking for Christmas: Purrrlock Holmes' Marvelous Holiday Adventure," musical/theatrical event, will explore the meaning of Christmas, Chanukah and other similar holidays. The main protagonist is Purrrlock Holmes, a lively, funny, spunky feline who can sing and act. Is there a Purrrlock in the house??

More details will be given at a meetup, soon to be scheduled. 

Meanwhile: Volunteer to make connections with some venues you know or find,  and work with fellow members to schedule various events for December. 

Please contact me ASAP with some brilliant ideas and your "yes" to participate. Be sure to tell me which week night is good for you to attend this planning meetup. We need the help of several people to pull this off! Let's put our heads together to make this a smashing holiday season by making many someones happy! We need to do this very soon, as the season will be here before we know it. and venues have already started "hiring" entertainers.

Please check your emails, regularly, so you can join us in planning this musical-theatrical outreach event!

Thank you!

Cheers,
Anna

Let's climb together at this newly opened indoor rock climbing spot - The Cliffs at LIC - the newest & largest indoor rock climbing gym in NYC area. Mention NYC Active group for receive specials for our meetups (Listed below). 

Specials for our meetup:

• First-time climbers will receive free rental gear. It must be the first visit to the facility and with scheduled meet-up.
• The $99 initiation fee is waived for month-to-month membership for meet-up members if they sign up on a meet-up day.
• Meet-up members will receive 50% off (enter promo code HALF-PRICE-CARD) on the Climbing 101 class on the day of their meet-up. Classes must be booked in advance.

The Cliffs at LIC features:

Expertly-set routes for all levels of climbing experience + ability 
• Over 30,000 square feet of climbing terrain
• Over 125 top rope stations and tons of lead climbing
• 16-foot top-out bouldering
• Professional instructors with a passion for climbing
• Separate Party Room for events + classes
• Full fitness gym
No experience necessary!
Each participant must have a waiver (to be filled out by a parent or guardian for participants under 18)!

Date/Time: Every Thursday 6:30 pm to 10:00 pm

REGULAR PRICING Posted at Cliffs LIC Website

Day Pass // $28
College Day Pass* // $24
1-Month Pass // $140
Learn to Climb 1-Month Package // $149
10-Visit Pass // $250
Memberships // Click for details

*Full-time college student ages 18-25

RENTALS

Climbing Shoes // $6
Harness // $5
Chalk Bag // $3
Package // $12

Click Here for details on memberships.

CLIMBING 101: TOPROPE BASICS

The facility includes climbing & fitness

Location (Map)

[masked]th Dr
Long Island City
Queens, NY 11101 
(718) 729-ROCK (7625)

Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days
Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

If you are a total beginner to indoor climbing (never climbed or belayed before), you will need to take a class. Please book "Climbing 101: TopRope Basics" at 6:30 pm on Tuesday by entering promo code HALF-PRICE-CARD or call[masked] & mention NYC Active meetup to get 50% off. This class will teach you how to tie the rope and belay your climbing partner. Gear rental is included in the class. You can still do boulder without taking the class or being belay certified though.

If you are new to The Cliffs at LIC but have been belayed certified in other gym, you can take a test & it will only take few minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please feel free to see me & we can practice together.

We'll all learn how to see what's slow and how to make it fast!

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

We all know that men are from Mars and Women are from Venus but does that apply to the species living in New York City???!!!  Why do things seem so different here??!!  Join us for this fun and interactive night where we get to the bottom of what the opposite sex is thinking.  We have reserved the private lounge on the 2nd floor of The Playwright Irish Tavern in the heart of midtown for this fun and informative evening.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way it is going to be a great  night out.

Here is how it works..

-Arrive between 6:30-7:30pm for socializing, mixing and mingling.  During that time you will anonymously fill out your most compelling questions, comments and observations about the opposite sex and drop them into a hat.

-When we have filled the hat our moderator will sit everyone down and read off the questions that will be directed to the opposite sex.  Participants are invited to answer, debate, add to and explain with hopefully useful information  for the opposite sex.

This has been an awesome night for us in the past and usually very informative when it comes to finding out what the opposite sex is thinking about dating, relationships, sex, etiquette, behavior, professional advice and more.

Can I come alone? Yes 99% of those attending will come on their own

Dress code: Business casual

How many and what ages?  60-80 people mostly 20's-40's

How do I pay?  Please bring exact change $5 when you arrive If there does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you want to know exact numbers or have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
This meetup is sponsored by Bloomberg, who will also be recruiting at the event. Don't forget to bring a resume!


Event agenda:

6:30 - 7:00 PM: Networking & Food 
7:00 - 7:15 PM: Short talk
7:15 - 8:30 PM: Keynote talk by Pierre Gutierrez 
8:30 - 9:00 PM: Socializing

Short talk: Music Recommendations at Spotify by Vidhya Murali

Main talk abstract:

Pierre will speak about what happens leading up to a Kaggle competition and how to translate a business need into a machine learning problem. Although one can learn a lot from a data science competition, data scientists need to be able to solve all aspects of a problem. Armed with his experience with Kaggle competitions and as a data scientist at Dataiku, Pierre will talk about topics like creating a target variable, choosing the right metric to optimize and how to correctly evaluate a machine learning model.

Bio:

Pierre Gutierrez is a senior Data Scientist at Dataiku (www.dataiku.com). He has experience in several topics such as fraud detection, predictive maintenance, recommender systems, smart cities and churn prediction. Pierre likes to apply Data Science tools to real world problems. Dataiku edits Data Science Studio (DSS), a collaborative development platform for data professionals. The product integrates standard data and machine learning tools and technologies, allowing users to build their own data-driven projects.
results.how_to_find_us: Mention us at security and they will instruct you where to go. The room number is 44-02.
results.name: Before Kaggle: from a business goal to a machine learning problem

results.description:
In this workshop, Lisa Eisenberg, Esq., an experienced immigration attorney working primarily with technology startups, will discuss various visa and green card options for foreign startup founders. 

We will discuss the lesser-known option of O-1 visa, and Lisa will share her experience in successfully obtaining this coveted visa for entrepreneurs in technology and other fields, as well as for software developers, web designers, UX designers and other tech professionals. 

We will also talk about best practices in filing H-1B petitions for entrepreneurs and shareholders, L-1 and E visas, and other visas for startup founders. In the end, we will cover President Obama’s executive actions aimed to benefit foreign-owned startups and their founders, including the proposed “significant public benefit” parole program for entrepreneurs.

Please send $15 to [masked] via Paypal by Sep 23rd, or $20 the same day.

About Lisa Eisenberg:

Lisa Eisenberg, Esq., the principal of Eisenberg Law Firm PLLC, has been practicing business immigration law for almost 10 years. Most of her clients are foreign tech entrepreneurs seeking to enter the U.S. market and tech startups hiring foreign specialists. Entrepreneurs often have a difficult time getting a work visa in the U.S. because our country does not offer a “startup visa” or any other option well-suited for startup founders. This prevents many founders from legally working in the U.S., effectively managing their businesses, or obtaining funding. 

Lisa has the expertise to utilize existing work visas for the unique needs of tech startup founders and early-stage companies in technology and other fields. Whether you’re an entrepreneur seeking to operate a business here, a U.S.-based company that would like to employ foreign talent, or a professional who wants to work in the United States, Lisa can help you obtain the legal status you need.
results.name: Visas For Founders by Lisa Eisenberg, Esq.

results.description:
Green New Yorkers Meetup is happy to share this NYC Climate Week event sponsored by the Sallan Foundation

http://www.sallan.org/events/archives/2015/09/015752.php#.VdsMUpdKL2R


</a> The Brain Trust of Benchmarking  Building Energy Benchmarking: Acting On the Results

Climate Week NYC 2015 is the ideal time for this panel discussion. The evening's presenters represent the Brain Trust of Benchmarking, so don’t miss:

• Laurie Kerr - Urban Green Council
• Constantine Kontakosta - NYU - Center for Urban Science and Progress
• Cliff Majersik - Institute for Market Transformation 
• Jeff Perlman - Bright Power and event moderator 
• Stuart Brodsky - NYU - Schack Institute of Real Estate

New York City's landmark Local Law 84, the Building Energy Benchmarking mandate, ought to be a power tool for helping to realize <a href="http://nypassivehouse.org/new-york-passive-house-mayor-one-city/">Mayor de Blasio’s goal of cutting our carbon footprint 80% by 2050 and its supporters have had a shared expectation that the disclosure of benchmarking data would quickly elevate debates about improving energy efficiency and turn attention to “low hanging fruit” opportunities with cost effective returns. Are these high hopes being fulfilled? The Benchmarking Brain Trust will tackle this question along with its policy and practical implications.

RSVP at eventbrite
results.name: Climate Week: NYC Building Energy Benchmarking: Acting On the Results

results.description:
Free beer/drinks, candy, selfie-sticks + win an Asus Zenwatch Android Smartwatch!

RSVP NOW at http://www.NYCSQL.com/events/225122166/

A Database Month event: http://www.DatabaseMonth.com/database/sql-acid

Robbie Mihalyi, Vice President of Engineering, Clustrix

In this session, we will discuss various SQL scale-up/out strategies along with their trade offs.

We will explore how to set up SQL RDBMS architecture that scales out and is both elastic and consistent, while simultaneously delivering fault tolerance and ACID compliance.

We will also cover how data gets distributed in this architecture, how the query processor works, how rebalancing happens and other architectural elements. Examples cited will include cloud deployments and e-commerce use-cases.

The key take-aways are:

• Five RDBMS scaling strategies along with their trade offs

• The importance of having no single point of failure for OLTP (fault tolerance)

• The vagaries of the cloud and how it impacts using an RDBMS in the cloud

Robbie Mihalyi, Vice President of Engineering, Clustrix

Robbie leads the Clustrix development and QA teams; he has over 25 years of technology leadership and operational experience at startups and large organizations. He has led both database product development teams and SaaS application development teams.

Prior to Clustrix, Robbie was the founder and CTO of Thynkster. Robbie has also worked in vice president roles at marketing software companies Marketo and MarketLive. At both companies, he implemented Agile processes and practices, significantly improving concept-to-market deployment.

In addition, Robbie served 10 years as the key engineer on the database engine at Sybase, later becoming the director of SQL server. Later, he led the performance effort for the RDBMS system, posting record-breaking benchmarks and leading the scalability re-architecture of the core database engine.

RSVP Now at: http://www.NYCSQL.com/events/225122166/

Swag giveaway + food/drinks at 6:30pm 
Power-Networking at 6:35pm 
Presentation starts at 6:40pm

You can save children from homelessness through the Techie Youth program! 
Please learn how you can save the life of a child athttp://www.TechieYouth.org 
(saving child's life is very easy!)

RSVP: http://www.NYCSQL.com/events/225122166/

New York City's landmark Local Law 84, the Building Energy Benchmarking mandate, ought to be a power tool for helping to realize Mayor de Blasio’s goal of cutting our carbon footprint 80% by 2050 and its supporters have had a shared expectation that the disclosure of benchmarking data would quickly elevate debates about improving energy efficiency and turn attention to “low hanging fruit” opportunities with cost effective returns. Are these high hopes being fulfilled? The Benchmarking Brain Trust will tackle this question along with its policy and practical implications.

RSVP here to be notified once registration is open

Working with our community, you will learn in depth knowledge of how real estate investing strategies work and you will also develop yourself to be a successful real estate entrepreneur.

At this meeting we talk about the biggest money making opportunities (Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Buy & Holds, Seller Financed Notes + Tax Liens/Deeds, Multi-Family/Commercial and Money Lending) for a Real Estate Investor in today’s market. You will get to learn about new investors that are investing in real estate and making $10,000-$100,000+ per real estate transaction, we will also talk about how you can make $1,000-$10,000 commissions helping our community grow and you will learn working strategies from professional and practicing Real Estate Investors on how to create wealth through real estate investing.. results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

We all know that men are from Mars and Women are from Venus but does that apply to the species living in New York City???!!!  Why do things seem so different here??!!  Join us for this fun and interactive night where we get to the bottom of what the opposite sex is thinking.  We have reserved the private lounge on the 2nd floor of The Playwright Irish Tavern in the heart of midtown for this fun and informative evening.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way it is going to be a great  night out.

Here is how it works..

-Arrive between 6:30-7:30pm for socializing, mixing and mingling.  During that time you will anonymously fill out your most compelling questions, comments and observations about the opposite sex and drop them into a hat.

-When we have filled the hat our moderator will sit everyone down and read off the questions that will be directed to the opposite sex.  Participants are invited to answer, debate, add to and explain with hopefully useful information  for the opposite sex.

This has been an awesome night for us in the past and usually very informative when it comes to finding out what the opposite sex is thinking about dating, relationships, sex, etiquette, behavior, professional advice and more.

Can I come alone? Yes 99% of those attending will come on their own

Dress code: Business casual

How many and what ages?  60-80 people mostly 20's-40's

How do I pay?  Please bring exact change $5 when you arrive If there does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you want to know exact numbers or have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: The Differences Between Men and Women Great Debate and Happy Hour

results.description:
The Beginner Buddhist Book Circle is for anyone interested in or new to Buddhism. In this biweekly series, we’ll explore classic introductory Buddhist books. Although we have “reading assignments”, the meetings focus more on basic Buddhist teachings rather than strict discussions of the books. Our meetings are casual and informal; all levels of interest and experience are welcome. When possible, we’ll have copies of the current book available at no cost. Meetings occur on the second Wednesday and fourth Thursday of the month unless otherwise noted. Please see the Meetup page and calendar for the full schedule.

*** Right Now We’re Reading: “The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings" by Thich Nhat Hanh***

In "The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings", renowned Vietnamese Buddhist monk, teacher, poet, and peace activist Thich Nhat Hanh (Thay) presents the essentials of Buddhist teachings in a clear, compassionate, and concise manner. In addition to covering teachings at the core of all Buddhist traditions, Thay also covers many key Mahayana Buddhist teachings. In all discussions, Thay helps guide us to the heart of what the Buddha taught; the transformation of suffering into peace, joy, and liberation.

First released in 1999, "The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings" has become a classic and essential read for anyone interested in learning more about basic Buddhist teachings. The book is widely available in bookstores and libraries in print, ebook form, and audio book form.


For the Sept. 24th meeting, please read Chapter 1 (3 pages).

Discussion points include:

-What's the "starting point" for Buddhism?


-Who (or what) was the Buddha?


-What lessons can we learn from suffering?


***

Happy reading and we hope to see you soon!
results.name: Beginner Buddhist Book Circle

results.description:
Free beer/drinks, candy, selfie-sticks + win an Asus Zenwatch Android Smartwatch!

RSVP NOW at http://www.NYCSQL.com/events/225122166/

A Database Month event: http://www.DatabaseMonth.com/database/sql-acid

Robbie Mihalyi, Vice President of Engineering, Clustrix

In this session, we will discuss various SQL scale-up/out strategies along with their trade offs.

We will explore how to set up SQL RDBMS architecture that scales out and is both elastic and consistent, while simultaneously delivering fault tolerance and ACID compliance.

We will also cover how data gets distributed in this architecture, how the query processor works, how rebalancing happens and other architectural elements. Examples cited will include cloud deployments and e-commerce use-cases.

The key take-aways are:

• Five RDBMS scaling strategies along with their trade offs

• The importance of having no single point of failure for OLTP (fault tolerance)

• The vagaries of the cloud and how it impacts using an RDBMS in the cloud

Robbie Mihalyi, Vice President of Engineering, Clustrix

Robbie leads the Clustrix development and QA teams; he has over 25 years of technology leadership and operational experience at startups and large organizations. He has led both database product development teams and SaaS application development teams.

Prior to Clustrix, Robbie was the founder and CTO of Thynkster. Robbie has also worked in vice president roles at marketing software companies Marketo and MarketLive. At both companies, he implemented Agile processes and practices, significantly improving concept-to-market deployment.

In addition, Robbie served 10 years as the key engineer on the database engine at Sybase, later becoming the director of SQL server. Later, he led the performance effort for the RDBMS system, posting record-breaking benchmarks and leading the scalability re-architecture of the core database engine.

RSVP Now at: http://www.NYCSQL.com/events/225122166/

Swag giveaway + food/drinks at 6:30pm 
Power-Networking at 6:35pm 
Presentation starts at 6:40pm

You can save children from homelessness through the Techie Youth program! 
Please learn how you can save the life of a child athttp://www.TechieYouth.org 
(saving child's life is very easy!)

RSVP: http://www.NYCSQL.com/events/225122166/
results.name: Database Architecture & Scaling Strategies, in the Cloud & on the Rack

results.description:
Andrew and Forest will talk about how the Financial Modeling Group at BlackRock leverages Apache Spark to explore and better understand the financial and economic behaviors of debtors through data. Several use-cases will highlight how we use Spark and D3 to visualize a large loan-level mortgage dataset, extract distributions and cluster boundaries in order to draw meaningful insight. They will also talk about their use of K-Means clustering to reveal similar borrower groups and corresponding discriminant attributes. They will also talk about how they used several sbt plugins to streamline the building, deploying and running of Spark analyses. 

The Speakers

Andrew Rothstein, Managing Director, is a member of BlackRock Solutions' Financial Modeling Group currently leading the Advanced Data Analytics team. Mr. Rothstein's primary responsibilities include managing a team of quantitative analysts and software engineers practicing data science in the pursuit of higher quality more predictive residential mortgage prepayment and credit models. Prior to focusing on mortgage modeling he has held many positions within the various teams that comprise the Financial Modeling Group. Since starting at BlackRock as an analyst in 2001, he has made significant contributions to BlackRock's core fixed income risk management platform in a variety of areas including software infrastructure, inflation risk modeling, and corporate credit risk modeling. 

 Forest Fang, Analyst, joined the Financial Modeling Group (FMG) within BlackRock Solutions in 2013. He was a founding member of the Advanced Data Analytics team within the FMG. His primary area of focus is in solving BlackRock’s clients’ large scale data science problems. He has developed many big data analysis and visualization tools. He is passionate about the underlying computing challenges inherent to visualization of large datasets. Prior to joining BlackRock Forest earned a Bachelor of Arts degree from Cornell University double majoring in Mathematics and Computer Science.

**IMPORTANT TRAVEL INFO**

As you may be aware, Pope Francis will be holding a prayer service at St. Patrick’s Cathedral this Thursday evening. 

+ The prayer service will take place at 6:45 PM at St. Patrick’s Cathedral.  Prior to the event, the Pope will be transported from 72nd and 5th Avenue to St. Patrick’s. This procession will result in full closures of 5th Avenue and closures to all cross-streets between 47th and 55th Street. 

+ The 5th Avenue closures will be implemented for vehicles and pedestrians and restrict crossing 5th Avenue (from 47th to 55th) between approximately 6PM and 830PM.  

+ Although the MTA plans to maintain normal service, there could be local subway entrance and exit closures and delays to mass transit in the area.

+ Recommend approaching our facility from the East and to allowing extra time to commute.
results.how_to_find_us: Please go up the escalators as soon as you enter the building and present you ID at the BlackRock reception.
results.name: Apache Spark in Financial Modeling @BlackRock

results.description:
This month we'll be focusing on fundamentals. 

NodeSchool gives you a chance to work on interactive programming workshops with mentors available in case you get stuck or have any questions.  This event is recommended for engineers with JavaScript experience but no Node.js experience is required. We're supporting several workshops to allow for all experience levels.



More info:http://nodeschool.io/nyc



Bring: An ID to show security and your laptop 

Prepare: 

Install Node.js before arriving. We'll certainly be available to help get Node.js installed if you're having issues, but coming prepared will mean more time for coding!


Workshops:

For this NodeSchool, you will have 5 workshops to choose from

Core: 

- Basics of JavaScript (javascripting)

- Basics of Node.js (learn-you-node)

- Streaming Interfaces (stream-adventure)

Electives:

- Functional JavaScript (functional-javascript)

- Basics of ES6 (count-to-6)

You can check the lesson plans out here: http://nodeschool.io


We'll be focusing on the workshops mentioned above, but attendees are welcome to try any of the workshops available on nodeschool.io



Agenda:

6:30 - 7:00: Mingle, drinks (including beer!), and pizza.

7:00 - 8:30: Get cracking on the NodeSchool workshops 

8:30 - 9:00: Wrap-up

Facilitator:

Andrew Ingraham will facilitate the event. 

Mentors:

- Andrew Ingraham - Facilitator

- Gautam Arora - Host

- Evelyn Leathe Straigt - Mentor  

- Cristina Colón - Mentor

- Will Blankenshi­p - Mentor

- Divy Tolia - Mentor

- Henry Zhu - Mentor

+ You! Let us know if you want to volunteer as a mentor !!!

Host:

Condé Nast is generously offering space, food and drinks. 

Condé Nast is a premier media company renowned for producing the highest quality content for the world’s most influential audiences. Attracting 115 million consumers across its industry-leading print, digital, and video brands, the company’s portfolio includes some of the most iconic titles in media: Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Brides, Self, GQ, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler, Details, Allure, Architectural Digest, Bon Appétit, Epicurious, Wired, W, Golf Digest, Golf World, Teen Vogue, Ars Technica, and Style.com. Built While Flying is Condé Nast’s digital team who is dedicated to growing our already rapidly expanding digital consumer base. 

= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = 

NY JavaScript expects all speakers and attendees to follow the JSConf Code of Conduct.

Due to limited seating, RSVPs for our events are $3-15. There are no refunds or transfers. Proceeds go to ScriptEd, a charity to increase code literacy among NYC youth at under-resourced schools.

If you would like to sponsor or speak at one of our events, please email us at [masked].

results.description:
The money and the deals usually happen in "Phase 2" (investor vibes with idea, meetings happen, checks get cut). The problem is, nobody ever gets a chance to get to that phase because their "phase 1" is terrible. Phase 1 is your pitch. Unless you have a great product already making waves of traction, you will have to communicate what it is your building to people, and why its worth their time and money. So we are solving that problem. Our first workshop is:

The Art Of The Pitch (2 sessions)

1st session you will learn:

- Formula for a high concept pitch
- How to craft an effective elevator pitch
- How to create a pitch deck for investors

2nd session you will: (October 1st)

- How to present
- Demo and critique of your pitch/deck

Hosted by Anthony Frasier

Panel judges

Dimitris Kouvaros VC at Newark Venture Partners


CEO at Gadget Gadget Software, Investor

What you learn from these 2 sessions you can use to teach other entrepreneurs in our community, and even can be used for business outside of tech. RSVP today for $30, space is super limited.

results.description:
Wanderful Chicago has chosen All God’s Children Need Traveling Shoes by Maya Angelou to be Wanderful’s August/September travel book club book. Learn more about our travel book club here.

We will meet at Ninth Ward to discuss this great tale of exploration and enjoy 2 for 1 happy hour drinks. Feel free to join even if you have not read the book. We hope to see you there! 

This is the description of the book from Amazon:

In 1962 the poet, musician, and performer Maya Angelou claimed another piece of her identity by moving to Ghana, joining a community of “Revolutionist Returnees” inspired by the promise of pan-Africanism. All God’s Children Need Walking Shoes is her lyrical and acutely perceptive exploration of what it means to be an African American on the mother continent, where color no longer matters but where American-ness keeps asserting itself in ways both puzzling and heartbreaking. As it builds on the personal narrative of I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings and Gather Together in My Name, this book confirms Maya Angelou’s stature as one of the most gifted autobiographers of our time.

Ninth Ward is a preferred partner of Wanderful's membership program! Click here to register for a pro Wanderful membership and receive a free drink with any food purchase at Ninth Ward, plus many other discounts and deals worldwide:www.sheswanderful.com/join

Creative Plates + A Soothing Cityscape = The Perfect Social Dining Experience.

The Pop-Up:

The summer might be coming to an end, but we are taking the excitement into fall! Back by popular demand, is our unforgettable open-air popup dining experience that will fulfil your appetites on a gastronomical and visual level.

Komeeda and 29. Private Kitchen collaborate to bring you a multi-course modern Indian-inspired all-inclusive picnic dinner. With good company and the sun setting over two iconic bridges that illuminate the NYC skyline, this experience will be the very essence of Brooklyn.

Date: Thursday. September 24, 2015 | Rain Date: Monday, September 28, 2015

Time: 6:30 PM – 9:00 PM

Location: DUMBO, location will be disclosed 48 Hours prior to event only to those with confirmed tickets

Standard RSVP: $67

PURCHASE YOUR TICKET AT DUTB3.PEATIX.COM

Seats Available: 16 (BYOB/F[Flask})

http://peatix.com.new.s3.amazonaws.com/event/108048/IMG_6946.JPG

The 29. Menu

Chef Shuchi Naidoo will put together an exclusive menu the week before the #DUTB pop up using freshly picked ingredients & seasonal produce from her local farmer's market. The menu is vegetable forward, with some chicken & fish.Unfortunately, no dietary restrictions can be accommodated for this meal.

(For reference only)

First.

Roasted Cauliflower + Cumin + Grapes

Second.

Fifth.

Tomato Rice + Spiced Yogurt + Ground Chicken

Sixth. [Dessert]

Carrot Halwa + Burnt Sugar Caramel + Coconut Flakes

The Chef:

Shuchi Naidoo, a banker turned chef, is the face behind the recipe blog, 29. Calories, and the 29. Private Kitchen. Her kitchen creates social dining experiences around prix-fixe tasting menus that are centred around small plates & tapas. Uniquely inspired by the unexposed genre of home-style Indian cuisine, she has given ‘curry’ a pretty significant facelift. With numerous supperclubs, intimate private events and underground pop-up dinners under her belt, Shuchi and the 29. Private Kitchen has received praise from many of those who have dined with her, including accolades on CNN travel, NBCs Today Show, CBS News, BBC Travel & the Wall Street Journal.

results.description:
Since we were kids, we were taught that working hard and finding a good paying job was the way to happiness, success and security.

NOT ANYMORE! If you think the times have changed, you’re right!

Surprising Facts About Today’s America:

-36% of American workers have less than $1,000 saved for retirement

-9 of the top 10 occupations pay less than $35,000 a year in wages

-Inflation rose 12.4% for middle class households from 2007-2013. Healthcare alone rose by 42.1% during this time.

-More than 3 in 5 Americans don’t have enough in savings to cover a $500 repair bill.

-Americans are being taxed into oblivion with a documented 97 different taxes they are required to pay.

-Could This Be Your Ticket Out?

Why not see for yourself? We will reveal the difference between the OLD rules of money and the NEW rules of money. Here is a quick comparison:

OLD Money NEW Money

*Work hard for money *Make money work hard for you

*Save your money *Invest your money

*A house is an asset *A house is a liabilty

*Invest in traditional *Invest in financial

education education

*Buy things to feel rich *Buy positive cash flow assets

*Word hard *Work smart

*Become financially *Become financially

secure free

Don't put this off! Make plans to attend this potentially life-changing event. Will another year bring you closer to your financial goals or will you just be another year older? Don't let this opportunity slip through your fingers.

Some of the Topics That You Will Learn:

• Ways to create new streams of income and cash flow beyond a traditional job

• Strategies to rescue your retirement and finish rich using real estate

• Tactics to get started with little "out of pocket" expense

• The fundamental shift from an employee-based mindset

• And much more!

If nothing changes, nothing changes. We understand how difficult it is to get started. But you have the power to take positive steps to gain control of your financial future. Take the first step by deciding to attend. It's that simple. Just RSVP to register.

Show Up to Get Fired Up! We want you to get "fired up" about your financial future! It's essential that you come with an open mind and are willing to question some of the traditional rules you've been taught since childhood. Today's information age functions by a new set of rules. The winners in today's economy understand and operate by the new money beliefs.

RSVP NOW to learn the new rules of money and the wealth creation power of real estate.

PRESENTERS 

Click HERE to sign up for the live stream of this event, provided thank to Shindig

TRIBUTE

A “Tribute” is a video montage of friends, family and loved ones (a “Tribe”) that come together to share their appreciation, admiration and encouragement for a person they care for. Tribute.co was created to make the act of creating and giving a Tribute easy. The platform automates the invitation, organization and editing process so users can create a professional quality video without spending a large amount of time or money.

REAL BIG HITS

Real Big Hits is a company dedicated to making ideas real. The platform has helped thousands of creatives to protect their thoughts, share their ideas and secure funding for their projects. Its parent company EmpressMAM is one of the largest recording media distributors nationwide, and to date has helped major broadcasters to make billions of dollars. Real Big Hits was founded to help creatives to achieve their dreams to make it big, and is powered by EmpressMAM's flagship product eMAM.

IRIS.TV

Iris.TV helps video publishers and networks increase consumption by turning their web and mobile video platforms into a personalized playback experience for every viewer. Their Adaptive Stream™, delivers relevant content in an interactive television-like experience, personalized to each viewer’s taste. Powerful backend tools help measure and manage video programming and performance. As a result, video publishers and content owners are able to increase video consumption, engagement, and retention.

GHOST ROBOT

Ghost Robot is a Brooklyn-based creative production company. They harness a variety of tools and creative talent to construct engaging ideas, content, and experiences across all platforms. Their home-grown stable of directors, writers, producers, animators and editors, have created award-winning films, music videos, and commercials that have been shown across the world and web. Known for an experimental flair and get-it-done approach, Ghost Robot combines creative solutions with hands-on production at a very early stage to create original, efficient, and effective work.

JOSHWA PRODUCTIONS

Joshwa Productions is a start-to-finish video production company dedicated to helping people make an impact by sharing their stories. This small and mighty team handles all aspects of production from direction, sound design and graphics to marketing. They've created a variety of video content for such clients as Warner Music Group, Variety, Keller Williams, Universal Music Group and more.

results.description:
ANNIE JACOBSEN, author of Area 51 and Operation Paperclip, for a discussion of her latest book, The Pentagon's Brain: An Uncensored History of DARPA, America's Top-Secret Military Research Agency.

No one has ever written the history of the Defense Department's most secret, most powerful, and most controversial military science R&D agency. In the first-ever history about the organization, New York Times bestselling author Annie Jacobsen draws on inside sources, exclusive interviews, private documents, and declassified memos to paint a picture of DARPA, or "the Pentagon's brain," from its Cold War inception in 1958 to the present.

This is the book on DARPA--a compelling narrative about this clandestine intersection of science and the American military and the often frightening results.

"Filled with the intrigue and high stakes of a spy novel, Jacobsen's history of DARPA is as much a fascinating testament to human ingenuity as it is a paean to endless industrial warfare and the bureaucracy of the military-industrial complex."—Kirkus Reviews

"A fascinating and unsettling portrait of the secretive U.S. government agency....Jacobsen walks a fine line in telling the story of the agency and its innovations without coming across as a cheerleader or a critic, or letting the narrative devolve into a salacious tell-all. Jacobsen's ability to objectively tell the story of DARPA, not to mention its murky past, is truly remarkable, making for a terrifically well-crafted treatise on the agency most Americans know next to nothing about." —Publishers Weekly


http://stores.barnesandnoble.com/author/4856966
results.name: Author Event "The Pentagon's Brain: Uncensored History of DARPA" Annie Jacobsen

results.description:
Developing with IoT Platforms: Kinoma, Mediatek Presenting


Learn about IoT Development from industry leaders Kinoma and Mediatek who will be presenting their IoT development platforms. If you are interested in creating connected devices, don't miss this event! The Internet of Things has the promise to be immensely disruptive across many industry sectors and requires a hugely diverse set of disciplines and skill sets. This event is a great way to experience IoT first hand!

Register here for a chance to win free IoT Hardware!


We would like to thank our sponsors for this event Kinoma, MediaTek Labs, and Atmel Corporation.

Kinoma's hardware and software prototyping solutions help developers, programmers, and designers rapidly create connected products. Kinoma's solutions are open source, open sensor, and open cloud. Take product ideas from drawing board, to prototype, through to mass production with Kinoma's devices and JavaScript application framework. Kinoma is an integrated design and engineering team residing at global semiconductor leader Marvell.

MediaTek Labs is dedicated to bringing top-notch developer kit solutions for IoT & Wearable applications. Compatible with Arduino, LinkIt ONE features all-in-one connectivity including GSM/GPRS, WiFi, Bluetooth, GPS on a single board. Say goodbye to shields. MediaTek Labs also helps developers gain access to prototyping and manufacturing services via its Partner Connect Program. Register now to win free hardware.  

Register here for a chance to win free Mediatek Hardware!

We thank Atmel an ongoing sponsor of IoT Central | NYC.

We also thank Work Better for hosting this event.

9:00pm   End of Event

Regardless of who you are or what you do, being able to communicate in a public setting is a necessary skill to have. People need to be able to express themselves effectively in order to succeed in school, in the workplace, and in life. This is an introductory seminar to public speaking, which addresses the importance of effective oral communication. It will teach participants the basics techniques to make a speech vibrant, informative, and memorable.

Experienced Speakers Patricia John & Akintade "Tony" Aboaba from Toastmasters International will be guiding the seminar. Their focus will be on the essentials: body language, attire, how to prepare, what NOT to have in your pockets, and much more. Hope you can join us for this very informative session!

results.description:
About the Meetup:

Digital Product Teams have discovered the value of Agile and Lean approaches. Working collaboratively, in small batches, and focusing on outcomes, these teams have found new ways to deliver value for their organizations. 

At the same time, many teams that are adopting these methods—or trying to—are running into organizational hurdles. This is because most organizations are set up in ways that are deeply anti-Agile. Most leaders and project teams think the digital revolution is simply the evolution of the IT department; they believe that business management can proceed without changing. 

This is not true. As this technology becomes embedded in literally every phase and process of our businesses, we need new organizational structures and management practices capable of leveraging these new capabilities. 

Come hear Josh Seiden share what the manager of today needs to know to work successfully with digital teams and create the environment in which they can succeed.


About the Speaker:

Josh Seiden is a principal at Neo, a full-stack innovation consulting firm that helps organizations incubate and scale impactful new product and business ideas. He is a designer and author who has been creating great technology products for more than 20 years - working in hardware and software, on consumer- and enterprise-based products, and in mobile, web, and desktop systems. At Neo, he co-leads the user-experience design practice, and specializes in working with clients in complex domains, especially financial services.

Prior to joining Neo, he co-founded Proof, the influential Lean UX consulting firm that Neo acquired in 2012. Earlier, he was head of product design at Wall Street innovator Liquidnet, and lead pioneering interaction design teams at Cooper. He is a founder and past President of the Interaction Design Association. He is the co-author (with Jeff Gothelf) of “Lean UX: Applying Lean Principles to Improve User Experience.”
results.name: Sense and Respond, a Manager’s Guide to Agility

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！

Trance Night – An Evening of Music, Trance and Dance for Evolutionary Change

September's Trance Night will be held on Thursday, September 24th at The Alchemical Theatre Laboratory
104 W 14th St
New York, NY 10011

 September's Trance Night will be virtually content free as we use trance dance to celebrate the turning of the seasons to the Fall and turn off our judgements of good enough and trust our unconscious mind and follow our bodies to move however they want to move.

You will learn about the power of Neo-Ericksonian Hypnosis because you'll experience it first hand.


Thursday evening, September 24th

The Alchemical Theatre Laboratory
104 W 14th St
New York, NY 10011

7:00pm – 9:00pm

* NOTE – Please arrive EARLY. Consider this a sacred space. Arriving late will disturb the process.

CLICK HERE - ONLY $22 (via PayPal)

Trance Night – As in previous trance nights, the trance induction while lying on the floor will be recorded so attendees can download it later on.

Doug O'Brien
Certified Master Practitioner and Trainer of Neuro-Linguistic Programming; Ericksonian Hypnotherapist
­http://www.dougobrienhypnosis.com
http://www.ericksonian.com

As a Hypnotherapist, Doug helped found the Department of Complementary Medicine at Columbia Presbyterian Hospital in the mid-nineties, under Dr. Mehmet Oz. Doug worked directly with pre-operative and post-operative patients on stress management and pain reduction as well as long term behavioral change to generate healthy living.

Doug O'Brien, is an NLP Master Trainer - originally given that designation by Anthony Robbins over 20 years ago - and is called a modern Shaman by some. He is also a musician and composer and a Trance Master Guide.

He is the guy who gave Tony Robbins an insight that completely changed Tony's approach to his second book (it was going to be called "The Niagara Syndrome" and became, instead, "Awaken the Giant Within")

Doug is the guy who has been the success coach to two of the top internet marketers in the country as well as corporate executives, top musical artists, fashion designers and professional athletes.

He has helped literally tens of thousands of people quit smoking in one session.
He has helped similar numbers lose weight and keep it off through the power of Hypnosis.

He can help YOU, too.

Endorsements/Testimonials
“I have attended all three of Doug’s Trance Night sessions. Each experience has been extremely powerful with noticeable results and the impact has lasted. I am definitely looking forward to attending the future Trance Nights.”
  – Jackie

"Best Meet-up ever.”
  – Kate

“Your Trance Night was a wonderful respite from the world. It was like a vacation from all of the stresses of every day life, a vacation for my soul. It continues to ripple though me today. So glad I came.”

  – Marshall

Doug O'Brien, is an NLP Master Trainer - originally given that designation by Anthony Robbins over 20 years ago - and is called a modern Shaman by some. He is also a musician and composer and a Trance Master Guide.

Doug is the guy who has been the success coach to two of the top internet marketers in the country as well as corporate executives, top musical artists, fashion designers and professional athletes.

He has helped literally tens of thousands of people quit smoking in one session.

He can help YOU, too.

results.description:
We're expanding our open hours. Bring your project, come hang, pick the brain of Charles Hamilton of HudsonWerks...

About HudsonWerks

HudsonWerks LLC is a New York City-based DIY hardware & new product development (NPD) shop.

Working with some of the world’s leading electronics and technology brands — Microsoft, Epson, AT&T, SAP — HudsonWerks owner Charles Hamilton has helped research, design, build and test wearable bio-sensing prototypes, advanced platforms for mobile content delivery using voice recognition, ultra energy-efficient tablets for specialized industries, devices on board the International Space Station (ISS), and communication tools for the elderly population.


His current projects include writing a book for Packt Publishers (UK), SEVENTY-FIVE RECIPES FOR THE BEAGLEBONE BLACK, due to be released this Fall 2015.
