results.description:
Hi, everyone! If you have been feeling anxious or stressed lately and want to talk about ways to beat anxiety, this meetup is for you!  It starts at 6:45pm and will last an hour and 15 minutes.

First, we will get together in a social but semi-structured way.  There will be soda and light snacks.  We'll spend the first 15-20 minutes just saying hello and meeting each other for the first time, welcoming any latecomers, etc.

Next, I'll lead a group discussion.  Topics will include talking about the difficulties of coping with anxiety, common experiences among group members, and tools including mindfulness techniques to help manage anxiety. Of course, members can also bring up their own questions and topics- I am just there to organize our time and provide a little structure!

We will conclude with an open "mingle time" for everyone to follow up on things said in group discussion, talk 1-1 with anyone who seems to have similar issues, helpful ideas, etc. and then we'll wrap up the meetup!

I'm looking forward to meeting new members and greeting familiar faces!  If you can't come because of scheduling, please let us  know what days/times are best for you so we can plan more convenient times in the future.

The most important part of this meet up is the 1-1 connection you can make with others!  The group starts with an open format where we connect over  snacks and soda, followed by a group discussion, and then a "mingle" time for  everyone to connect 1-1 and build on the group discussion or talk about whatever feels most helpful for you! Disclaimer: This is NOT a psychotherapy group!!
results.name: NY Anxiety Thursday Night Meetup!

results.description:
New York Tarot Tarotology is a class devoted to the study of the pictorial language of the Tarot. Have you ever wondered "What do the cards mean?" Or, "Why does every book you've looked at say the cards mean something else?" This class will answer both those questions. 

The on-going classes, will feature Tarot Symbolism, the Esoteric Titles assigned to each card in the Tarot as well as what each title means, Astrology and the Tarot, Qabalah and the Tarot, which includes a study of the Tree of Life,  Alchemy and the Tarot, as well as the History of the Tarot. 

All levels are welcome, even if this is your very first class.

There will be a Meet-Up sign on the table.

You will have time to get a little something to eat and socialize in order to unwind from their day, before the class begins, but I would like to start the class as soon as possible and might run a little over to enable people to have their questions answered. We need to be able to practice reading also and I want to be sure to get that in. Bring your questions and we'll all share what we see in the cards. I will arrive at 6:00 PM. 

Payment can be made in class.
results.how_to_find_us: Panera is near the corner of 33rd Street & 5th Ave. Closest subway is the F at 34th Street. Walk one block to 5th Ave. Turn right & walk down one block to 33rd. Street. We will be in the Cafe downstairs.
results.name: Welcome All Tarot Enthusiasts

results.description:
On September 24th, ArtsTech will host a discussion on matters of copyright and the short and long-term implications for digital artists. It's an issue that has and will continue to work its way into art world affairs (i.e. Richard Prince's New Portraits show at Gagosian consisting of "Instagram paintings"), especially with the advent of digital platforms and new technologies. Kevin McCoy, art technologist and CEO of Monograph, will be moderating the panel. Panelists are two foremost art lawyers Judith Prowda and Franklin Boyd and artist Sean Fader, whose work was re-appropriated by Richard Prince. Here's some of the questions that will be addressed: 


• Is there a successful model of selling digital artwork online that protects artists that exists? If so, what does this look like? If not, what might this look like?

• As an artist, what precautionary steps can be taken to avoid situations of reappropriation?

• How do international laws work for or against artists? Are there countries with stronger protections for artists than others?


Drinks and snacks will be provided.

Schedule:

7:00 pm – Doors open

7:30-8:45pm – Panel discussion followed by a Q&A session

8:45-9:30 pm – Conversation continues

Speakers:


Kevin McCoy, an artist and NYU professor. In 2014 he created Monegraph, an on-line platform for media licensing and attribution.He is the company’s co-founder and Artist/CEO. Working for more than twenty years at the intersection of art and technology, his artwork is in the permanent collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Museum of Modern Art and the Whitney Museum.

Judith Prowda: Judith Prowda is an attorney, mediator and arbitrator focused on art law, copyright, entertainment and commercial law. She is also a senior faculty member of the Art Business Program at Sotheby's Institute of Art, where she teaches graduate courses in Art Law and Ethics and advises Masters Thesis students. Author of Visual Arts and the Law: A Handbook for Professionals (Lund Humphries 2013) and numerous other publications, Judith is a leader in the intellectual property field, and has consulted at Sokolow, Dunaud, Mercadier & Carreras in Paris and at the World Intellectual Property Organization in Geneva. She is Past Chair of the Entertainment, Arts and Sports Law Section of the New York State Bar Association, and is Chair of the Section’s Committee on Fine Arts and Co-Founder and Co-Chair of the Committee on Alternative Dispute Resolution. In addition, she is a member of the Art Law Committee of the New York City Bar Association and has served on the Copyright and Literary Property and Entertainment Law Committees.  

Franklin Boyd: An arts attorney with a general commercial practice, Franklin Boyd is also the founder of Xipsy, home of the Negotiated Resale Right for Artists. She teaches art finance, market and law courses at the Sotheby’s Institute of Art and has served on the  boards of Art in General, Zer01 and SmartSpaces. Franklin began her legal career at Cravath, Swaine & Moore LLP, after having worked in the General Counsel’s office of the Metropolitan Museum of Art and for the State Attorney General of New York.

Sean Fader: Sean Fader received his MFA from the School of the Art Institute of Chicago, his MA from the Maryland Institute College of Art in Baltimore, and his BFA from the New School in New York City. His work has been exhibited throughout the United States and internationally in Dubai, Canada, Mexico and England. Fader was named a NYFA Fellow in 2013 and A Blade of Grass Fellow for[masked], and he received Magenta Foundation’s Flash Forward Award for Emerging Photographers in 2012. Recent exhibitions include Share This! Appropriation After Cynicism at Denny Gallery, New Portraits organized by Richard Prince at Gagosian Gallery, #wishingpelt, performed at Defibrillator Gallery in Chicago (2013), Spring Break Art Show and Pulse Art Fair in New York City (2014), White Boys curated by Hank Willis Thomas and Natasha L. Logan at Haverford College (2013), and Sup?, a solo exhibition at the University of Illinois in Springfield (2014). He has received press coverage in MOMUS, Hyperallergic, Art F City, the Huffington Post, and Slate.com.  Sean was a recent resident at Yaddo and will be attending Bemis Center for the Arts Residency this coming winter.
results.name: Art Copyright: Confines in a Digital Space

results.description:
In The Mirror of Death: An Introduction to the Tibetan Buddhist Understanding of Death and Dying

This 8-week course guides participants through the essential teachings on dying and death from the Buddhist tradition of Tibet. It offers a glimpse of this practical wisdom and sacred inspiration, which is so beneficial for today’s world. The universal message of these teachings speaks to people from all walks of life and is relevant for those of any spiritual tradition or none. They show us how we can face uncertainty and change, transform difficulty and fear, prepare for death and support others to die with dignity.

The course is open to everyone. However, registration is limited to 15 people.

Some books you may find helpful for the course:

The Tibetan Book of Living and Dying by Sogyal Rinpoche

Facing Death and Finding Hope by Christine Longaker

Eight Thursday evenings: September 24 – November 19 (no class on October 22)

7:00PM – 9:00PM

Course Fee:$125.00

Please register at

https://crm.usa.rigpa.org/civicrm/event/register?reset=1&id=149
results.name: In The Mirror of Death (8 week course @ Rigpa)

results.description:
CHECK IT OUT FOR ONLY 5 BUCKS!


Welcome To The Writer’s Room


More than just a writing class, our TV Drama workshop gives you the experience of a real writer’s room on a 1 hour TV Drama series, with a teacher with over 15 years of television experience acting as showrunner, and a class of 12 talented student staff writers.

You’ll not only complete an hour-long pilot or spec script for a TV Drama series of your choice, you’ll also collaborate on the development of your fellow students scripts for a different show each week..

What You’ll Learn

You’ll learn the elements of a successful TV Drama series, and how to write a series pilot or series spec script that shows off your talent as a writer, but also your ability to demonstrate your professionalism to every network, studio, and series producer who reads it.

By the time you’re done, you’ll not only have real world experience of working in a TV writer’s room, you’ll also a community of writers you can depend on, and a draft of a professional grade spec script or pilot episode for your own Television Series.

One-On-One Mentorship From A Teacher You Can Trust

In addition to your work in class, you’ll get a one-on-one consultation with your showrunner and teacher, Steve Molton, to discuss the unique challenges of your script and the goals for your career.

What About The Online Option?

You can be a part of our TV Writing Classes from anywhere in the world, through a live two way video stream! All you need is a computer, a headset, and a high speed internet connection. You’ll be able to see, hear and participate in everything, just like being in the room!

For more info or to set up a plan, give us a call at[masked]-3594.


---

NORMAL COST: $899

MEETUP MEMBERS:  Check out the first day of this  10-week workshop for only $5 bucks with no obligation!

Class Size is Strictly Limited To 12 Students To Allow All Students The Opportunity to Workshop And Receive Feedback On Their Writing. 

You MUST RSVP to attend this event.

You'll LOVE this workshop or your money back!
results.how_to_find_us: www.writeyourscreenplay.com
results.name: The Television Drama Workshop

results.description:
Interested in out-of-body experiences and psychic experiences? Your welcome to join us at one of free public seminars!

Have you ever had a vivid flying dream? How about the sensation of floating while falling asleep or meditating? How about the perception of “dropping” back into your body just before waking up? If so it may be possible that you have experienced what is called an out-of-body experience. It has sometimes been known in various spiritual traditions and schools of thought in history, as “astral projection” or “soul travel”.

Despite being considered by many to be a strange or obscure topic, the experience has been reported for thousands of years by people all over the world, often mixed up with dreams. Throughout history people have reported “otherworldly” journeys and spiritual experiences into other dimensions in a variety of settings - during spiritual practices (i.e meditation, prayer, etc), near-death, during sleep or spontaneously during the day. What is interesting is that unbeknownst to most of the public, is that the out-of-body experience is a powerful tool for self-transformation, self-discovery and wellness and can be willfully induced, developed, controlled and utilized to greatly benefit yourself and others. The experience is much like the altered states of consciousness that shamans and medicine men in history used to connect with the psychic world, obtain knowledge, heal others, etc.

This short seminar is offered freely to the public and will provide you with cutting edge information on out-of-body experiences (i.e. astral projection, soul travel, etc), subtle energy, non-physical dimensions and related topics. Cutting through misconceptions and misinformation about the topic, you will learn about the latest research on these experiences, including their benefits (see below) and – unbeknownst to most of us – how they already affect our daily life yet have huge implications about who you are and your life purpose.
Some of the benefits of the out-of-body experience are:

• Understanding non-physical dimensions or realities
• Direct contact with spirit guides
• Development of psychic abilities
• Losing the fear of death
• Getting information about your life purpose
• Using OBEs as a tool to assist or heal others
• Psychic awareness and protection
• Development of universalism and fraternity

In addition to these benefits, these additional fascinating topics will be discussed at the lecture:

• Our multidimensional nature
• How the OBE experience (i.e astral projection, etc) works
• How an OBE is experienced first hand
• Astral projection tips, benefits & utilities
• How to use the OBE to discover our life purpose
• Psychic abilities related to the OBE
• Our multiple subtle bodies and their function
• What current research tells us about the OBE
• Overview of easy out-of-body experience techniques
• Non physical dimensions
• What happens psychically at night
• Information about IAC’s OBE and psychic training programs
• Answers to questions you have about these topics or your experiences

Is this lecture right for you?

This lecture is packed with fascinating information and is interesting to both those new to the topic, or those already quite knowledgeable about it. Whether you’re just curious about the topic, want to ask about an experience you had, or what to go deeper, this lecture is for you. It is well suited for anyone planning on further study but still looking for a rational, integrated overview of these frequently misunderstood topics.

If you are interested in IAC’s other programs, note that this free lecture is an ideal (although optional) starting point for people interested in taking IAC’s other courses. It allows would-be students to make a personal connection with our instructors and team, obtaining confidence in our knowledge, approach, and framework. This lecture also introduces our organization, and gives an overview of our curriculum, programs, and publications. Hence it is a great opportunity to ask an instructor about IAC's main OBE training course, the award-winning Consciousness Development Program (CDP), which we offer regularly in New York.

Who teaches this free lecture? 

It is taught by one of IAC’s senior faculty members, depending on who’s available. IAC’s faculty members have years of experience and training in spirituality and consciousness studies, including out-of-body experiences and psychic phenomena. IAC is an educational and research centered organization in the area of consciousness studies, human potential and psychic development, and has offices in over 12 countries worldwide.

How do I attend?

Confirm via meetup that you're attending or email us to register at newyork (-at-) iacworld.org

results.name: Free Seminar on Out-of-Body Experiences and Consciousness Studies

results.description:
Derek Khanna of Lincoln Labs recently wrote a fabulous white paper on the United State's progress with the economy. We're fortunate to have Derek join us as he'll discuss details of the paper and a Q/A session. You can checkout Derek's paper here.

Further Description

The United States economy is barely growing. The engine of economic growth, entrepreneurship, and new firm creation, has been declining for the past three decades. Today, we are the lobbyists for the future, advocating on behalf of start-ups that don't exist yet. We can grow the economy through unleashing the full forces of innovation across the economy. Here's how to foster permissionless innovation.

For as long as we can remember, technologists have thrown a Heisman (or perhaps another one-finger hand gesture) to the government. We get it. Government is clunky and slow and boring. It’s where good ideas go to die. But here’s the thing: government isn’t going away. Public policy matters, and it matters a hell of a lot to innovators and entrepreneurs whose ideas are changing the world.

Lincoln Labs is the connecting hub for these two worlds. We think better communication will lead to more liberty-minded laws and regulations, a more efficient government and a freer society, which in turn makes it easier for innovators to innovate. So what exactly do we mean by liberty? Liberty means freedom, individuality, self-sufficiency. It means creativity, free will and latitude. Translation: it means government being less of a roadblock.
results.name: Pushing for economic growth in the future

results.description:
China Hands NYC is having another meetup! Come join us!

China Hands are invited to meetup at WeWork Charging Bull on the 10th floor, in New York City's financial district, at 7pm on Thursday September 24th. 

Kevin Slaten, Program Coordinator at China Labor Watch, will be the guest speaker of the night. He is a respected Researcher and Rights Advocate with nearly a decade of experience around international relations, Sino-U.S. relations, Chinese civil society and rights defense, and Chinese politics. 

https://youtu.be/KQUJOXPhMYk

Kevin's talk is entitled, "Is Chinese Labor Abuse Inevitable?". Chinese workers' human rights and legally enshrined labor rights have been broadly and persistently violated for most of the post Opening era. While capitalism's thirst for profit is undoubtedly driving labor abuse, what factors in China have allowed deep deprivation of working people to continue for more than two generations? Did China's development and governance models make labor abuse inevitable? And will anything change for China's next generation of workers?

We'll be providing good beers, drinks, and snacks, and we're thankful for your $10 meetup contribution towards the costs of staging New York's best China Hand networking community. 

Due to strict building security, PLEASE RSVP before the event to have your name placed on the guest list. Security will not grant access to names not listed on the guest list. 

China Hands NYC is grateful for the support of our foundation sponsors:
Allegravita
Strategic Communications and Public Relations 
Allegravita is an award-winning, multi-disciplinary public relations and strategic communications agency focused on the China region.


China Luxury Advisors 
China Luxury Advisors counsels luxury brands and retailers on their China consumer strategy, ranging from market entry to digital to attracting, converting, and retaining affluent Chinese customers worldwide. Thanks also to our generous venue sponsor...

WeWork

results.description:
We're back to sci-fi in September, and I've selected a book that's been on my to-read pile forever: Ammonite by Nicola Griffith, winner of both the Lambda Literary Award for LGBT fiction and the James Tiptree, Jr. Award for SF dealing with issues of gender. NOTE: if you'd like to select a book for a future meeting, please email me!


Here's the blurb: "Change or die. These are the only options available on the planet Jeep. Centuries earlier, a deadly virus shattered the original colony, killing the men and forever altering the few surviving women. Now, generations after the colony has lost touch with the rest of humanity, a company arrives to exploit Jeep–and its forces find themselves fighting for their lives. Terrified of spreading the virus, the company abandons its employees, leaving them afraid and isolated from the natives. In the face of this crisis, anthropologist Marghe Taishan arrives to test a new vaccine. As she risks death to uncover the women’s biological secret, she finds that she, too, is changing–and realizes that not only has she found a home on Jeep, but that she alone carries the seeds of its destruction..." 

Let's meet to discuss this book at the wonderful Cafe Madeline in Ditmas Park on Sept. 24. Hope to see you there!

results.description:
The Sound Mind gathering explores the vibrational and sound healing for personal meditation, soul expansion, as well as physical well-being. 

When we learn to use our breath and voice for toning, chanting, and psychosomatic actualization, we become powerful healers. The gifts we were born to share come to fruition if we but dare to explore, expand, AND express our vibrational state. You can tune your Soul-Body to higher dimensions and progress your visionary abilities following the scale of sound and color - starting where you are and who you are at the present moment and then climbing up.

The starting point is like looking at a hiking map with a little red circle that says 'you are here' and all the possible trails ahead and then you take off - transcendence path is a process that is anchored in the body. No matter how natural and sacred, there is no vine, shroom, or chemical that will take you to the next level of spiritual consciousness. You can change your state and catch a glimpse of your transcendent vision, yes, right here within your Soul-Body.

Sound Mind is about a durable and steady progress into who you were meant to become in this amazing moment of opportunity that we call a human life. It goes fast, so why not …make a sound?
results.name: Sound Mind - Heal Your Life with Sounding, Toning, and Chanting

results.description:
Squarespace offers a website and ecommerce platform that powers a growing slice of the internet. The company has over 500 employees across three cities and internal data that gives a window into the complexity of the web at large.


The Speakers:


Join Andrew Bartholomew and Brad Willard to hear how Squarespace aligns strategy, infrastructure and tools to serve insights across a quickly growing company. You'll get a view into the stack that the analytics, data science, and data engineering teams rely on, and Brad will walk through ways machine learning has helped shape how Squarespace views its customers.

Brad works on the Data Science team, applying customer data to create processes/algorithms to make Squarespace better for its users. Previously he worked on social TV recommendation and algorithm scaling for the thundering herd in the cloud. He has also designed and implemented one of the largest multimodal biometric search engines used in commercial and defense applications around the world.

Andrew leads strategy at Squarespace, overseeing teams focusing on business strategy, customer insights, analytics and data science. He previously worked on data-driven prosecution initiatives at the Manhattan District Attorney's office.

----

Update

Please make sure you arrive on time. We have overbooked this event and we will have to let people in on a first-come, first-serve basis!

----

For additional news and announcements...

results.description:
Greetings Heroes! 

eSports Hero and Nebulous Gaming NYC have officially partnered in hopes that together we can provide the gamers of New York City with a strong community and a new place to call home. Located in Manhattan's Lower East Side, we are going to turn the 2,500+ square foot private venue into the hub for all gaming and eSports events on the East Coast.

With that said, bring out your laptop, phone, or tablet every Thursday, and join us for an evening of food, friends, and Hearthstone as we celebrate the re-launch of Nebulous Gaming NYC and our Weekly Fireside Program.

---

These Hearthstone Fireside Tournaments are to be hosted weekly in a completely private venue. Similar to how Magic the Gathering has coined "Friday Night Magic", we want to make "Thursday Night Firesides" something that will  always be available to you guys. We are taking the traditional Fireside format up a notch and you can expect that every week there will be at least one of the following taking place: (1) Deckbuilding Competition, (2) Challenge Stone Tournament, (3) Double Team Tournament (2v2), (4) Conquest Tournament.

As an official part of the Blizzard FSG program we will also do our very best to provide our Hearthstone community with Card Packs, and anything Swag Blizzard passes on to us.

$6 is the Grand Opening Price Discount and the cover will be collected at the door. Once you pay, feel free to stay as late as your heart desires (or at least until close which is usually around midnight). There are cool funky bodegas right around nebs where you can grab snacks / sandwiches throughout the night.

Nebulous Gaming NYC: 

https://www.facebook.com/NebulousGaming

---

The new Nebulous Venue is beautiful and very chill. The WiFi is blazing fast and there are power outlets for everyone. There will be Pizza, board games, Digital Darts, and snacks / beverages available for purchase on site. 

*Pro Gamers / VIPs will be in attendance. *

Pre-Register via meetup. 150 Person Capacity.

---

Leadership Opportunities:

We need someone that is passionate about Hearthstone and is willing to help spearhead this weekly Fireside as a Community Leader. If you are interested in helping us run events in NYC, please reach out. Forward your resume to [masked]

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.name: Happiness and "The Secret"  7-9pm at Barnes & Noble in White Plains

group.name: The Happiness and Goodness Club - White Plains

results.description: Kirtan is a form of devotional chanting whose roots go back over 500 years to India. It is a form of Bhakti Yoga (yoga of devotion) and has the power to open the heart. Musical instruments and rhythmic drumming accompany the singing and the attendees are encouraged to participate by chanting, clapping and dancing. You will not be able to resist the urge to join in! In its heartfelt expression, kirtan can induce profound states of meditation, bliss and ecstasy. There is a sweet sound vibration that permeates through all layers of coverings and makes God dance. That sound vibration is Kirtan. It is a mysterious connection that draws people to each other.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for three years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!

results.description:
Please join us on Thursday evening for a 6ish mile, casual-pace loop run.

We will meet just inside the 52nd Street entrance to Windmuller Park at 7:15pm and head out for a 6ish mile loop through Woodside, Sunnyside, LIC, and Greenpoint, before returning to the start. We won't set a minimum pace requirement for this run. But, please be sure that you can comfortably run a full 6 miles without stopping before deciding to participate.

For our evening runs, we will wait up to 10 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. This can mean we will wait for 2 minutes or 10. Please be prompt. 

If there is interest after we complete our run, we may venture to a pub for snacks and/or beverages.

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:

results.name: Krav Maga Level One (NYSC)

results.description:
"Conversations with My Molester: A Journey of Faith" with a message of Healing and Renewal.


Written & Performed by Michael Mack

Tickets:  As usual, please get your tickets directly thru the show's ticket site:  http://conversationsplay.brownpapertickets.com/  or TDF.

On the eve of Pope Francis' historic visit to New York City, poet & playwright Michael Mack returns to NYC for a professional run of his "powerful" (Washington Post) and "profound" (Times Square Chronicles) one-man play CONVERSATIONS WITH MYMOLESTER: A Journey of Faith documenting his journey after an incident at age 11 with his pastor.

Mack wrestled throughout his life with haunting questions about sexuality and spirituality, imagining one day meeting his abuser for a conversation.

That day came 40 years later when he landed on his former pastor's doorstep. In this true story, Mack recounts how a childhood experience launched a 40-year search for healing - at first away from, and then back to, the Roman Catholic Church. Like Pope Francis in his historic visit, Michael Mack too comes to New York on a mission of faith, but Mack's pulpit is the stage.

His message is the reality of healing and renewal, as the play explores the cost of forgiveness and the nature of reconciliation.

http://www.michaelmacklive.com/ - Press & Reviews below:

Exquisite...heartbreaking...will truly resonate with those who know that awful place where insanity and love collide."

—National Public Radio

"Mack's breathtaking performance casts vivid poetic light on one of life's most inexpressible and commonplace sorrows."

—Minneapolis Star Tribune

"Transcendent art that reaches out with unblinking honesty."

—Boston Sunday Globe

"Moments of great warmth come through his family chronicle. It is a work of redemption."

—Philadelphia Weekly

"Redemption comes in well-defined characters and Mack's ability to flow through renditions of his mother and family members. He knows his subject well."

—Village Voice

"A work of devastating clarity that uses simple language and rich metaphor to create a powerful evocation of his and his mother's life."

—Boston Globe

"Compelling, informative....a vivid snapshot of one family's journey. This spoken word performance has at its heart the power to entertain, transport, and transform."

—Showcase Magazine

"It is art for the sake of art and memory and healing."

—Washington Post

"Mack's poetry is more than cathartic, it is remarkable."

—Baltimore Sun

"In his beautiful, compelling memoir, Mack switches seamlessly between past and present voices. Graphic, fragmented, and honest, Mack gracefully enlightens."

—Minneapolis Skyway News

"Searing metaphors.... Schizophrenia shattered his family, but Michael Mack recalls love and spirit."

—Worcester Telegram & Gazette

"An especially poignant look at the fuzzy line between illness and religious illumination. Tender, stirring, uplifting....a must see."

—The Rake (Minneapolis)

results.description:
Open to All. Thursday nights are now a potluck dinner night for the Orgasmic Meditation community here in NYC! And anyone over 18 who wants to check it out too!

If you are someone who already OMs or if you are curious and want to meet the OM community and check it out, or just meet some awesome people and enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too so don't worry about it if you can't or don't have time. It's a casual atmosphere that might include some connection games. It's a great way to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. OMing will not take place AT the event but for those trained in the art there will be a circle beforehand at the usual time. The event is free! The door will open at 7:30 sharp and we will go until about 9:30. You're welcome to come anytime in between, unlike our other events which have tighter time tables. BUT we can't guarantee there will be any food left and you might miss some fun so try to come on time! If you have any questions please contact Marissa Ward -[masked] / [masked] Can't make it to this event? check out www.turnonny.us for more.

Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

results.description:
Thursday nights are now a potluck dinner night for the Orgasmic Meditation (OM) community here in NYC! And anyone over 18 who wants to check it out too!

If you are someone who already OMs or if you are curious and want to meet the OM community and check it out, or just meet some awesome people and enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too so don't worry about it if you can't or don't have time. It's a casual atmosphere that might include some connection games. It's a great way to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. OMing will not take place AT the event but for those trained in the art there will be a circle beforehand at the usual time. The event is free! The door will open at 7:30 sharp and we will go until about 9:30. You're welcome to come anytime in between, unlike our other events which have tighter time tables. BUT we can't guarantee there will be any food left and you might miss some fun so try to come on time! If you have any questions please contact Marissa Ward -[masked] / [masked]
results.name: OM Community Potluck! Open For All!

results.description:
How To Build A Fire is a storytelling series set within the visually surprising, kinetic, and energized space of Open Source Gallery. The series is the brainchild of the poet Terence Degnan, who for a year, curated and hosted countless storytellers from all walks of life while inviting guest curators along the way to help to diversify the voices. He has passed on the curatorial and hosting duties to his friends and colleagues Kate Hill Cantrill and Dennis Norris and they intend to maintain the spontaneous mix of characters, themes, ideas, while opening up the series to include musical, visual, and other creative ways of enhancing the art of telling a story. This month, storytellers have been invited to interpret the theme "Borders and Boundaries" however they choose.


Featuring: 
Hilary Leichter 
Anna Luft 
Michael A. Youmans 
Chris McFarland
results.name: HOW TO BUILD A FIRE: Borders and Boundaries

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description: Please join us at 8:30 PM est (7:30 PM Central) every fourth Thursday evening for the Citizens Constitutional Caucus Town Hall Conference Call, fielding discussion about current political issues. Don Watson, Moderator of the Citizens Constitutional Caucus will facilitate the call which gives Constitutionalists an opportunity to review pertinent legislation and challenges to the Constitution. This call is designed for all levels of knowledge and everyone is invited to attend. So please call in and join the Conference Call.  If you get a message that the circuits are busy, just keep trying the number and it eventually works. There is no extra charge to participate other than the usual charges by your phone plan for a long distance call. You can even listen in to the conference call while at other events...just hit *6 to mute your phone and you can do two things at once! For more information please see the Citizens Constitutional Caucus web site www.citizensconstitutionalcaucus.com and Meetup group, http://www.meetup.com/Citizens-Constitutional-Caucus.
results.name: Citizens Constitutional Caucus Town Hall Conference Call

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include...


30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

This event is officially hosted by The Rise, NYC. They host morning workouts every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings. See them on meetup here:


http://www.meetup.com/The-Rise-NYC/


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Challenge with The Rise

results.description:
This morning, like every weekday morning from 7:00 AM until about 7:35AM, Heights Meditators meet at Our Savior's Atonement Lutheran Church (OSA), to practice the technique. We ask everyone to get seated in the chapel, latest, by 7:10 AM.


Heights Meditation morning sessions aim to help you to start the day firmly established on a stable platform, centered in being, clear of mind, full of quiet, good intent. If that sounds like a happier and more skillful approach to life than the one you may be currently using every morning, it probably is. Come try it out for a few weeks and see if daily meditation doesn't make a big difference to your life!
results.how_to_find_us: A or 1 Trains to 190th Street, south entrance to the church at W 189 and Bennett Avenue. Look for signs posted on the doors!
results.name: Morning Meditation for the People of Upper Manhattan and Vicinity

results.description:
Women helping women train to find their inner warrior ! Walking can do so much more for you then get you from point A to B. It's a great way to tone up and increase your fitness and health.

My passion is CrossFit and Spartan Obstacle course racing and helping people improve their health and wellness. With the support and comraderie of other women of all fitness levels , we come together to walk and add in moderate intervals of body movement workouts as we power through the beautiful scenery of Tibbets Brook Park.

Women of all fitness levels, shapes and sizes can see in a few short weeks the amazing changes in their bodies ! Let's get in a powerful walk and chat about nutrition and relieve alittle stress and make our bodies stronger !! Who knows you may want to sign up for a local mud run with me!!!

results.description:
NYC MEDIA LAB SUMMIT - SEPT 25, 2015! 

Coming September 25, NYC Media Lab's Annual Summit is a snapshot of the best thinking, projects, and talent in digital media from universities in NYC and beyond. The day will feature:

• Announcements about NYC Media Lab's new programs + demos of Lab seed projects

• Two keynotes (Ted Bailey, CEO at Dataminr and Rita Gunther McGrath, Professor at Columbia Business School)

• A lightning talk from the LinkNYC team on NYC's new first-of-its-kind media and communications network

• The release of an NYC Media Lab whitepaper on the impact of virtual reality on the media & technology industry

• 12 concurrent faculty-led workshops from NYC faculty, spanning data science, interaction design and more

• 100 demos from faculty and students in a pan-university "science fair"

Register here with code take20 to receive a Promotional Discount ticket. 

Registration is managed by the NYU Skirball Center Box Office. Using the link above you should see a "Promotional Discount" registration option.
results.name: Suggested Event: NYC Media Lab Summit

results.description:
Hello Friends!

This week we have Jim Bland (Internet of Things) come and share his journey. He is the CEO of a startup Internet of Things company and former founder and CEO of a few successful technology companies. His professional focus throughout most of his career has been on commercialization of new technology and particularly in managing disruptive IT innovations. Jim spends most of the year in Washington, DC though he finds his way to Charleston, SC, Europe and on various adventures as often as possible.


On the strictly professional side, he began his career in the US Foreign Service where he served as a commercial attaché in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. Later he worked as a consultant for William Kent International focusing on commercialization of new technologies for a variety of Fortune 500 companies.


For a number of years, Jim has lived in the Washington, DC area and focused on the start-up and development of technology based IT and healthcare businesses. Some of his ventures include development of patented devices to reduce repetitive stress injuries, applications of touchscreen technology to improve data capture in electronic medical records and creation of a web portal to facilitate the management of clinical research data. Most recently he served as CEO of a company providing connectivity and mobility solutions to a Fortune 500 client base.


We'll get a chance to hear about his experience in the Foreign Services and his  journey in tech, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you this Friday!
results.name: Founder's Friday with Jim Bland

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!

results.description:
Greenwich Village in Manhattan is a community with a global history and reputation. The quiet streets of the area have been the stage for creative and social movements that today give shape to the unique American character. The area started out as farm territory and later became an immigrant community. In the first half of the 20th century the area was inhabited by some of the greatest creative minds of American Culture. Today the area retains its cultural essence in diverse aspects and the public art and architecture contrast richly with the greater metropolitan environment of NYC.

Itinerary:
• Father Demo Square
• Bleecker Street
• Cherry Lane Theater
• Sheridan Square
• Cafe Wha?
• Washington Square Park
• New York University
• And Much More

Reservations: 
Please RSVP.If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:
Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins at father Demo Square on 6th Av. and Bleecker St. map here. Tour concludes at Washington Square Park map here.

Cost: 
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You are not charged. At the end of the tour you can put a value to the information presented in the form of a gratuity.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 4:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Attention Foodies, Conscious Beings, Magical Creators, & Spiritual Seekers!!!

Welcome To Wahlburgers Restaurant In My Hood In Coney Island By The Sea!

This is an informal gathering where you can kick back & enjoy a night out with amazing people, make new connections, & share your unique gifts with people who are just waiting to meet and greet you!

I'm so grateful I get to meet old & new friends & discuss enlightening topics like the meaning of ascension, the planetary shifts & stellar alignments, & interdimensional consciousness while eating delicious food in an awesome & friendly environment!

This Place Is WICKED AWESOME!!!

The month of September's  theme is all about showing up as a contribution on this planet & sharing what's unique & special about you in a new way in a new paradigm on the new earth!

Time to come out as the amazing avatar master being of light & love!!!! 

Bring your shining light, your divine essence, & samples of your gifts, talents, & special abilities like flyers, cards, or anything else that has your name on it...literally!

I'm here to facilitate life changing events to remind you that you're never alone. We get to contribute to each others lives as we expand our NYC Conscious Community!

At our last empowering meet-n-greet, I was so impressed with the friendly staff, the delicious burgers, sweet potato tots, & nutella fluff crepes, that I knew this place contained the magical ingredients for ongoing events & gatherings!

While I was there, I met Paul Wahlberg & Was blown away by his charming & attentive caring concern for my dining experience. Wow!!! What a nice guy!

And YES the burgers ROCK & NO it's not because the Wahlberg family own & run this establishment as someone asked me very recently!

Mark Your Calendars To Come Out On Friday, September 25th to meet up on the rooftop for drinks, appetizers,entrees, & deserts from 5-8pm. The ocean & boardwalk is right down the block for those that want to arrive early or stay late.

Here's the menu so come hungry & bring your appetite!

https://www.wahlburgersrestaurant.com/kitchen-and-bar/

Watch The Wahlbergs on the cyclone here: 

http://www.aetv.com/wahlburgers/video/brotherly-competition-at-coney-island

Please note there are other yummy choices on the menu besides burgers!!

I'm looking forward to connecting with old & new amazing friends to build our brooklyn community even bigger & brighter than we ever dreamed possible!

The view at night is spectacular from the roof top over looking luna park and the boardwalk in coney island!

Shine On Brooklyn!!!!

The address is 3015 Stillwell Avenue & West 15th Street

Take The D, F, Q, Or N Train to the last stop & cross the street and you're there!

More detailed directions can be found here: 

https://www.wahlconeyisland.com/location/

Heart Healing Hugs,

Vandana Atara Aura

results.description:
Weather: Hello Guys and Gals! Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.
Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
What do Fortune Cookies and Brooks Brothers neckties have in common?   Answer: they are both manufactured in Long Island City Queens!  I can't think of another neighborhood that has this much variety - industry, the quaint Hunters Point Historic District, and the spectacular cityscapes and views of the Manhattan skyline from the New Hunters Point South Park on the East River. Long island City is also home to Jet Blue, the Silvercup Studios where numerous feature films have been shot, a staggering number of new condominiums, MOMA Queens/PS 1, obscure museums and just some really strange looking areas (:  There's even a stretch of shops and restaurants that evoke a village atmosphere.

After a one hour guided walk, we'll  enjoy a free concert overlooking the Manhattan skyline and you can purchase food at at the park's fine cafe. - LIC Landing (link below).  BRING SOMETHING TO SIT ON IF YOU CAN AS THERE'S PLENTY OF GRASS BUT THERE MAY NOT MANY SEATS.  Link to the free concert: performance: http://www.nycgovparks.org/parks/hunters-point-south-park/events/2015/09/25/lic-landing-live

Link to the restaurant in the park:  http://www.liclanding.com/about/

After the concert we'll have the option of continuing the evening wither in Long Island City - plenty of places to enjoy a drink and socializing or perhaps we'll move to .....?

Cheers from Hank!

[masked]

Blues Jam Made Easy; work on pentatonic scales and seventh chords.

This will be a guided blues jam with room for improvement on all levels of playing.

Acoustic guitars are provided. There are a few amps for electric guitars if you bring yours.

Bass players are welcome (bring your own bass)

Ukelele players are welcome (bring your own uke)
results.name: Happy Hour Guitar Jam

venue.address_1: Middle Brook Trail, Martinsville, NJ 08836 (on Google)
venue.name: Washington Valley Park Parking lot

results.description:
Let's do a quickie ~2 hr sunset hike.   After, we can go back to my place for drinks and hot tub. Bring a bathing suit if you want the latter, BYOB if the former.  Please bring light food to share if you are so inclined.  :)

Be at the parking lot by 5:30 because the window of daylight is shrinking.  I recommend bringing a headlamp or other light so you don't trip getting back to the parking lot after the sun goes down.   Maybe we will see the waterfall this time.   :)

Invite a friend!   Rain cancels.


Info: http://www.njhiking.com/nj-hikes-washington-valley/

Parking: N[masked] W[masked]
287N to exit for Thompson Ave (think it was 13b).  north till it ends, and turn right onto Chimney Rock road. Left on Washington Valley Road. Left on Newman’s Lane. Parking is a large paved lot on the left, after you pass a bridge. The park site has directions from Rt. 22. 


The parking lot  is off of Newmans Lane.  If your GPS doesn't accept the above info, try plugging in a nearby house: 644 Newmans Lane, Bridgewater NJ.  The parking lot is right down the hill from there, adjacent to the reservoir / bridge.

Cheers,
Glenn
results.name: After work "quickie" and potluck

group.name: BLAZE >> Backpacking Gay Men of NYC

results.description:
Let's meetup for another home game! Meet up before hand for food, the bullevard or just chat about upcoming game!


For those of you who will take the PATH train, let me know which location you will be at:

1) in front of the WTC stop on the Path in NYC and (this group will take train together to game and meet up with the others at meetup spot #2 below)

2) in front of the VIP entrance at the Red Bull Arena (here we can meet and greet and off to food or Bullevard for games and entertainment) We can also meet up outside of VIP entrance to take train back home (we can decide this when we meet) :)
results.name: NYRB vs Orlando City

results.description:
What day is today? Why, it's bring the pain Friday! It is once again time for us to ... Dodge. The. Ball.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of dodgeball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game in which players on two teams throw large balls at each other while avoiding being hit themselves. That's it. And no athletic skill is necessary!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using with a few modifications: Dodgeball Rules

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be dodging and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Dodgeball for Grownups (Co-ed)

Friends,

Join us for a fun evening this coming Friday, September 25. We will first meet for a night of mingling, drinking and more @ Suite 36.

Later that night we will go to Monarch rooftop. There we will continue the party till 4am. Both venues are less than 5 minutes away. Doors for Monarch opens @ 10pm. We normally leave the first venue at 10;15pm.


Free admission for our group members at both venues.(mention Rory's List to the door person)

Many of our Meetup groups have been invited to this event. Get to meet a fun and diverse group of people.

Feel free to come solo or with your friends.

Contact us if you have further questions.

We look forward in seeing you for a fun weekend.

Cheers,

Events Organizer

Rory

results.description:
Hello lovelies, I was invited to join the roundtable discussion for #BlackGirlImages, hosted by Diva's Night Out. I would love to see all of your friendly faces in the audience. The round table discussion will feature women of color who work within the entertainment or media industry. Collectively, panelists will cover three core topics (current perceptions/roles of women in the media, evolution of the Black Female Image, and how women of color are using their creativity to reclaim and redefine their own image).

Tickets: #BlackGirlImage is a ticket only event. The hosting organization has agreed to give our members specially discounted tickets of $10. To attend, you must RSVP using the link below in advance. Please select early registration, using the coupon code: BLACKGIRLIMAGE when registering through this link:

http://www.nyblackprofessionals.org/new-products/otz11o4c8n6z0qitwiemv8aj2qpdif

For More Info on Diva's Night Out, visit:

http://www.nyblackprofessionals.org/new-page-3/

results.description:
Join 300+ professional singles after work for an evening of mixing, mingling and merriment at this upscale penthouse/rooftop mixer.

Every time we host a Meetup at the famous & elegant Hudson Terrace it sells out, so please get your ticket ASAP.  

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. GET TICKETS AT THIS LINK - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/hudsonterrace/dates/Sep-25-2015_at_0600PM

What to expect:

• Complimentary Appetizers

• Drink Specials (6-7pm)

• Ice Breakers & Prizes

• Love & Relationship Tarot Readings

• Top 40 & Hip Hop all-night

• 300+ singles (21-49) 

Admission:

*50% off limited tickets available for $20 ($40 otherwise)

*Only 20 available at this price (goes up as event gets closer)

NO tickets sold at door. MUST PREPAY HERE -https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/hudsonterrace/dates/Sep-25-2015_at_0600PM

Is this event private? Yes. The entire venue will be 100% private for our members and their guests.

Can I come alone? Yes. Most come on their own. You can come alone or bring friends, either way you'll have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99 ? 30+ groups are co-organizing so the RSVP's shown here are only a small portion of the members attending.  300+ will be in attendance like all our past events.

What do I wear? Dress to impress. No sneakers, sweats, hats. Jeans ok.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/hudsonterrace/dates/Sep-25-2015_at_0600PM
results.how_to_find_us: Party is private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided

results.description:
Come join us at the Rubin Museum for a fun happy hour social and to raise money for Haiti


About the Rubin
Drink specials 6-7pm
http://rubinmuseum.org/events/series/k2-friday-nights
Museum admission is free every Friday night from 6:00 to 10:00 p.m. during K2 Friday Nights.
During K2 Friday Nights, Café Serai becomes the K2 Lounge, offering a special pan-Asian tapas menu to accompany the evening's DJ and programs.
Happy Hour runs from 6:00–7:00 p.m. with a 2-for-1 special on all beer, wine and well drinks.

About the Haiti Fundraiser
From Chia-Ti
“I am making a call for donations for my annual service trip to Port-au-Prince, Haiti.  I am planning to go at the end of September. This will be my 6th trip to run a Community Arts and Yoga Program at Hopital Adventiste d'Haiti. I first went down to Haiti after the earthquake in July 2010, and I have returned every year since to work with hospital patients and young people in the surrounding neighborhood. The pictures below are from my trip.  We were having a lot of fun with this group tree pose!

What you can give:
A financial contribution is the best way to give. The money goes directly to pay for the young people in my programs to go to school. School in Haiti is 80% fee-based, and can range from US$100-$400 a year (costs of school fees plus uniforms, books, exam fees, etc). I go with each student and their guardian and pay at the school directly, after making sure their grades merit the support. Last year, we were able to raise enough money to send 12 children and teens to school.
Backpacks, school supplies(notebooks, pens, pencils, etc), sneakers (especially men's size 10 and above) and sandals. I also need one large suitcase and one carry-on luggage to carry these supplies.
The young people also ask me for electronics - if you have a laptop, cell phone, or iPod you have to give, you will make someone extremely happy.

How you can give: Supplies: You can bring supplies to the Rubin or coordinate with me for other options.
Financial contributions: Cash or checks will be collected at the Rubin or online through Paypal or Chase QuickPay(use [masked] as my email address). Contact me for my address if you want to mail a check. 

Your generosity is so appreciated. Together we can create the change we want to see in the world...more art, more wellness, more access to education for all.

Thank you from my full heart. Many blessings, Chia-Ti”

Chia-Ti will be at the Rubin to collect donations, to share her passion and to answer any questions about this wonderful service trip.
results.name: Free Happy Hour!!!  Fundraiser for Haiti!!!  Free Museum Admission!!!

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

results.description:
Did you know that there are 100’s of places in the city and beyond that offer free food like hot dogs, buffalo wings, mussels in white wine, popcorn, peanuts, bagels and lox, antipasto and so much more? There are so many free food options I created a Facebook Page devoted to the establishments that offer free food. 

This Friday, join me and a whole bunch of singles from multiple meetup groups as we hop from bar to bar to sample their free food offerings. I know you’re all psyched to gorge on free food and while that is possible, there’s a slight catch. You have to buy a drink first, but it’s not like it costs any more that it usually does. The 3 bars we will be visiting are as follows

Croxley Ales: 28 Ave. B btw E 2nd & 3rd Sts. 
3 different kind of boneless wings and mussels in wine with a drink purchase from 5-7p on Fridays 

Crocodile Lounge: 325 E 14th St. btw 1st & 2nd Ave 
A free personal pizza with every drink, all the time, is just about the best you can ask for in life. 

The Charleston: 174 Bedford Ave @ N 7th Street (1 stop from NYC, a 5-min ride) 
More free personal pizza pies but this place makes it better 

We'll meet outside of Croxley Ales at 6pm located at 28 Ave. B btw E 2nd & 3rd Sts. We'll hang out for 20 minutes while we bond and wait for everyone to arrive. We'll spend an hour at each establishment or for as long as it takes everyone to have a drink and some of the free food that goes with it. We'll stay at the last place because it's the best with the best pizza with the cheapest drinks in the coolest neighborhood with the most beautiful people you ever saw in your life after us of course. =)  

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 

Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook­ | Twitter­
results.name: Free Food Singles Bar Crawl - Age 21 to 49

results.description:
Did you know that there are 100’s of places in the city and beyond that offer free food like hot dogs, buffalo wings, mussels in white wine, popcorn, peanuts, bagels and lox, antipasto and so much more? There are so many free food options I created a Facebook Page devoted to the establishments that offer free food. 

This Friday, join me and a whole bunch of singles from multiple meetup groups as we hop from bar to bar to sample their free food offerings. I know you’re all psyched to gorge on free food and while that is possible, there’s a slight catch. You have to buy a drink first, but it’s not like it costs any more that it usually does. The 3 bars we will be visiting are as follows

Croxley Ales: 28 Ave. B btw E 2nd & 3rd Sts. 
3 different kind of boneless wings and mussels in wine with a drink purchase from 5-7p on Fridays 

Crocodile Lounge: 325 E 14th St. btw 1st & 2nd Ave 
A free personal pizza with every drink, all the time, is just about the best you can ask for in life. 

The Charleston: 174 Bedford Ave @ N 7th Street (1 stop from NYC, a 5-min ride) 
More free personal pizza pies but this place makes it better 

We'll meet outside of Croxley Ales at 6pm located at 28 Ave. B btw E 2nd & 3rd Sts. We'll hang out for 20 minutes while we bond and wait for everyone to arrive. We'll spend an hour at each establishment or for as long as it takes everyone to have a drink and some of the free food that goes with it. We'll stay at the last place because it's the best with the best pizza with the cheapest drinks in the coolest neighborhood with the most beautiful people you ever saw in your life after us of course. =)  

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer

Email: [masked]

Meet-Up Event at Pilsner Haus*


Bonjour, Buongiorno, Hola, Ni hao, Al salaam a'alaykum!

We look forward to seeing everyone next Friday, September 25th at 6:00p.m for Learn Language Hoboken’s Monthly Meetup.  As we "Leap into Fall", this will be our first Meet-Up hosted at the fun and friendly Pilsner Haus.

This event is for ITALIAN, SPANISH, FRENCH , ARABIC AND CHINESE Language Enthusiasts, and is open to all levels! Come out and practice your language skills. The more the merrier, so feel free to invite anyone, this is an open event and we'd be happy to have your guests join us.

Look for our banner and anyone wearing a Learn Language Hoboken tee-shirt, hat or logo.  If a nice day, we will be outside in the patio area.  If rainy or cold, we will be in the room off the patio!


Looking forward to seeing you there!

Please RSVP on our group page. http://www.meetup.com/Hoboken-Language-Exchange/
