Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Ticket to Ride and Settlers of Catan are among the oldest) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

Note, we will be sharing a hotel bathroom key, so please do not return it to the bar until the evening is over.

Please feel free to email me with any questions that you may have.

Steven

results.description:
ABOUT THE RUBIN 

Museum admission is free every Friday night from 6-10 during K2 Friday Nights. Cafe Serai become the K2 Lounge, offering a special pan-Asian tapas menu to accompany the evening's DJ and programs. http://rubinmuseum.org/events/series/k2-friday-nights

Happy Hour runs from 6-7 pm, with a 2-for-1 special on all beer, wine, and well drinks

ABOUT THE FUNDRAISER

I want to take this time to make a call for donations for my annual service trip to Port-au-Prince, Haiti. This will be my 6th trip to run a Community Arts and Yoga Program at Hopital Adventiste d'Haiti. I first went down to Haiti after the earthquake in July 2010, and I have returned every year since to work with hospital patients and young people in the surrounding neighborhood.  


What you can give:

A financial contribution is the best way to give. The money goes directly to pay for the young people in my programs to go to school. School in Haiti is 80% fee-based, and can range from US$100-$400 a year (costs of school fees plus uniforms, books, exam fees, etc). I go with each student and their guardian and pay at the school directly, after making sure their grades merit the support. Last year, we were able to raise enough money to send 12 children and teens to school. 

Backpacks, school supplies (notebooks, pens, pencils, etc), sneakers (especially men's size 10 and above) and sandals.  I also need one large suitcase and one carry-on luggage to carry these supplies.  

The young people also ask me for electronics - if you have a laptop, cell phone, or iPod you have to give, you will make someone extremely happy. 

How you can give: Supplies: You can bring supplies to the Rubin or coordinate with me for other options.
Financial contributions: Online through Paypal or Chase QuickPay (use [masked] as my email address), check or cash. Contact me for my address if you want to mail a check.

I take donations up until the day I leave (<a>Sept 27</a>).

Your generosity is so appreciated. Together we can create the change we want to see in the world...more art, more wellness, more access to education for all.

Thank you from my full heart.  

Blessings, Chia-Ti


Chia-Ti Chiu * www.onelovewellness.com

Special thanks to Harry Gruber of the New York Brainiacs Meetup Group for having this brilliant event idea and co-hosting the event!  Check them out: http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/

results.name: Rubin Musuem Happy Hour & Fundraising for Haitian School Kids

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
Speed Dating - Ages 45 to 59  (Sold Out For Women)
When: Friday, September 25th 2015
6:30 PM - 8:30 PM (Check-in at 6:20)
Where: Pranna Lounge - 79 Madison Ave.

GET TICKETS AT: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speed-dating-nyc.html

THIS EVENT IS NOW SOLD OUT FOR WOMEN. MEN CAN STILL SIGN UP.(If you're a woman that would like to sign up, you can join the waiting list for the event by sending an email to [masked] with the subject "Waiting List - September 25". Just put your name in the body of the email. If any spots open up for women, we will email you as soon as they do. If we do not email you back, that means that no spots opened up for women).

PRICE: $34  (Must Pre-Pay Online. No Tickets Sold At Event Door)
(We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because once we fill up for a certain gender we will list event as sold out for that gender. Sign up now to secure your spot).

The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup.

EVENT DETAILS:
Speed dating is so much fun and a great way to meet quality, single professionals in the busy city of NYC. Most people know within a few minutes if they would like to see someone again. We may be biased but we definitely think this is a much better way to meet people than online dating or at a random bar.

You will go on between 8 and 15 mini dates each lasting between 3 and 6 minutes each (we lengthen or shorten the date time according to how many people attend). Women stay seated and the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman.

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

FAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

results.description:
Vision of the Rainforest ~ A Visit of Amazon Artists & Live Painting


We invite you to join two prominent Peruvian artists Alfredo Zagaceta and Moises Llerena as they showcase dozens of their Amazonian shamanic visionary artworks and demonstrate their painting techniques and creative process. As children Alfredo and Moises were taught and trained by the legendary visionary artist Pablo Amaringo. It will be a rare opportunity to see these stunning original paintings in person and in 3D. Come meet the artists, listen to their stories, and have a live painting class with them!


Please bring your own drawing pads to record your visions. This will be a very lovely creative and spiritual experience. There will also be live music performed by renowned Columbian musician ARKAWA. Original paintings, prints, and CDs will be for sale; light snacks and refreshment will be served. 


WHEN:   Friday, Sept ​25​, 6:30 - ​9:00 ​PM 

WHERE:  "Art Oasis" - 80 Bowery, Suite 302, New York, NY 10013  (half block north of Canal Street, nearby subways: 6, B, D, N, Q, R, J, Z)

Suggested donation:  $15 ~ $20


Please RSVP  to me if you would like to join us, space is limited. Looking forward to seeing you!!


Warmest, 

​Wen-Chi "Little Owl"

Cell: <a>[masked]</a>


*******************************************************

​Curator:  Wen-Chi  www.wenchiart.com

Event host:  Maggie Law  www.artoasis.center

Alfredo Zagaceta:  www.zagaceta.com

Moises Llerena:  www.moisesllerena.ch

ARKAWA:   www.youtube.com/user/ARKAWAMUSIC76

https://myspace.com/arkawa

Speed Dating - Ages 45 to 59  (Sold Out For Women)
When: Friday, September 25th 2015
6:30 PM - 8:30 PM (Check-in at 6:20)
Where: Pranna Lounge - 79 Madison Ave.

GET TICKETS AT: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speed-dating-nyc.html

THIS EVENT IS NOW SOLD OUT FOR WOMEN. MEN CAN STILL SIGN UP.(If you're a woman that would like to sign up, you can join the waiting list for the event by sending an email to [masked] with the subject "Waiting List - September 25". Just put your name in the body of the email. If any spots open up for women, we will email you as soon as they do. If we do not email you back, that means that no spots opened up for women).

PRICE: $34  (Must Pre-Pay Online. No Tickets Sold At Event Door)
(We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because once we fill up for a certain gender we will list event as sold out for that gender. Sign up now to secure your spot).

The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup.

EVENT DETAILS:
Speed dating is so much fun and a great way to meet quality, single professionals in the busy city of NYC. Most people know within a few minutes if they would like to see someone again. We may be biased but we definitely think this is a much better way to meet people than online dating or at a random bar.

You will go on between 8 and 15 mini dates each lasting between 3 and 6 minutes each (we lengthen or shorten the date time according to how many people attend). Women stay seated and the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman.

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

FAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

CAN I PAY AT THE EVENT DOOR?
We do no accept payment at the event door. You must pre-pay online.

WHEN WILL I GET MY MATCHES EMAILED TO ME?
We will email you matches within 48 hours after the event.

IS THERE A REFUND POLICY?
If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer refunds if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up.

results.description:
After the very successful first meetup organized, there is no reason not to do it again...and again! This event is now recurring every fourth Friday of every month, so mark your calendars, ladies! Please see "upcoming meetups" section for the exact dates. 

How to join:

Mark yourself as attending, and if you wish, inbox me your personal info (phone and email) so it is easier to coordinate. 

Going forward, we are expelling all the members who RSVP-ed but did not make it to our events without cancelling 24h in advance. We apologize, but we have to ensure high quality  standards for our upcoming meetups by restricting the meetups to 15 people maximum.


Where the event will be held: 

The exact location is only visible to the members of this group and may change every time a new meetup is organized based on recommendations. Please see "location details" to find out where this meetup will be held. 

You can bring a +1 or +2, no need to ask me beforehand. The more, the merrier! 

I am looking forward to meeting all of you!  

Cindy
results.name: After Hour Drinks!

venue.name: Rubin Museum of Art - K2 Lounge / Cafe Serai

results.description:
Bodhisattvas (Buddhists and like/opened minded compassionate friends) are now everywhere yet still hard to find.  So come join us and get connected with other bodhisattvas from the New York Metro area.  Every Friday we meet other compassionate friends at the Rubin Museum Cafe in a relaxed and easy going atmosphere.

Bodhi Lounge is a social/entrepreneurial meetup for Buddhists, or anyone interested in meeting Buddhists and learning about Buddhism. That said, people of any faith or practice—or no spiritual practice—are all welcome!  Let's all get along and learn from each other. So let's meet and have a cheerful time making new friends and/or helping each other grow our friendships or businesses!

So why are we always at the Rubin Museum Cafe and not check out other locations?  Rubin Museum is a Himalayan museum, which means mostly Buddhist art.  Thus we like this museum!  Also, by being at one location all the time, people now can just show up if their schedule opens up.  There, that easy!

This is a joint social between Body Lounge and Dharma Drink.  We are always at one location; ask the museum staff for the Dharma Drink group.  If the first staff does not know, ask another.

See you soon!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask the museum staff for the Buddhist social group!
results.name: Weekly Social with Bodhisattva (Buddhist) Friends @ Rubin Museum Cafe

results.description:
We are inviting you to join our Workshop Program. Socialize and learn at one meetup!

Building Awareness is one of the first marketing steps you should take as an artist. Your prospective buyers, curators, admirers should be able to find you. 

There is no second chance to make the first impression. If you don't have a budget to pay to a PR-agency, you should learn how to do simple things by yourself and how to do it wisely. It's not that complicated.

At this workshop you will understand the difference among major social media networks and get the idea how to start your own *artist entity* account. 

Based on your previous feedback, we will also discuss the content aspect.

You are welcome to bring your notebooks or gadgets to show and share your existing social media accounts and to learn how to improve your online presence. 

The investment: $20.00

Paper, pens, water, light snack will be offered at the workshop.

Find out more about our workshop program: http://www.reartiste.com/workshops/
results.name: Workshop: How to Successfully Market Yourself in Social Media

results.description:
Developed more than 100 years ago to be a haven of suburban living just minutes from Manhattan, Victorian Flatbush maintains that special atmosphere today — right in the heart of Brooklyn. Lets stroll the streets of this spectacular neighborhood, and marvel at the homes.

We will meet in front of Coffee Mob by the Newkirk train station. This is the route we will follow:

Down Marlborough until we hit Albemarle. We will stay on Albemarle until we hit Stafford. Then we will circle back to Cortelyou.

Once on Cortelyou we will grab a bite at one of the restaurants along that strip, and afterwards perhaps, check out a bar or two.
results.name: Twilight Victorian Flatbush House Walking Tour + Explore Ditmas Park

      Please forward and share this announcement with your friends!

Welcome Fall 4

East Coast Swing Dance Instruction  6:30pm Registration (optional)

Meet 'n Greet  7:15pm

Friday Dance Party & Social  8:00pm to Midnight 
*

The Place to be seen!

Over 175 attended our Last Dance!

The Manor - Dôme Nightclub

click venue name above for directions

111 Prospect Avenue, West Orange, NJ 07052 
( bordered by Eagle Rock Reservation to the east )

Essex County

*

East Coast Swing Dance Instruction

Registration 6:30pm -- Instruction 7:00pm to 8:00pm  

Meet 30 dancers at the instruction, a great icebreaker as you rotate partiners! Mix with 120 more new faces at the Dance and Social.

No partner needed. Tonight's class is for Beginner and Intermediate level dancers.  Accomplished dancers are always welcome to polish their skills and to meet new faces

*

Meet 'n Greet  7:15pm
Come Mix and Mingle; our Party Hostess will introduce you to new friends.

*

Friday Dance Party & Social

8:00pm to Midnight.

 "Mix, Mingle and Dance" in The Dôme Nightclub. PBSN's DJ will be spinning the hottest dance tracks of yesterday and today all night long! Come meet new dancers! Singles and Couples; all are welcome, median age 55. Introduce your friends to PBSN tonight in an elegant and sophisticated yet relaxed atmosphere.

*

Come choose your food pleasure from the all new Late Night menu available to 10pm. Premium wines available by the glass ... Cash bar.

*

Dress to Impress:
The Manor requests business casual attire, jackets are preferred.
No jeans, no sneakers, no shorts, no t-shirts.

 *

Guests, Friends, and Walk-ins are always welcome.
Membership is not required.

The Dôme, originally designed for but never integrated into the White House during the Benjamin Harrison administration [masked]), was adapted for The Manor and added to the West Orange landmark in 1975. 

Experience the grandeur of the Spiral Stairway and newly completed Two Story foyer on your way up to the Dome Nightclub.

 *

www.PBSNinfo.com

  QUESTIONS: Call Ralph  [masked]

results.description:
RSVP Only if you are 100% sure

We have never been this place before, let's go :)

The reason I want to check out this place because it Has almost 5 stars reviews on yelp. with over 100 reviews,

http://www.yelp.com/biz/21-shanghai-house-new-york-4?utm_source=ishare


We are going to eat Family Style, No exception! please read details below. 

CASH Only No exception! ( make organizer Job easier! Do not show up with credit card please!) 

• Serious RSVP only. Do not RSVP if you're not certain. 

• "NO-SHOW" or Last day RSVP change Will NOT be tolerated.

• There will be a $3.00 meetup fee and will be added to your bill.

• We are going to eat Family Style, I will order assort dishes for everyone. We will split the final bill of food. Every individual is responsible to pay their own drinks.

• Cash Only. Very important!!! Makes everyone's life easier...

•  Most restaurant only keep reservation for 15 minutes, so if you are late for more than 15 minutes,The restaurant might take the seat away ( I will do my best to keep it for you , but if restaurant insist there is nothing I can do about it )  so try to be on time please. Thank You. 

• Do not RSVP if you do not agree to all points above.


The Cost of Food without Drink should be around $25-$33 per person (could been more or less ) , No including Drinks
results.name: Friday Dinner: Yelp Top rated restaurant series  : 21 Shanghai House

results.description:
Click below to purchase tickets to this event: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/nyac-walks-street-art-galleries-in-the-lower-east-side-happy-hour-edition-tickets-18680386539

Discover how the chaos of the Lower East Side has shaped—and continues to shape— the destiny of the art world, in the eyes of neighborhood expert and artist Rich Garr. 


See and learn who and what inspired today’s fascinating mix of outdoor art, whether it’s a scrawled graffiti tag, a paste-up, or a full scale mural.

Besides the latest street art and graffiti pieces, the tour will stop into fine art galleries along the way, comparing and contrasting street art with art on gallery walls.

Come early to get a drink at the start of the tour, and stay after for a parting pint to round out this "happy hour" tour!


No tour is ever the same.
results.name: NYAC Walks: Street Art & Galleries in the Lower East Side, Happy Hour Edition

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

Watch the sun set over NY Harbor and the Historic Hudson River as you sip on refreshing cocktails, meet dozens of new friends, check out 3 awesome river bars and learn a little history along the way!   This event is designed for only our members, friends and partner groups, this is NOT a tour for tourists!   If you have never been to NY Harbor at sunset sign up today!  It is truly a special experience as the lights of NY and NJ light up the surrounding waters.

Here is how it works:

Registration is from 6-6:45 at The Battery Gardens Cafe on NY Harbor's outdoor bar. At 7pm we will walk north along the promenade to the  new Pier A Harbor House Beer Hall for more cocktails and socializing. At 8pm we will again walk north to our destination Merchants River House Cafe in Battery Park City.

Along the way you will learn the history of lower Manhattan, New Amsterdam, Governors Island, Liberty Island & Statue, Battery Park, Ellis island, NY Harbor, The Hudson River and More!

Can I come alone? YES 98% of those attending will come on their own.

What should I wear? Most come from work so business casual.

Do I have to drink and eat? no

Is food available? yes all 3 locations have great food!

What if it rains?  We will watch the weather closely and send out updates that day.

How do I  pay?  Please bring exact change.  $15

Can I just meet the group at the final stop and hang with you guys?  NO that defeats the purpose of the evening (yes, if you still want to pay the $15!~)

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Hudson River/NY Harbor History Tour and Riverside Bar Review

Here is how it works:

Registration is from 6-6:45 at The Battery Gardens Cafe on NY Harbor's outdoor bar. At 7pm we will walk north along the promenade to the  new Pier A Harbor House Beer Hall for more cocktails and socializing. At 8pm we will again walk north to our destination Merchants River House Cafe in Battery Park City.

Can I come alone? YES 98% of those attending will come on their own.

What should I wear? Most come from work so business casual.

Do I have to drink and eat? no

Is food available? yes all 3 locations have great food!

What if it rains?  We will watch the weather closely and send out updates that day.

How do I  pay?  Please bring exact change.  $15

Can I just meet the group at the final stop and hang with you guys?  NO that defeats the purpose of the evening (yes, if you still want to pay the $15!~)

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
Speed Dating Event
Ages: 45 to 59  (Sold Out For Women)
When: Friday, September 25th 2015
6:30 PM - 8:30 PM (Check-in at 6:20)
Where: Pranna Lounge - 79 Madison Ave.


* THIS IS NOT A JEWISH SPECIFIC EVENT. ALL ARE WELCOME TO ATTEND.


GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speed-dating-nyc.html

THIS EVENT IS NOW SOLD OUT FOR WOMEN. MEN CAN STILL SIGN UP.(If you're a woman that would like to sign up, you can join the waiting list for the event by sending an email to [masked] with the subject "Waiting List - September 25". Just put your name in the body of the email. If any spots open up for women, we will email you as soon as they do. If we do not email you back, that means that no spots opened up for women).

PRICE: $34  (Must Pre-Pay Online. No Tickets Sold At Event Door)
(We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because once we fill up for a certain gender we will list event as sold out for that gender. Sign up now to secure your spot).

The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup.

EVENT DETAILS:
Speed dating is so much fun and a great way to meet quality, single professionals in the busy city of NYC. Most people know within a few minutes if they would like to see someone again. We may be biased but we definitely think this is a much better way to meet people than online dating or at a random bar.

You will go on between 8 and 15 mini dates each lasting between 3 and 6 minutes each (we lengthen or shorten the date time according to how many people attend). Women stay seated and the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman.

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

FAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

CAN I PAY AT THE EVENT DOOR?
We do no accept payment at the event door. You must pre-pay online.

WHEN WILL I GET MY MATCHES EMAILED TO ME?
We will email you matches within 48 hours after the event.

IS THERE A REFUND POLICY?
If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer refunds if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up.

WHO IS ATTENDING?
The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup. You can feel free to RSVP page to let the group know you're attending but you still have to go to the above link to pay for the event.

GET YOUR TICKETS AT THIS LINK: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speed-dating-nyc.html
results.name: Speed Dating Event: Ages 45 to 59  (Sold Out For Women)

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

Watch the sun set over NY Harbor and the Historic Hudson River as you sip on refreshing cocktails, meet dozens of new friends, check out 3 awesome river bars and learn a little history along the way!   This event is designed for only our members, friends and partner groups, this is NOT a tour for tourists!   If you have never been to NY Harbor at sunset sign up today!  It is truly a special experience as the lights of NY and NJ light up the surrounding waters.

Here is how it works:

Registration is from 6-6:45 at The Battery Gardens Cafe on NY Harbor's outdoor bar. At 7pm we will walk north along the promenade to the  new Pier A Harbor House Beer Hall for more cocktails and socializing. At 8pm we will again walk north to our destination Merchants River House Cafe in Battery Park City.

Along the way you will learn the history of lower Manhattan, New Amsterdam, Governors Island, Liberty Island & Statue, Battery Park, Ellis island, NY Harbor, The Hudson River and More!

Can I come alone? YES 98% of those attending will come on their own.

What should I wear? Most come from work so business casual.

Do I have to drink and eat? no

Is food available? yes all 3 locations have great food!

What if it rains?  We will watch the weather closely and send out updates that day.

How do I  pay?  Please bring exact change.  $15

Can I just meet the group at the final stop and hang with you guys?  NO that defeats the purpose of the evening (yes, if you still want to pay the $15!~)

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
Join us as we watch and discuss Part 6: Legacy of the 8 part documentary series: Magical Egypt from a Rosicrucian Perspective.

View Website Here!

Watch Video Here!

Summary:

There is another side of Egypt that is not so widely known. Egypt is also the land of secrets. Another history, a secret history, tells of Egypt as the inheritor of deep wisdom and magical ability from an even earlier culture. It is the account of the Egyptians themselves. This alternate history is echoed by parallel accounts from the myth and history of other ancient cultures, as well as myriad secret societies and occult sources. The remarkable number of parallels in these stories provides a unique window into this other Egypt.

A new kind of counterculture is emerging around the unexpected discoveries of a small but growing circle of scientists, authors and researchers. The focal point of this counterculture centers on an alternative interpretation of ancient Egypt - not as mankind's earliest attempts at primitive civilization, but as a fully developed, and inexplicably advanced culture, who's scientific and metaphysical achievements we are only beginning to fully appreciate.

All Are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Magical Egypt: Navigating the Afterlife

results.description:
Please read Ursula LeGuin's "The Dispossessed." "The Dispossessed: An Ambiguous Utopia is a 1974 utopian science fiction novel by Ursula K. Le Guin, set in the same fictional universe as that of The Left Hand of Darkness (the Hainish Cycle). The book won the Nebula Award for Best Novel in 1974,[1] won both the Hugo and Locus Awards in 1975,[2] and received a nomination for the John W. Campbell Memorial Award in 1975.[2] It achieved a degree of literary recognition unusual for science fiction works due to its exploration of many ideas and themes, including anarchism and revolutionary societies, capitalism, individualism and collectivism, and the Sapir–Whorf hypothesis."
(From Wikipedia)

Let's try a new location this month! It's inexpensive and it's got something for everyone. I recall it being relatively quiet too: Pure Pita in Montclair.

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XiGwAvd5mvM


About the film:

In January 2013, filmmaker Laura Poitras was several years into making a film about surveillance in the post-9/11 era when she started receiving encrypted e-mails from someone identifying himself as "citizen four," who was ready to blow the whistle on the massive covert surveillance programs run by the NSA and other intelligence agencies.

In June 2013, she and journalist Glenn Greenwald flew to Hong Kong for the first of many meetings with "citizen four", who turned out to be Edward Snowden.

She brought her camera with her to this series of tense encounters and the resulting film is absolutely unique in the history of cinema: a 100% real-life thriller unfolding minute by minute before our eyes.


Winner of best documentary at the Academy Awards -- BAFTA Awards -- Directors Guild of America Awards -- Critics' Choice Movie Awards -- and many more.

A MUST SEE!


The film runs 113 minutes and will be followed by mingling and a moderated discussion.

Approximate timeline for the night:


• 7pm - Arrival & mingling

• 7:15pm - Film starts


• 9:10pm - Short moderated discussion breaking out into smaller discussion groups



Directions  & Parking:

The coffee house we've graciously been offered as a venue is located inside the Union Train station, near Kean University. It's in an unmarked building, so it might be tough to spot from a distance. To help you find it, here's what it looks like from down the street.

In addition, here is an overhead map to help you get your bearings and familiarize yourself with the area.

If you're driving to the event, you can park in any open spot at no charge. At this hour, there is no parking enforcement.

If you are taking the train, the venue is right inside the Union Train station, which is on the Raritan Valley Line. Here's an NJ Transit Map of the rail system to help you figure out if taking the train would be convenient for you.


To Find Us:

Rock'n' Joe is a cozy place. You'll see us gathered around the big pulldown movie screen on your left as soon as you walk in the front door. Grab a beverage or something to eat and come sit with us!

Please support the venue, Rock'n' Joe with a food or drink purchase (their coffee is sooo good!) so they can continue to welcome us back month after month!
results.name: Citizenfour (Edward Snowden and the NSA wiretapping scandal)

results.description:
Offering to the Spiritual Guide is a special Guru Yoga of Je Tsongkhapa. The main practice is relying upon the Spiritual Guide, and includes all the essential practices of the stages of the path (Lamrim) and training the mind (Lojong), as well as both the generation stage and completion stage of Highest Yoga Tantra.

By relying upon Je Tsongkhapa, our compassion, wisdom, and spiritual power naturally increase. In particular, because Je Tsongkhapa is an emanation of the Wisdom Buddha Manjushri, his faithful followers never experience difficulty in increasing their wisdom. There are many other benefits from practicing Offering to the Spiritual Guide. These are explained in the book Great Treasury of Merit, which contains a complete commentary to the practice.

There is no cost associated with attending pujas .

Tsog Pujas
Tsog’ means ‘collection’ and when we make Tsog offerings we do them collectively, as a group. In this way we accumulate collective karma – we create the cause to progress along the Spiritual Path together. We also accumulate a great deal of merit – positive mental energy – the cause of good fortune.
During a Tsog puja we arrange a table of food and drinks – making it look as beautiful as we can. We imagine that we are preparing a banquet of delight for the holy beings to enjoy. We then invite the holy beings to the place of offerings and imagine they enjoy this blissful banquet.
Afterwards, we enjoy the Tsog offerings with our Spiritual friends. These Tsog puja’s are a great way to get to know your Spiritual friends and to feel a part of a Spiritual Community.

Please bring an offering of your own to add to the table – any food or drink that you feel is beautiful. (No meat or alcohol please.) Please feel free to join in and enjoy. If you like, you can arrive early and help arrange the Tsog offerings.
results.name: Offering to the Spiritual Guide  Puja  ~ Chanted Prayers ~ Free Everyone Welcome

results.description:
Learn to act while overcoming stage fright. Meet new people and increase your confidence and poise. 10-session program. Scene Work - Improvisation - Monologue Study - Showcase Performance opportunities.

The focus is on relaxation and natural performance based on sound fundamental acting technique. We also provide the unique opportunity to perform before live audiences in our own in-house showcase productions.

Acting programs are often very intimidating. The instructors are harsh and anxiety is not addressed. We offer a more humane and effective alternative. Our program is designed to empower as well as guide you through the acting experience.

Many people who attend our classes have never acted before and just need a supportive environment to try it out. We work in very manageable steps. You will not be asked to do anything you are not comfortable with.

Please do come in and see for yourself, if the program is right for you.

Initial session is free of charge. If you do decide to enroll at the
Free Trial, you will receive a $49.00 discount, and 2 bonus sessions.

Discounted rate:$250 for 12 sessions.

Regular rate: $299 for 10 sessions

results.description: "Amazing Grace" is the story of John Newton, a musically talented Englishman that must make the emotional decision of following in the footsteps of his slave trading father or embracing the more compassionate views of his childhood sweetheart. A tale of romance, rebellion and redemption, the show follows him step by step as he grows from a young vocal man with strong opinions to an adult with a softer heart and soul. Its been said that John's journey ignited a historic wave of change that gave birth to the abolitionist movement. Orchestra seats are $98 (regular $139 plus fees) and Middle Mez seats are $78 (regular $98 plus fees) and includes a talk back with cast members following the show. Tickets available while supplies last.

Please bring a drum or rattle. Have extra socks for warm cozy feet, and a blanket or shawl for comfort, water.

About The Organizer: Irma StarSpirit Woman is a Medicine Woman honoring the ways of the curanderas (medicine healers) & her Mayan Ancestors, her medicine elders, She is a shamanic and Reiki practioner, Certified Crystal Healer, Dreamworker, an Ordained Minister in the Order of Melchizedek, Co-Founder of the New York Shamanic Healing Circle, and core member of the NY Shamanic Circle for 18 years.

StarSpirit Woman uses sound healing, fire readings, crystals, and works with the “poderios”, the elemental forces we need to keep an open channel of communication. Her style is accompanied by prayer work and traditional indigenous ceremonies to heal her community with heart. results.description:
We’re trying something new for Movie Night this month, showing 3 short Tibetan films for your enjoyment. The first is about the restoration of Yeshe Tsogyal’s birthplace, “In the Minds of All Beings: Tsogyal Latso of Tibet.” The second, “A Brief History of the Neten Choklings” is about the great Terton Chogyam Lingpa, Orgyen Tobgyal Rinpoche, his father (incarnation of the terton), and Neten Chokling Rinpoche and their monastery in Bir. The third film, directed by Khyentse Norbu, is called “Finding Manjushri.” It’s a delightful tale of a monk’s quest for wisdom.

Please enjoy these fascinating films with us. Bring something to eat or drink for our potluck table. Movie Night is free and open to the public. Our space is small, so please arrive on time, and let us know you’re coming. Reserve a spot through [masked].

results.description:
Are you craving deeper connections in your life?

Do you want to experience more awareness/presence in your day to day life ?

Do you ever have the feeling that you could be enjoying richer more authentic interactions with people?

Sometimes creating profound connection is as easy as looking just beneath the surface with whoever we are with, at any given time and simply being more present with what actually is.

Join us at Reflections Yoga for social games that invite us beneath the surface and into a deeper experience of ourselves and others.

Authenticity Games are a fun, highly-interactive partner and group exercise that explore ways of seeing, connecting, appreciating yourself and others at a deeper level. They are a safe and structured way for us to go beyond small talk and beyond superficial appearances.

It’s an opportunity for us to have fun and celebrate with great people who are also wanting to explore what’s possible in connection.

Join us for some fun relational games, socializing, and snacks

Bring a friend, or come alone and meet some awesome new people.

When we celebrate and explore what makes each of us unique, we often end up realizing just how much we all have in common.

Games Night begins at 7 pm and will wrap up around 10 pm - we generally visit, eat, socialize, do acro-yoga, and hang out in cuddle-piles after the games wrap up. Hope you'll plan on lingering with us.

TO PAY IN ADVANCE: http://relatinggames.eventbrite.com/

If you have any challenges registering online, call Reflections Yoga[masked]

Payment:
$30 at the door
$25 in advance Reflections Yoga
227 East 24th Street
between 3rd and 2nd

(NOTE - the address for Reflections on Google Maps and Reflections' mobile site have not been updated to indicate the NEW location on East 24th Street)


For updates on authentic relating events in New York, join our Meetup or Facebook groups

http://www.meetup.com/Authentic-Relating-NY

https://www.facebook.com/groups/authenticrelatingnyc/

For more information on games nights, visit www.authenticworld.org/games-night.
results.name: Connection Lab!   Relating Games that Build Intimacy and Community

Thank you to everyone who came to our last Game Night!  It was heaps of fun and conquest!   :)

We hope you join us on our next Game Night for a chance to meet tons of new people, play some great games, and drink a few beers. And make sure to invite your friends! We'll have Jamaican/Caribbean dominoes as well. This is one of our favorite strategy games and we would love to share it with the experienced and inexperienced alike.

In addition to dominoes, we will have Settlers of Catan, King of Tokyo, BANG!, Cards Against Humanity, and others. If you'd like to bring your own games, there will be lots of people who like to learn new games.  And again, all are welcome!

Also make sure to bring some cash for a donation.  Though donations are not required, if you are able to donate we suggest $5 for gaming and $5-10 if you're drinking and gaming. Organizing this is 100% volunteer and all the money goes to this MU page, refreshments, and renting the space.

We do not provide food, but there are lots of take-out and delivery options nearby.

See you there!!

results.description:
Can therapists help people without being the expert?  How do therapist and client break out of constraining roles and include clients as co-creators of their therapy and producers of their lives.  What's the mind-set, emotional-set and skill-set needed for innovative and progressive therapists to do just that?  It can be unsettling at the same time as it is profoundly exhilarating and empowering to move into a co-creating mode. Join psychiatrist and social therapist Hugh Polk, M.D for a conversation with Monica Marangon, M.S.Ed., and Ian Johnson, LMSW, recent graduates of the social therapist training program. They will share their clinical experience building their relationships with clients and their efforts to bring this postmodern approach into their work in outpatient mental health clinics, inpatient settings and in private practice. 

Hugh Polk, MD is former unit chief at New York Presbyterian Hospital /Cornell Medical Center, Westchester division, staff psychiatrist at the Furman Counseling Center at Barnard College, and is currently medical director for Emblem/Health. Polk is on the faculty of the East Side Institute for Group and Short Term Psychotherapy and clinical supervisor at the <a>Social Therapy Group</a>. He completed his undergraduate studies at Harvard University, his M.D. from Case Western Reserve University School of Medicine, and his psychiatric residency at Albert Einstein College of Medicine.

Ian Johnson is a licensed social worker, CUNY Hunter alumnus, and graduate of the East Side Institute Therapist Training Program in Social Therapy. He has ten years of experience with older adult populations in roles spanning nutrition and nursing assistance, case management, and psychotherapy. He has worked with older adults and their families, in clinical, residential, and community settings. 

Monica Marangon is a mental health counselor, graduate of Fordham University and the East Side Institute Therapist Training Program in Social Therapy. She has specialized in working with people with traumatic brain injury and post-traumatic stress. Monica is a trained sociologist, and it is this focus on person-in-environment that attracted her to social therapy four years ago.

Registration Fee 
In Advance: $25; Student/Retired/Low Income: $15  
At the door $30; Student/Retired/Low Income: $20

Click Here to Register

results.description:
Autumn may have officially started, but we can still pretend it's summer at LOCK YARD, which serves up hot dogs, sausages, and burgers!

Here's how they got written up in Time Out New York:  "Former Brooklyn firefighter Tommy Casatelli—behind Bay Ridge's Kettle Black and Ho' Brah Tacos—opens a third neighborhood watering hole, a wood-laden beer bar fittingly parked next to Engine 242. Housed inside an old locksmith shop where Casatelli worked as a kid, the copper-backed bar features 12 all-American craft beers—including local brews from Sixpoint, Kelso and Ommegang—and four wines on the black-iron taps. From the open kitchen come snacks including a dozen sausage varieties (such as a chicken-jalapeño-mango from Brooklyn Cured and a broccoli-rabe-and-provolone from Lioni’s), alongside hot dogs, sweet-potato Tater-Tots and Frito pie. Out back is a 32-seat garden equipped with picnic tables, an apt setting for kicking back with one of the bar’s 20 canned brews."  I'm not a drinker myself, but that sounds like a good selection of beer.


Here's a link to their website so you can see what they offer for dinner:  http://www.lockyard.com/media/lockyard_menu.pdf


<a href="http://hobrahtacos.com/project/bay-ridge-main-menu/"></a>

How to meet us:  Let's get there at 7pm.  I'll be holding my handwritten MEETUP sign, so that should be easy to find : ) 

It's four people so that we can get seated more easily.

We'll try for separate checks, but please bring cash to make it easier to settle any bills otherwise.  There is also our own $1 meetup fee, payable to the Meetup organizer, me.

results.description:
IMPROV FOR ACTORS - THE BASICS- Part 1

This Improve with Improv Workshop is the first of two workshops that will focus on learning basic improv techniques which include theater games,movement exercises and scene work designed to help the performer be more spontaneous, focused and aware. The participants will learn skills that help them to break out of their comfort zones and explore new creative territory.


Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.


A fun, safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.

Suggested Donation: $15 (most improv classes cost $35-$50 ea. in NYC.)

**Please note that there are no shoes allowed in the studio.**

results.description:
Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/
results.how_to_find_us: We meet at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center in Bayside, Queens. We convene in the Community Room.
results.name: Friday Night Boardgaming in Bayside Queens!

results.description:
Join us this Friday night as two of the best bands are on hand.....   Desert Highway ....the music of the Eagles , Joe Walsh , Henley and more and then the great 45 RPM ......     .....As Summer fades to Autumn no band captures the driving sound of our generation like the Eagles.... and no band covers them better than Desert Highway.....  

The house lights dim and the stage lights illuminate as the recorded introduction begins.  There is a shared excited anticipation between the audience and the arrival of the band to the stage.  Tonight there will be a celebration encompassing the love of the music of The Eagles.  A love shared by millions of people around the world.  The band that takes the stage shares this passion of their music and painstakingly recreates it's likeness.  This is a totally live experience without any prerecorded instruments or vocals added.  In addition, the solo works of Eagles members, such as Don Henley and Joe Walsh, are added to the rich Eagles repertoire throughout the evening.  As the joy envelops the audience, people sing along, sway, dance and cheer for an evening not soon forgotten.  This is the recurring feeling each time you make the choice to enjoy a live performance from Desert Highway. 

See more Below and 45 RPM

A treasure trove of songs has gone unappreciated for much too long.  Huge 70's radio hits that are instantly recognizable, but are not "cool" enough for ordinary bands to play. Let's face it, some of these songs are so cheesy you'd need to up your cholesterol meds. Still, there's a reason they were million sellers: they really are a lot of FUN! Infectious hooks, great melodies, and incredible production defined AM radio and have woven these tunes into the fabric of our lives. Yet nobody plays them live ... until now! 45rpm is six highly skilled, dedicated, and fairly deranged singers and musicians from the New York scene who bring these songs back to life with the veracity they deserve.  We recreate some very special music and having a total blast doing so! Consider us cheese connoisseurs.

 With 45rpm, we revive the songs and the era from which they came with a fun, entertaining, visually engaging show that has the audience singing and dancing along with all those "wow, I remember that one" moments. Come to a 45rpm extravaganza near you and be ready to experience "cheesegasm"!

Come on down ...we will be up front to the Center under name Terri ......at table ....

2 drink minimum for table ( soda is fine ) ...or join us adjacent at podium

$10 cover
results.name: Friday Night Live Duo..Desert Highway the Music of the Eagles then 45 RPM

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Come meet award-winning authors and internationally-acclaimed seminar leaders Ariel & Shya Kane (the inspiration behind our Meetup) and hear them speak about their new book "Practical Enlightenment". 

In Practical Enlightenment, Ariel & Shya Kane share a refreshing approach to living life without worry, stress or anxiety – a way of living where your past no longer dictates your present or future and you experience your own perfection. Through humorous and touching stories of real people in real life situations, the Kanes show you the easy way to live an enlightened life – no effort required!


There will be books available for sale at the event or you can order your book here: http://www.amazon.com/Practical-Enlightenment-Ariel-Shya-Kane/dp/1943625018/ref=tmm_pap_swatch_0?_encoding=UTF8&qid=&sr=

What to Expect.
Relax. It's Easy.

 

Classes are led by experts, many with thousands of hours of experience and deep knowledge and skill. In addition, there are often people training to become instructors who are happy to offer individual guidance.

 

Classes are tailored to the needs of the attendees. A starter session will be given if there are newcomers. New techniques and insights are always available for regulars. Advanced techniques may also be explored.

 

Classes begin with a brief announcement and introduction followed by 30-40 minutes of instruction and practice. Typically, classes are no more than an hour. Not long, considering the benefits can last a life time.

America Ferrera shines in a star-making performance as Ana, a Mexican-American teenager who’s struggling to break free from her mother’s old-world expectations, in this coming-of-age drama set in East Los Angeles. Ana wants to attend college so she can better herself, but she’s needed in her sister’s sewing sweatshop, where women labor to make dresses that are then sold for many times what the shop is paid to make them.    Winner of the Audience Award for best dramatic film, and the Special Jury Prize for acting in the 2002 Sundance Film Festival

results.description:
Join Adventure Outlet for a weekend of hiking and camping in the Adirondacks High Peaks region - just in time for the Fall Foliage...don't forget your cameras!


Tackle some of the most rugged and challenging hiking terrain in the country and scale some of the famous Adirondacks 46 High Peaks while feasting your eyes on the bursting colors of Adirondacks Park.  

 The Basics:


This is a car camping trip. We will be staying at the Heart Lake wilderness campground at the Adirondacks Loj. This campground is conveniently located at one of the three main trailheads that provide access to many of 46 High Peaks. We will have to coordinate car/tent shares ahead of time, and solo tents most likely won't be permitted (unless it happens that we have a big 4-5 person tent on one site). The campsite is semi-developed, so we will have access to drinking water, and a restroom with running water and showers.

It takes about 5 hours of driving to reach ADK Loj from New York City. Plan on leaving the city in the early afternoon on Friday, and arriving at the campground by 10 PM (you can check in at the campground as early as 2 PM). Arriving at the campsite on Friday means we can get up and start our hikes early on Saturday. Depending on the hikes you choose to do, you may need every bit of the daylight you can get. 

We'll have to vacate our camp sites by 11 AM on Sunday, so before we go hiking on Sunday, we'll have to pack up all of our gear into cars, and move cars to the hiking parking lot.I suggest doing a shorter, a half day hike on Sunday and leaving the ADK by 4-5 PM - this will allow you to get back to the city at a decent time.

Cost, RSVP and Cancellation Policies:

 The price for this trip is $28 per person and includes the cost of the campground, and the basic campground supplies only (firewood, cooking gas...).

Food is not included in the price - you are responsible for bringing your own meals for the weekend!

Please send your payment via paypal to:

[masked]

Very Important: You must select "sending money to family or friends" option.

This will ensure that we receive the full amount you send us; otherwise a fee will be taken out of the amount you send, and you'll have to send another payment to cover the difference.

If you do not have a paypal account and really don't want to open it, please email me for additional payment options.

------------------------------------------------------------------

There is a limited number of spots available for this trip.


Please RSVP yes only if you are certain about going and ready to submit your payment. If the interest for the trip surpasses the capacity, members that RSVPed "YES" but failed to submit their payment will be replaced with members from the waiting list that are ready to commit.

Cancellations made 14 days or more before the start date of the event will receive a full refund; for cancellations made within 14 days there will be no refunds.


Please answer all RSVP questions. These questions are necessary for the campsite reservations, and will also help us plan and organize room and tent shares.

If you do not make any arrangements on your own, you can either look for drivers/passengers/tent roommate using the message board, or we will suggest roommate/driver/passengers based on the preferences and departing location indicated in your RSVP answers. 


Gear:


This is a car camping trip. You'll need to either bring a tent, or to secure a space in someone else's tent - as the number of tents per campsite is limited we'll have to coordinate tent shares. You'll need a sleeping bag and a sleeping mat. Please keep in mind your sleeping bag temperature rating - in the late September, the temperature can easily drop to 40 during the night.

Proper footwear is essential for all hikes in this region - a pair of comfortable, broken-in shoes, with good traction. Please no flip-flops, clogs, skate shoes and similar footwear. 

Bring enough water containers to carry enough water for the entire day. There is a drinking water source at our campsite, but don't forget to bring your hydration packs, bottles. There are a few brooks/creeks flowing through the region so depending on what hike you decide to go on, you may be able to filter the water on the trail.

You are responsible for bringing your own food for this weekend. Along with the food, bring any spices, dishes, utensils, and such necessary for preparation of those meals. We will have a communal stove you can use to boil water/heat up food, and a fire ring with camp fire later in the evening.

You will need a small backpack to carry your food, water, and extra clothing during the hikes. Some of the ADK hikes are very steep and challenging, so you will need to use your hands to climb up/down rocks and boulders, hold on to the roots and branches, so you need your hands to be free.

The weather in the ADK can be unpredictable, and can change in the matter of minutes. Although they're barely above 4000 feet, most of the peaks are bare and exposed so with a bit of a wind chill at the top, a sunny day can turn into a cold one - so be ready and dress in layers. Bring an extra layer, a hat,  and rain/wind jacket that can fit into your backpack. A pair of gloves can be helpful on a cold, windy day.

As on any given hike - it is always a good idea to have your own map of the area you are hiking. You can purchase any ADK High Peaks trail map you find; I find none of them to be great - but National Geographic map #742 may be a bit better than others. Along with the map, on a terrain like this you should have your own compass as well, and know how to use it. If you have a hiking GPS, let me know and I can forward you links to Garmin compatible GPS trail maps.

Headlamp/flashlight is a must on this trip. Campground is fairly dark and you'll need your headlamp right upon your arrival, in order to setup your tent. Some of the hikes are long and it's not uncommon for people to finish those hikes well past dusk.

Insect replant spray is always good to have handy when in the wilderness. 

We will have an access to a bathroom with running water and showers - but don't forget to bring your towel,soap,shampoo, slippers, and other toiletries.

Cell phone signal is intermittent and can't be relied on in this region...but if you have the phone on you - in case of back country emergencies, such as lost or injured hikers, and wildland fires, please notify the DEC Forest Rangers at[masked]-0235.

Hikes:


There is a huge variety of hiking trails available in the vicinity of the campground, ranging from easy walks to the most difficult in the country top list hikes. Please use the discussion area bellow to inquire about hikes, and find partners interested in same hikes. As a general rule, aside from the easy walks around the campground and the Heart Lake, hiking in this area should be done in groups of at least 3 people. 

If you are not familiar with the Adirondacks High Peaks region, you can use this website to get an idea of distance, difficulty, and elevations change/gain of  some hikes:

http://www.everytrail.com/guide/adirondack-46er-list


All hikes that start at Adirondack Loj Heart Lake Trailhead, will be really easy to get to - that trailhead is by our campground. For some other hikes you may have to drive to reach the trailhead, and/or arrange drop-off/pickup with someone from the group.

Getting there: 

We will carpool, and share the cost of gas/tolls.

The ADK Loj is located at :

‎1002 Adirondack Loj Road,Lake Placid, NY 12946

I will email you my contact info and additional details about how to check into the campground/find our sites before the event. Cell phone signal reception is intermittent in this region, so make sure you have all driving directions/instructions before you reach Adirondacks Park.


GPS Coordinates: [masked], [masked]


DISCLAIMER

Participation in activities is strictly voluntary and group members assume all risks in connection with activities; per Meetup.com's Terms of Service Agreements, organizers and hike/trip leaders are released from any and all forms of liability related to events.Full text of our liability waiver can be found on the following page:

http://www.meetup.com/Adventure-Outlet/pages/Risks_and_Waiver_of_Liability/
results.name: Fall Foliage in the Adirondacks

results.description:
Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every week we go to someone's apt, park, or bar.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee 

[masked]

Come out, get a great workout and make new friends!!

GAME RULES:

-On serves only one REDO will be granted per player per game on first serve. (Can hit any obstacle (except lighting) and ball cannot be going out of bounds on sides) After a successful serve(s), no redos! (Beneficial to players waiting to sub in)

- NO REDOS on ceiling obstacles only on WIRE (less arguing, will speed up games)

-If each team fouls they both will cancel each other and a redo will be played immediately 

-No Net touches top or bottom (For Safety of all players)

This group meets on the 4th Friday of each month to discuss various works of "modern" masters or upcoming talent in SF, fantasy, paranormal, horror and related genres. It also occasionally explores classics and the 'masters' of the classics.

A naval lieutenant commander contacts Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson, taking them to the the grisly site of the Dutch steamship Friesland, hoping that their expertise might stop an international incident. Soon the chase draws Holmes and Watson out of their familiar London to the dark and dangerous city of Devil's Cape, Louisiana, which Holmes describes as "a city that swallows law."

What mysteries does Devil's Cape hold for them? Corruption. Pirates. Danger. And more.

results.description:
SUGGESTION: Some folks may prefer to lounge on the deck or patio. If so, it is recommended you bring a sweater. Can be chilly. Where has summer gone...

The end of something is always the beginning of something new...

Though many of us are sad to see another summer come to a close, there is much to celebrate about Autumn--falling leaves, apple picking, Halloween, pumpkins, squirrels collecting chestnuts, Thanksgiving, less weekend traffic on the parkway, to name a few. Let's get together to celebrate the season!!    

Since Autumn is about harvest, we are asking each guest to bring:

1. The beverage of their choice (We will provide vodka--my beverage of choice. Bring a juice or mixer, if that's your preference.)!  :-)

2. A small side/munchy for the group.

We will provide everything else (snacks, other beverages, paper products, and so on).

RSVP soon!! Space is limited!!
results.name: Autumn Pot Luck Party!!

Friday Sept 25th at 9:00pm - 12:00am

4254 Arthur Kill Rd, Staten Island, New York 10309

results.description:
Karaoke is fun! Every other week, let's all meetup in Elmsford, and let loose with some singing!

Karaoke starts at 10:00, so let's meet around 8:30 to get dinner and hang out beforehand.

There is free valet parking, and when the valet guy leaves, he parks your car very close by (as parking becomes more available) and gives you back your keys.
results.name: Bi-weekly Karaoke

results.description:
Dearest Bitches and Bros, 

It’s been so long, yet don’t lose all hope in this country. Sure, a small army of Republicans have lined up for the Mr. America pageant, of which the swimsuit portion was as painful as the speaking. But have no fear, the winner will feed and clothe your unwanted children. This show is for all you election weary children and Trump fans over the age of 21 and costs nothing for you doomsayers. Some side effects may include side-splitting, knee-slapping, and spitting up drinks. Seating is limited. Arrive early to reserve a seat for you and your party. 

Music by 
North Coast
http://northcoastnyc.com/

Comedy by 
Alex Fosella (Perfect Ten Podcast) 
Marie Faustin (The Warm Up) 
Gabe Pacheco (Sirius XM) 
Caitlin McKee (Gotham)
Cyrus McQueen (Last Comic Standing)
Anthony DeVito (Just for Laughs)

Hosted by 


Naomi Karavani
Melissa Stokoski

results.description:
It's the world famous Nuyorican Poets Cafe. We used to go often, because it's an experience I love to introduce people to. We haven't been there in an extremely long time, though, and I felt that was a crying shame (I even cried a little bit). So, because it's awkward to watch a grown man cry, and I don't want to put you guys through that, we're going again. And besides, this place is just so damn awesome, it's impossible to explain. You just have to come with us and experience it.

Details: The show doesn't actually start until 10pm, but it's best to get in line early unless you like sitting on the floor- and that's if you make it in at all.

Price: $13 at the door- cash only.

If you want to check the website, click the link in the name above.
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be in the line, probably at the front.

results.description:
I'll repeat the Google Wallet instructions for those unaccustomed: ***In the notes section of the payment, please leave your name and what event you are paying for! Thanks
-Download the Google Wallet app on your phone. You'll have to have a gmail account to register your username with this service if you don't already have gmail (in that case create a gmail account first... I did the same thing awhile back just to use this service)

- Create a 4 digit PIN to sign into Google Wallet. Then you'll be on the app homepage. -The left button says 'send money'. Click it and you'll have a screen where you can input a name or email address. My email address for this is [masked] .

-Once you input my username you'll see the screen where you type in the dollar amount. Once done, click the gray 'next', then the blue 'review' button in the upper right corner. -This takes to a confirmation screen. If anything looks off just click the left button on the upper lefthand side to go back a page. Otherwise, you confirm it and click send. Done! An icon will appear in your notifications area letting you know it's sent to me.

From now on, every event will not require a payment to rsvp on this page, I will check the rsvps daily to make sure everyone followed up - any issues message me on here and we will figure it out. Please work with me and send the payment when you register for the event... after this first set up it will take ten seconds each week. If you register and don't pay within 24 hours i'll reach out to you and then have to open the spot back up.. work with me here please, that would not be fun

results.description:
PMJ : Our 4th Fall Season begins with celebrating our 80th PMJAMNITES event , We are super grateful after 3 1/2 years to be still bring you great local music and being able to channel musicians and music lovers :- to enjoy music , meet, perform & network at our live music events. 

FEATURED ARTISTS 

**************************

9 pm > JIM GILLIGAN > Introspective & Deliberate Originals.

9:30 pm > F - 66 > Everybody's favorite Rock 'n' Roll Band.

10:30 pm > BIG DROPS > High Energy Dance- Smile Band.

11:30 pm > DJ QUILL > Experimental Trip-Hop.


12 am onwards - DJ After Party /with DJ Quill !


See you at the show.:)
Dress Casual : 21+ : Doors open at 8:45 pm.  


for updates, follow us on Facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/events/889570547758441/


Instagram & Twitter: @playmusician

================================================

PMJAMNITES
----------------------

 is a monthly music event to attract & showcase local talent and create an artistically social event. Artists pre-sign up to perform and are delegated a slot to perform . Designated Artists are featured and showcased .   

PMJAMNITES is a great place to meet an network with other musicians and music lovers in the local community.

PMJAMNITES LIVE MUSIC  begins at 9:00 pm thru 12:00 am

PLAYMUSICIAN ®  -  Arts . Community . Events

---------------------------------------------------------------------

Playmusician creates, promotes, curates  and produces Outdoor & Indoor Live Entertainment Events.


We plan, produce and conduct live music events in the community at local bars/ restaurants, music venues , performing arts centres and outdoor festivals.


PLAYMUSICIAN has successfully conducted large ticketed shows , community events , Festivals & Charity Events (Including Sandy Relief for the Hoboken Shelter)  in the Tri-State Area .


We promote diversity and quality through our events.


We have been the bedrock of the artist community since 2010 in the local Jersey City area.

WWW.FACEBOOK.COM/PMJAMNITES
WWW.PLAYMUSICIAN.COM/

ARTS . COMMUNITY . EVENTS
Facebook ADD : "playmusician"
Please "Like" playmusician/PMJAMNITES on facebook.

results.description:
Starting this Friday, March 6th, Sizzling Salsa will implement a reduction in prices for the dance socials on Fridays. Under this new cover charge, singles will pay $12.00. Also, couples will pay $20.00. With the implementation of this new flat fee, singles will save $3.00. In addition, couples will save $5.00.


Although we are offering this comprehensive package for our weekly parties, you'll still pay nothing for food, drinks, water etc. Moreover, you'll continue enjoying the great selection of Latin music, and the quality of our state-of-the-art PA and DJ system, which produces pristine sound. 


The dance socials start at 9:00 pm.

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.
