PILOT FREQUENCY MANAGEMENT
(redundancy is safety!)
Since most pilots are using the Vtx (5.8ghz video transmitter) bands, please be aware of your transmitter type (Fatshark/Immersion or Boscam) and channel. Here's the basics: 1) Never power up your video TRANSMITTER without first checking that there is no one else currently transmitting on the same channel. 2) Power up your video RECEIVER and goggles/display first BEFORE you power up your aircraft and video transmitter. If you see someone else's signal, then you need to switch your channel, you're stomping. 3) During races, only those in the race should be transmitting video (unless you check in with the race coordinator first to add your frequency to the list.)

4) For racing, the best spread of channels currently seems to be Fatshark/Immersion channels 1, 4 and 7, and Boscam channels 1, 4 and 8. Everyone should initially set their transmitters to one of those channels.

5) Please arrange the video transmitter on your aircraft so that the dip switches/button to change your channels are easily accessible. You may need to change channels quickly just before your scheduled heat. --------------------------------------------

Suggested equipment to bring: 1) Your aircraft(s) and ground station. Be prepared to let everyone know the frequencies you'll be using for your Tx, Vtx, etc. You may want bring your rig in a mobile chest of some kind with wheels, it is a small enjoyable hike each way.

3) AMA License: (highly recommended if you are flying, you can get it here: http://www.modelaircraft.org/)

4) Safety glasses or high impact sunglasses. 5) Sunscreen and water. 6) BYOP - Bring Your Own Power generator, Batteries and charging station. There are no power outlets at this location.

7) A fold out chair to sit comfortably while in FPV. GENERAL INFO: NO FLY ZONE: For safety, the no fly zone is anywhere outside the race track and infield. Please launch your aircraft at the edge or in the grass/dirt area. When coming in for a landing, please approach slowly and don't prop wash/buzz everyone, there's lots of pilots "blind" with FPV goggles that can't tell if you are out of control. We have a 100% safety record and intend to keep it that way. FLY ZONE: All pilots and spectators should stay out of the fly zone as much as possible. Please pilot your aircraft from within the no-fly zone. If you crash or need to enter the field, please wait until races are over, and call out in the pit area your intensions so other pilots can avoid you. CRASH & TRASH: Take out what you brought in, including a little extra while you're at it. That way we're always spotless. KIDS: we encourage bringing any family members and kids interested in RC flying, as it's a great place for young pilots to learn best practices in the art of FPV. For ground/flight safety purposes, we ask that all young pilots be always supervised and mentored on safe flying practices, kept away from dangerous fly zones, and be courteous/don't touch without asking in all staging areas. It is highly recommended for kids to wear protective eyewear. RESPONSIBLE FLYING: Our group prides itself on minimal rules and attracts folks that are mindful, safety conscious and considerate of other pilots, bystanders, pets, wildlife and the environment. If in doubt please ask about best practices from any of the experienced pilots, we're all here to help learn and have a really great time together.

RACING: Please race at a speed and agility that you can comfortably maintain control of your rig. When flying, please be aware of other pilots calling out in the pit. Typically these are "Person on the course, dog on the course chasing rig, powering up on Vtx, etc." It is critical you do not fly over people in the pit or other visitors in the park. And most important, have a blast of fun! Pilots click here to register: http://bit.ly/dSports Rotors Up! Looking forward to seeing you there!

results.description:
All of New York city is a no fly zone... Except for the Aerial Sports League!   To celebrate we're setting up a ginormous drone sports event in the coolest spot in NYC - the New York Hall of Science.  


Join us for World Maker Faire 2015 for 2 full days of aerial sports including drone combat, FPV Racing, Freestyle and so much more!!! 

It's going to be the biggest ASL drone sports event on the East Coast and we want YOU in the games! Space is LIMITED, so pilots will be entered on a first come-first serve basis until the limit is reached.

There is no cost to enter, and all registered pilots get two free tickets to Maker Faire, but only if you RSVP with us. 

Pilots click here to register: http://bit.ly/1L76UdR


Once registered, you will receive a pilot/maker package with all an event guide, rules and other information.  You will also receive 2 free tickets to Maker faire, passes to private maker parties and events, a gift bag of special goodies from our sponsors, discounts and so much more.

Complete Maker Faire info can be found Here:  World Maker Faire 2015

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4q1BQG8Vm1A

=•••••  PLEASE NOTE ••••••=  

RULES OF DRONE COMBAT

Combat drones limited to 1kg max weight, 550mm size, 4S battery and absolutely NO carbon fiber props.  We encourage creative offensive and defensive weapons, but NO use of fire, projectiles, chemical or electro-based systems.  We reserve the right to refuse or demand modification to any drone deemed a potential hazard.

Standard drone combat consists of two drones fighting head to head in a pre-defined arena.  The objective is to knock the opponent’s drone to the floor while avoiding your own drone hitting the floor.  


Combat starts with each drone ready-to-fly and idling in a designated landing zone or ring.  At the sound of the buzzer, each drone lifts into the air.

Each player begins with 3 points.  One point is deducted each time a player’s drone touches the floor. The first player to reach 0 points is declared the loser.

Only drone-on-drone physical contact is permitted.  Players may use flying, hitting and bashing to attempt to force the other drone into the ground.  Drones may not use fire, projectiles, electric shocks/signals or chemicals/materials to interfere with the other drone.  

If combat results in both drones hitting the floor at the same time or within 3 seconds of each other, then both players loses a point.  However, a game-winning point or “kill” point can NOT be obtained if both drones hit the floor at the same time or within 3 seconds of each other (ie.  The winning drone must NOT hit the floor with 3 seconds of the losing drone hitting the floor for final kill point).

Each time a drone crashes, Pilots have 90 seconds to lift off again.  During this time they are permitted to enter the arena to make emergency repairs, replace batteries & parts or make adjustments to their drone.  Pilots have 90 seconds to get their drone flying or they are eliminated from the match.  During this time the healthy drone is allowed to land and rest, but it must land upright and completely within it’s starting zone or ring.  If for any reason the drone hits the floor outside of the ring upon landing or otherwise crashes or can’t lift-off again, it will lose a point as if it had crashed in combat.

Matches end at 5 minutes.  The drone with the highest score will be declared the winner.  If there is a tie, the winner will be determined by tennis ball firing squad.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=85X3INBGQzA

PLEASE NOTE
 =•••••  FPV Racing INFO: ••••••=  

Important FPV Guidelines: 
For FPV racing, or any FPV event where multiple people are flying at the same time, it is best to keep the video transmitter frequencies separated as much as possible to allow as many flyers in the air at one time as possible.  

If you have a 5.8ghz setup, please be prepared to change your video transmitter to one of the following frequencies. Keep in mind that most transmitters default to channel 1, so it’s best to pick another one so there are fewer conflicts. 

Preferred 5.8ghz band FPV Frequencies: 
Boscam/Fatshark = the manufacture and name for the more common frequency bands. 
1st Number = the channel within that band 
Number in parentheses = the boscam channel number on a 32 channel VTX/VRX 
Last Number = the actual frequency for that channel 

Boscam 4 (34) 5645ghz 
Boscam 1 (31) 5707ghz ** 
Fatshark 1 (41) 5740ghz ** 
Fatshark 4 (44) 5800ghz 
Fatshark 7 (47) 5860ghz 
Boscam 8 (38) 5945ghz 

** Only one person at a time can use these frequencies as they overlap 

We will have frequency tags and a whiteboard to help manage who can fly when. Please be considerate and do not power up your VTX if someone else is using that channel. Always check if that channel is being used and call out when you are about to power up so others can speak up if it is not a good time to do so. Even if you are on another channel, the power surge from turning on a transmitter is enough to disrupt someone else’s video for a few seconds, which is all it takes to lose position and crash. 

PILOT FREQUENCY MANAGEMENT 
(redundancy is safety!) 
Since most pilots are using the Vtx (5.8ghz video transmitter) bands, please be aware of your transmitter type (Fatshark/Immersion or Boscam) and channel. Here's the basics:  

1) Never power up your video TRANSMITTER without first checking that there is no one else currently transmitting on the same channel. 

2) Power up your video RECEIVER and goggles/display first BEFORE you power up your aircraft and video transmitter. If you see someone else's signal, then you need to switch your channel, you're stomping. 

3) During races, only those in the race should be transmitting video (unless you check in with the race coordinator first to add your frequency to the list.)

4) For racing, the best spread of channels currently seems to be Fatshark/Immersion channels 1, 4 and 7, and Boscam channels 1, 4 and 8. Everyone should initially set their transmitters to one of those channels.

5) Please arrange the video transmitter on your aircraft so that the dip switches/button to change your channels are easily accessible. You may need to change channels quickly just before your scheduled heat. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TD0ftmZsji8


--------------------------------------------

Suggested equipment to bring: 

1) Your aircraft(s) and ground station. Be prepared to let everyone know the frequencies you'll be using for your Tx, Vtx, etc. You may want bring your rig in a mobile chest of some kind with wheels, it is a small enjoyable hike each way.

3) AMA License: (highly recommended if you are flying, you can get it here: http://www.modelaircraft.org/)

4) Safety glasses or high impact sunglasses. 

5) Sunscreen and water. 

6) BYOP - Bring Your Own Power generator, Batteries and charging station. There are no power outlets at this location.

7) A fold out chair to sit comfortably while in FPV. 

GENERAL INFO: 

NO FLY ZONE: For safety, the no fly zone is anywhere outside the race track and infield. Please launch your aircraft at the edge or in the grass/dirt area. When coming in for a landing, please approach slowly and don't prop wash/buzz everyone, there's lots of pilots "blind" with FPV goggles that can't tell if you are out of control. We have a 100% safety record and intend to keep it that way. 

FLY ZONE: All pilots and spectators should stay out of the fly zone as much as possible. Please pilot your aircraft from within the no-fly zone. If you crash or need to enter the field, please wait until races are over, and call out in the pit area your intensions so other pilots can avoid you. 

CRASH & TRASH: Take out what you brought in, including a little extra while you're at it. That way we're always spotless. 

KIDS: we encourage bringing any family members and kids interested in RC flying, as it's a great place for young pilots to learn best practices in the art of FPV.  For ground/flight safety purposes, we ask that all young pilots be always supervised and mentored on safe flying practices, kept away from dangerous fly zones, and be courteous/don't touch without asking in all staging areas.  It is highly recommended for kids to wear protective eyewear.  

RESPONSIBLE FLYING: Our group prides itself on minimal rules and attracts folks that are mindful, safety conscious and considerate of other pilots, bystanders, pets, wildlife and the environment. If in doubt please ask about best practices from any of the experienced pilots, we're all here to help learn and have a really great time together.

RACING: Please race at a speed and agility that you can comfortably maintain control of your rig. When flying, please be aware of other pilots calling out in the pit. Typically these are "Person on the course, dog on the course chasing rig, powering up on Vtx, etc." It is critical you do not fly over people in the pit or other visitors in the park. And most important, have a blast of fun!  

Rotors Up! Looking forward to seeing you there! 

(Special thanks to Scot & Kevin for helping with the rules and guidelines )

results.description:
Batman Day 2015 is upon us!  Come out to East Side Mags for a day of fun-filled Batman-related goodies!


We've got a ton of stuff going on so strap in and get ready:  HERE COMES BATMAN DAY!


-Awesome Batman-themed coloring sheets, crossword puzzles, word-searches and more table activities


-Batman-themed trivia contest starting at 4pm until 7pm


-All Day Batman Raffle ($5 entry, winners announced on Sunday, 9/27) with Batman-themed prizes includes comics, novelty items, posters and more!


-A special Batman movie double feature where instead of charging admission we'll be asking attendees to bring canned, healthy food for donation to Toni's Kitchen Food Pantry here in Montclair, NJ!  Be like Batman and help those in need!


-Rumor has it that Batman might be here IN PERSON!  Keep your eye out and let us know if you spot him!


-Come to East Side Mags in Batman-related cosplay/costumes and get DOUBLE STAMPS on your purchases!  Ask us for details!

UPDATE (9/25/15):  We have 2 major announcements for all you Bat-Fans out there!


*Stephen Coughlin will be here from 4pm-7pm to sketch for our customers!  Stephen is the amazing (and Montclair-local) artist/writer of Sanctuary, an all-ages graphic novel!   Come say hi and get a cool sketch!


*We have our BIG raffle prize announced!  Enter the raffle ($5 per entry) and you can win some BIG Batman merch!!!  See images posted here for the GRAND RAFFLE PRIZE!


*Batman Trivia will take place between 4pm-7pm!  Prizes a-plenty!!!


*SAVE on all our Batman merchandise!

**10% off all Batman related toys and apparel

**20% off all Batman trade paperbacks and hardcovers

**30% off all Batman back issues (does not include wall books or indie art work)

See you there!

results.description:
Meetup/Hangout – 9:45 am

Whole Foods (Union Square) -- upstairs cafe. Show up a bit early to say hi, chat, and drop off any thing you don’t want to run with: jackets, bags, phones, etc. Somebody will always stay to watch the stuff.

Run – 10:00 am

Run 1 mile, 3 miles, 5 miles, or whatever you want. We'll head to the West Side Highway together. No pressure and no limits. Totally informal. Lots of different paces for lots of different people. Even walking speed is encouraged!

Brunch – 10:45 am

Whole Foods has ALL THE FOOD. Come get some.

What to expect: a seriously fun group of runners who definitely do not take running too seriously . We will meet, chat, RUN, stretch, chat, EAT BREAKFAST and then leave. It’s that easy. First we run, then we eat!

results.description:
The worldwide phenomenon that is Maker Faire returns to NYC for it's annual gathering of tech enthusiasts, crafters, parents, educators, tinkerers, hobbyists, engineers, science clubs, authors, artists and students. This is the world's largest DIY festival that has grown to be the premium event for the maker movement! It is huge!

http://makerfaire.com

We are going Saturday, but there is too much to do and see and most people go for the whole weekend. Buy your tickets below:

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/world-maker-faire-new-york-2015-tickets-17490090331

You can also volunteer instead and register here:

http://makerfaire.com/new-york-2015/traveler-program/


Interested in:

* Catching the next successful kickstarter project in its infancy, getting inspired or pitching your own idea to like minded folks?

* Learning all about developments in 3d printing and robotics?

* Learning how to pick locks, hack drones, craft wearable tech or jewellery?

* Attending Ted Talk style presentations from trail blazers ?

* Picking up really cool gear and tech for steep discounts (DIY, tools, materials, electronics, kits, books, hiking, biking...)?

* Catching crazy musical and acrobatic performances while chowing on amazing food (think celebrity chefs from the food network)?

* Getting involved with green tech or testing out the bamboo bike or designing your own designer bacteria in the biotech section?

* Getting major free swag from every corporate sponsor present

* Checking out all the exhibits at the children's museum for free ?

* Igniting a passion for independent thought and creative problem solving in your students or your child?


* Volunteering for the event ?

It is all happening here :D

Download the app, there will be too much going on


http://makerfaire.com/app/


(see map http://makerfaire.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/09/MF15_NY_Map_8x11.pdf)

BE ADVISED: There is NO PARKING at the New York Hall of Science (NYSCI). Please plan accordingly by reviewing the Citi Field parking information noted below.

EVENT DATES & TIMES: Saturday, September 26 — 10:00 am – 6:00 pmSunday, September 27 — 10:00 am – 6:00 pm EVENT LOCATION:

New York Hall of Science

[masked]th Street

Queens, NY 11368 EVENT PARKING: Citi Field


12001 Roosevelt AveQueens, NY 11368

Refer to the Parking & Shuttles section below for more details.

GETTING TO MAKER FAIRE:

Transportation and parking information is updated regularly. Please check back for more information.

BY PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION

BY BICYCLE

BY CAR

PARKING & SHUTTLES

TRANSPORTATION FOR THOSE WITH A MOBILITY DISABILITY

PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION

World Maker Faire is very well attended! We strongly suggest you share rides or take alternative transportation instead of driving.

Subway

Take 7 LOCAL train to 111th Street Station. Walk three blocks south. Or, take 7 EXPRESS to Mets-Willets Point. Walk down the boardwalk and follow the signs to the New York Hall of Science.

Walking Directions from 111th Street Station to NYSCI: View YouTube subway directions video.

Biking and walking directions from Mets-Willets Point Station to NYSCI via Google Maps.

Bus

Q23 or Q58 to Corona Avenue and 108 Street. Q48 to 111 Street and Roosevelt Avenue.

BY BICYCLE

Bike Valet will be available at the 111th Street entrance to NYSCI. It’s free to park your bike! Bike Valet hours are:

SATURDAY & SUNDAY — 9:30 am – 6:30 pm

Please check the Queens Bike Map for preferred routes and bike paths.

Arrive in Style with Uber!

We’re thrilled to partner with Uber to provide new and existing Uber users discounted ride options to World Maker Faire. Here’s how to get your ride:

New Uber Users—Get $20 off your first ride!:

Download Uber’s free iPhone/Android/Blackberry 7 app and set up your account using promo code MAKER25 (Or go to

https://get.uber.com/go/MAKER25

.)Request a pickup 5-15 minutes before you need one. $25 will be applied toward your first ride on uberX, UberBLACK, or UberSUV (excluding uberT)No cash needed—your credit card is billed directly for the trip and tip!

Existing Uber Users—Try uberPOOL and get $20 off your first uberPOOL trip!:

uberPOOL is the innovative carpool option from Uber, the smartphone app that connects riders and drivers at the tap of a button. You’ll be matched with people riding along a similar route to get to your destination quickly at a price the fraction of a New York City taxi. An uberPOOL match guarantees a cheaper fare, and only adds a few minutes to your trip. To use the discount:

Enter the promo code MAKERPOOL in the ‘Promotions’ section of the appSelect the uberPOOL option at the bottom of the screenRequest and ride—you may be matched with another rider traveling along a similar route

Questions? Check out http://uber.com/nyc or email <a>[masked]</a>.

BY CAR Directions to Parking at Citi Field

Enter your point of origin in this map to get specific driving directions via Google Maps to the public parking lot at Citi Field. Or follow the driving directions below from surrounding boroughs and states.

Those arriving in a group by bus, please see the Bus Parking information below.

Driving Directions:

From Queens Take the Grand Central Parkway East to exit 9E- Citi Field/Northern Boulevard East, or take Grand Central Parkway West to exit 9E- Citi Field/Northern Boulevard East.

From Manhattan Take the Robert F. Kennedy Bridge to Grand Central Parkway to exit 9E- Citi Field/Northern Boulevard East, or take Queens Midtown Tunnel to Long Island Expressway to exit 22A-E to either Van Wyck Expressway North or Grand Central Parkway West to exit 9E- Citi Field/Northern Boulevard East.

From Brooklyn Take the B.Q.E. East to the Grand Central Parkway East to exit 9E- Citi Field/Northern Boulevard East, or take the Eastbound Belt Parkway to the Northbound Van Wyck Expressway. Take the exit 9E-Citi Field/Northern Boulevard East.

From the Bronx Take the Cross Bronx Expressway to Whitestone Bridge to Whitestone Expressway to exit 13D- Northern Boulevard/Citi Field, or take the Robert F. Kennedy Bridge to the Grand Central Parkway exit 9E-Citi Field/Northern Boulevard East.

From Staten Island Take the Staten Island Expressway East to the Verrazano Narrows Bridge to the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway North/East to the Grand Central Parkway exit 9E- Citi Field/Northern Boulevard East.

From Long Island Take the Westbound Southern State Parkway to the Northbound Cross Island Parkway to Whitestone Expressway exit 13D to the Northern Boulevard/Citi Field exit, or take Westbound Northern State Parkway/Grand Central Parkway exit 9E- Citi Field/Northern Boulevard East.From New Jersey


From Northern New Jersey Take the George Washington Bridge to the Major Deegan Expressway (I-87) South to the Robert F. Kennedy Bridge to the Grand Central Parkway to exit 9E- Citi Field/Northern Boulevard East.


From Southern New Jersey Take the Goethals Bridge to the Staten Island Expressway East to the Verrazano Narrows Bridge to the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway North/East to the Grand Central Parkway to exit 9E-Citi Field/Northern Boulevard East, or take the Bayonne Bridge to 440 South to the Staten Island Exp. East, then follow directions above or take the Outerbridge Crossing to 440 North to the Staten Island Exp. East, then follow directions above.

From Connecticut Take I-95 to Whitestone Bridge to Whitestone Expressway to exit 13D- Northern Boulevard/Citi Field.

From Westchester Take the Hutchinson River Parkway South to the Whitestone Bridge to Whitestone Expressway to exit 13D- Northern Boulevard/Citi Field.

From Rockland Take I-87 South (becomes the Major Deegan Expressway in New York City) to the Robert F. Kennedy Bridge to the Grand Central Parkway to exit 9E- Citi Field/Northern Boulevard East.

PARKING & SHUTTLES:

World Maker Faire parking will be in the Southfield Lot at Citi Field. The entrance to the Southfield lot is east of Roosevelt Avenue between 114th and 126th. Parking for Citi Field is $10 for the day. No in/out privileges. There will be continuous shuttle service between Citi Field and NYSCI. Check back for shuttle schedules.

Bus Parking: Buses arriving with groups should head to Citi Field. Buses will be directed to drop off their passengers in the South Lot very close to the shuttle pick-up/drop-off point. Buses will then be directed to park and stage. Bus parking is $20 per vehicle for the day. Group leaders should stay in touch with their bus drivers by phone to coordinate a pick up in South Lot when the group takes the shuttle back to Citi Field.

Shuttles run continuously between Citi Field and World Maker Faire. SATURDAY & SUNDAY: First Shuttle from Citi Field 9:00am, Last Shuttle from World Maker Faire 8:00pm

Back to Top

TRANSPORTATION FOR THOSE WITH A MOBILITY DISABILITY

Handicap parking is available at Citi Field. An ADA shuttle that can accommodate motorized wheelchairs will be available for those that require it. There is no parking available at NYSCI.

results.description:
A healthy mind and body is key to a successful, joyful and happy life. Learning to manage the mind, emotions, stress in today's world is a much needed life skill. Did you know our very own breath actually holds a secret to a healthy and happy existence? :) Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes! In this one hour workshop we will explore the connection between the breath, mind and body and learn a few breathing techniques to relax and rejuvenate. We will top it off with a guided meditation - no experience necessary :)

The workshop is also an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program that has benefited over 40 million people worldwide . Don't hesitate to ask for the upcoming program.

So come join us!
results.name: Happiness Inside Out

results.description:
Hello folks,

An organization that is working with us recently got a new shelter that needs a lot of love! So we decided to help them!

Location: 599 Ralph Avenue, Brooklyn, NY


Directions: The closest subway stop is the #3 train stop at Sutter Ave-Rutland Rd. It’s about a 5 minute walk. The other close train stops are the #4 to Utica Ave (10 minute walk) or C train to Ralph Ave (15 minute walk).

Recommendations: Wear clothes that you don’t mind getting messy and wear closed toed shoes.

I know this place might be a little far for those who live in Manhattan. But unless we have a "GREAT" excuse like this,  we would never venture out :) Please RSVP only if you are certain that you can commit. If there is enough interest, we will socialize a little bit after the event. Would be nice to get to know fellow volunteers.

My cell (Takuya) is[masked]-3020. Text or call me if you get lost.

Regards,

results.description:
About our Meetup:

http://www.ThriveInThePark.com

Thrive in the Park was created by a group of friends with a common interest in fitness, clean food, and having a great time.

Our goal is to get in the best shape while in the company of great people.

Workout Details:

Bring a water bottle and your determination.

Our free workouts are created by certified fitness experts and are designed for everyone at any level of fitness. 


The work out will consist of body weight exercises (pushup, sit ups, squats, lunges, jumps, team competitions, partner exercises, etc).

If you have any questions, please send us a message and we'll get back to you.

Note: When you RSVP we will send you a telephone number you can call/text in case you have any trouble finding us.


What people are saying:

Achelle - #ThriveInThePark is the workout I look forward to all week! Not only do I get an incredible full body workout, but it's a fun and encouraging group to be apart of!

Devon - #ThriveInThePark is the best way to sweat out last night's wine.

History:

Thrive in the Park started in 2014. We believe in giving back to the community and in creating ripples of kindness, strength and gratitude. It is our hope that you too will go out into the world and create these ripples. 

We can't wait to see you!

Sponsored by: http://www.soRipe.com
results.how_to_find_us: We're located on the track in McCarren Park, close to the bocce ball courts
results.name: Thrive in the Park

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.

WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...

1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated

9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved

Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Updated September 5th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

FALL (Sep - Nov)

As the city cools down we play four times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!) 
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!) 
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"I have tried many different forms of meditation and yoga over the years. Though I have experienced some positive changes practicing over the years I never felt committed to practice on regular basis. Nan takes it to a whole other level. How and why? All I can say is you have to experience it for yourself. There is power in simplicity,love, and truth. Despite some language barriers(which are minor) You can feel her love and healing energy. Open your mind and see with a different set of eyes. I highly recommend her special Saturday classes." Michelina, Bodhi Meditation class Saturday November 15, 2014

“ My first time today. Nan is very helpful and dedicated. I enjoyed it immensely and I did experience a shift in energy. I feel more alert, relaxed and focused even as I write this testimony. I plan on attending her next class in Freeport." Michelina, Bodhi Meditation class September 17, 2014

“ Very strong healing energy tonight. I got there feeling very tired. I had stomach pain all day, and during the first meditation of the evening it got a lot better. By the end I wasn't thinking about it at all. I left full of energy. ” Pam, Bodhi Meditation class November 22, 2013

“ I didn't realize I would be reaping the benefits of Bodhi Med so quickly after attending only two classes. After my second class I felt even more relaxed. I have insomnia, but after the second session I fell asleep faster and deeper which has not happened for a long time. ” Dee, Bodhi Meditation class September 18, 2013

"I have been attending these classes for three weeks. They are amazing. Nan is wonderful! My energy level is shifting and I am beginning to experience an ongoing sense of well-being with balance and relaxation. Highly recommend!" Kathleen, Bodhi Meditation class October 25, 2013

------------------------------------------------------


Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.


Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways


1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Small group meditation sessions. Up to 7 people per meeting

I do Bodhi meditation, a form of energy healing.

If you open your heart and relax your mind you will benefit from this session. Benefit you physically and spiritually.

Seating, we have soft meditation mats and soft chairs whichever makes you feel more comfortable.

The session takes about 30-40 minutes followed by a discussion period. Tell me how you feel and what you felt.

Cost: $10

Regular meditation schedule:

Saturday: 10 - 11 AM

For travel from NYC:

Take the Long Island Railroad (Babylon branch) to Merrick

Location:

Ni Nan Healing Art Center

2326 Merrick Road

Merrick, NY 11566

Tel# [masked]

Have a great day,

Nan

 ---------------------------------------------------------------------

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

results.description:
Outdoor Yoga Session To Welcome Autumn.

Fall is the season of transformation. We can see this all around us in nature. The leaves change color, the air becomes cooler, and we settle down some and ground, after Summers heat and high energy.

It is important that we change with the season, just as nature does, by adapting our daily habits, yoga practices, and food choices.

According to Ayurveda each season is dominated by one of the three doshas. Vata dosha is prevalent during autumn. The qualities of Vata are cold, rough, light, changeable, irregular and moving. Vata is composed of the elements of  air and space.

With the abundance of Vata energy circulating during the Fall season our bodies and minds can become overwhelmed and out of balance. We cannot change the weather change but we can maintain internal balance by adjusting our lifestyles to counter the predominant Vata energy in nature, and welcome Fall.

Class will begin at 10:30am, and will be held for one hour and 15 minutes.

Please bring a yoga blanket, or beach towel along with your yoga mat.

Wear comfortable clothing and in layers to adjust with the yoga practice.

There will be two sessions. September 19, and 26.

Please RSVP if you would like to join.

Class fee is $20 per session.

12 student maximum.

Food Network's top celebrity chefs are scouring the nation in search of the best home cooks out there. You’ve watched them on TV, bought their cookbooks, and tested out their recipes at home. This is your chance to be mentored by a culinary icon. Outlast your competitors in this high-stakes cooking competition, and you could go home with bragging rights and $50,000! 

Are you an amazing home cook? Do your friends beg to be invited to your dinner parties? And then beg you for all of your recipes? Do you love to talk about flavor profiles and favorite cooking utensils to anyone who will listen? 

If you are a Food Network fanatic and a truly skilled home cook who prepares elevated dishes completely from scratch, this is your chance to apply to All-Star Academy. Maybe you abandoned your dreams of culinary school to take care of your family. Maybe you have racked up a collection of state fair blue ribbons, taken home the trophy at a cooking competition, or earned local celebrity status for your food. Whatever your story, we'd love to hear it!

The 11th Annual NYC Mental Health Film Festival moved to Manhattan. We still bring a vivid selection of thought-provoking films which positively portray the mental health community. The event also includes three Q&A sessions with filmmakers, and audience discussions.

EVENT: 11th Annual New York City Mental Health Film Festival

Village East Cinema, Manhattan

189 Second Avenue – 2nd Avenue and 12th Street

Any train to 14th street, take bus or L train to 1st Avenue

Tickets are available on website: www.mentalhealthfilmfest.nyc

For discount tickets Contact Carla at Community Access[masked] x7726

Or go to www.communityaccess.org Community Access gives a voice to mental health recipients. Community Access provides quality housing and employment services for the mental health community.

Morning FIlms
10:30 AM – 12:45 PM

Patient’s Rites
How to Touch a Hot Stove
Never Look Down
The Blind Stigma

45 minute Q&A with Directors of Patient’s Rites and How to Touch a Hot Stove

Afternoon Features
1:30 PM – 5:45 PM

No Letting Go (USA Premiere) + half-hour Q&A with cast and filmmakers
Cracking Up + half-hour Q&A with David Granier

results.description:
Community Access is hosting the 11th Annual NYC Mental Health Film Festival, with exciting news about this year’s event: Presenting the US premiere of No Letting Go, a feature film based on the award-winning short, Illness. Following the film, you will be joined by producers and cast members for a poignant conversation about their journey to make this inspiring film about the life of one family whose son struggles with bipolar disorder.

Comedian David Granirer, star of the hit documentary Cracking Up, will be in the house to wow the crowd with his incisive stand-up comedy. Ever dreamed about your life as a musical? Then, get ready for the hilarious “Patient’s Rites, a Musical Documentary”! 

You can choose to attend the morning or afternoon films – or select a day-long pass – at a super affordable price.

Morning series times: 10:30 - 12:45 
Afternoon series : 1:30 - 5:45 


And, your ticket purchase entitles you to a FREE popcorn + a few other treats! 


CLICK HERE FOR TICKETS & MORE INFO
results.name: NYC Mental Health Film Festival 2015

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
results.name: Soccer Saturday -@west 134th Street Field - 10:45am

results.description: We will do a detailed analysis of The Fool from the Major Arcana. There will be a Q & A. Bring your decks and your questions. We will continue doing easy spreads. Don't forget your intuition or a pen and paper, as well as a sweater. They are still using air conditioning and it won't be pleasant if you feel cold. There will be time for you to have a little something to eat. I'm not a clock watcher and I won't rush this class. I want you to be able to get as much out of it as possible. You can go over your notes and practice at home. Keep up your journals; they are an extremely helpful tool and they will enable you to see how much you have progressed from where you began. If there are time constants for anyone, who cannot stay at least the 2 hours, I will send you the balance of the notes, if there are any; but not the readings. Readings can become very personal and that is kept within our circle only.
results.name: Second Beginners' Class -- The Fool

results.description:
*UPDATE*:  Eric's workshop on "What Is Thelema?" will be held from 3:00-3:45 at Workshop Area B.

Aiwass and the Temple of Thelema will have a table at this year's Pagan Pride Day in Washington Square Park, from 11:00 am to 5:00 pm. There will also be crafts vendors, music performances, workshops and more!

Come get your photo taken with a cut-out photo of the Master Theiron at our table for free. Announcements of upcoming Aiwass public events and Babalon Salon, our study group for women!

Our member Eric will lead a workshop on "What is Thelema?"

Thelema is the name of the philosophical school and religious matrix established in 1904 with the writing of Liber AL vel Legis (The Book of the Law) by Aleister Crowley [masked]) and stands on the central axiom, the Law of Thelema. The Law is summed up in two phrases from the Book:

“Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the Law” (AL I:40) and
“Love is the law, love under will” (AL I:57).

The central goal of a Thelemite (as adherents refer to themselves) is to discover and perform his or her True Will, which is generally defined as the innermost Nature or proper life course of the individual. The techniques used to achieve this goal fall under the heading of Magick.

Time of the workshop to be announced.

We will be at our table through the day.

We will not be meeting at our regular time today; only at the Pagan Pride Festival.
results.how_to_find_us: We will have a table with our banner and a photo of Aleister Crowley.
results.name: Aiwass at Pagan Pride

results.description:
National Alpaca Farm Days is almost here and Bluebird Farm Alpacas in Peapack, NJ is getting ready for our open house weekend on Saturday, September 26th and Sunday, September 27th from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m! On the last weekend of September every year, many alpaca farms and ranches across America welcome visitors of all ages to meet their alpacas and to learn about the alpaca lifestyle. Bluebird Farm Alpacas invites you to join us for this special event. Our Farm Store, which features unique items made from our alpaca fiber, will be open, as well. 

Bring along a picnic lunch and maybe a camera if you'd like to participate in our photo contest!


The event is free. There is also a farm store/boutique. On Sunday, there will be a spinner demonstrating and on Saturday there will be felting demonstrated (great for kids to get involved in trying out). Stacy Miller will be there all day both days. Feel free to look for her and introduce yourselves from the Meetup! 

Parking is available, but limited, so carpooling is a great idea. 

We ask that no pets, such as dogs, come along (although we love them!) because they make the alpacas nervous. 

You can share our website, as well (www.bluebirdfarmalpacas.com), if you would like.


<<<<<PLEASE READ>>>>>>>>

Lisa (your fearless leader) will not be hosting or attending, but this was too interesting not to post. Stacie Miller will be there and will welcome all the meetup members who attend on Saturday or Sunday.

Also, this will not be a typical meetup where we meet at a specific time and place a group. 

This Meetup is FAMILY FRIENDLY, but YOU are responsible for any small humans you bring. 

Enjoy!

PS, as always, if you cannot attend, no need to post why. We'll catch you next time!
results.name: Bluebird Farm Alpacas Open House

results.description:
Just a reminder to SAVE THE DATE: for another great day on the Hudson. Get on the Metro North and enjoy great views, and entertainment!!

Please join us to celebrate the fall season on the picturesque Peekskill Riverfront Green for the 6th Annual Hudson Valley Irish Fest.

This day-long festival runs from 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. Please show up whenever it is convenient for you. There will be music all day long, starting at 11.

There is a $10 per person suggested donation fee and kids 12 and under are free.

NO COOLERS OR OUTSIDE FOOD OR BEVERAGE PERMITTED, THANK YOU!

No pets allowed, Certified service animals only.

http://www.hudsonvalleyirishfest.com/about-the-festival/


Lineup for Main Stage 2015 Hudson Valley Irish Fest

11 am – TBD


12 pm – TBD


2pm –– TBD


4pm – TBD


5pm – TBD


with  our Massed Pipe Bands

5:45pm –– TBD

Learn more at: http://www.hudsonvalleyirishfest.com/about-the-festival/

7th Annual Hudson Valley Irish Fest


GETTING THERE:

If you are not driving to Peekskill, you can take the Metro North Train to the Peekskill train Station which is only about an hour from Grand Central Train Station, then its only a short walk from there.

**I would highly recommend the 1 hour train ride(HUDSON LINE) from Grand Central Station to Peekskill, NY for ease and comfort. It is an early festival: 11am until 7pm- so, not too late for public transit. Sit back and enjoy the beautiful views of the mountains, greenery and the Hudson. It is beautiful this time of year! The Festival is right past the Peekskill Train Station -- at the Riverfront Green Park.**

http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_results.cfm?n=y


If you are driving and are using a GPS-- use the address for the Peekskill Train Station, to get you to the general area. It is located at: 300 Railroad Ave., Peekskill, NY 10566


**THE LOCATION MENTIONED ON THE ACTUAL MEETUP PAGE IS APPROXIMATE(HUDSON AVE):
RIVERFRONT GREEN PARK IS ACTUALLY AT RAILROAD AND HUDSON AVENUES.**use these points to get public transit directions**

The Metro North Trains run every hour from Grand Central Terminal, and if you choose to drive, there is also parking at the MetroNorth Train station and surrounding area.

METRONORTH TO PEEKSKILL-- steps from the festival area.We've all enjoyed it for the past four years, and usually get a great turn out. The Festival committee usually rolls out the red carpet for us-- reserved space, Signs for our meetup, etc...September 26, 2015 at the Peekskill Riverfront Green
results.name: 7th Annual Hudson Valley Irish Fest--Peekskill, NY

results.description:
Join us by RESERVING A FREE TICKET at www.myrtleavenue.org/events or calling[masked], ext. 6. Description from their website below:
On the last Saturday of the each month during the summer, the Myrtle Avenue Brooklyn Partnership will host a FREE guided walking tour through the historic Wallabout neighborhood. The walks are being offered in partnership with the Fort Greene Park Conservancy.

The tours begin in Fort Greene Park at 11am on the final Saturday of the month from May through September 2015.

The guided walk will explore 400 years of history through the area’s historic architecture and landmarks and will venture into the neighborhood’s beautiful mix of pre-Civil War homes and late 19th century industrial district just outside the Brooklyn Navy Yard. The tour will focus on how the neighborhood has developed from when the Dutch first arrived in the early 1600’s and highlight notable residents, such as Author Walt Whitman and Doo-Wop Singer Little Anthony. Information on Whitman, along with the reciting of some of his works during the tour, is provided by the Walt Whitman Project and the American Opera Projects.

Many local residents are aware of some of the neighborhood’s notable historic events or people, such as the Prison Ship Martyrs’ Monument and Walt Whitman, but many lesser known stories are widely unknown. The tour will highlight these stories. For example, the tour will pass the home of the first professional baseball player, the birthplace of Michael Jordan, and The Chocolate Factory, a factory that once made Tootsie Rolls.

The tour includes a 1.5 walk, beginning in Fort Greene Park and concluding at 99 Ryerson St. The event is FREE, but space is limited and registration is required.

Spaces are still available on the May, June, July, August and September tours. Click on the month you wish to attend to reserve your spot today!

These tours are made possible with a grant from the New York Council for Humanities.
results.name: Free Wallabout Historic Walking Tour

results.description:
This 2-Day comprehensive workshop explores visual storytelling with dynamic camera movement and skillful actor blocking.

Through extensive, daily hands-on exercises, participants will learn to visualize the scene, work with actors, strategize with storyboards, and evoke the essence of the script: DRAMA!

Participants will learn how to visualize, choose optimum camera positions, camera movement, and lens choices in relations with actor blocking.

Through this process, participants will understand how to convey tone, mood, and style, as well as give the film a distinct look that belongs to the director's unique vision.

WHEN: SEPT 26-27 (Sat & Sun) 11am - 3pm
WHO: Narrative/Documentary Filmmakers
FEE: $425 Includes Studio and Equipment

LIMITED SEATING. Join us! Unleash Your Creativity!

Registration: http://www.solarnyc.com/workshops/directing/registration.html

Solar Film/Video Productions
632 Broadway, Ste. 304
New York, NY 10012

results.description:
This 2-Day comprehensive workshop explores visual storytelling with dynamic camera movement and skillful actor blocking.

Through extensive, daily hands-on exercises, participants will learn to visualize the scene, work with actors, strategize with storyboards, and evoke the essence of the script: DRAMA!

Participants will learn how to visualize, choose optimum camera positions, camera movement, and lens choices in relations with actor blocking.

Through this process, participants will understand how to convey tone, mood, and style, as well as give the film a distinct look that belongs to the director's unique vision.

https://d3mjyf8rb023qs.cloudfront.net/api/file/kV4c3ERMQE2CNwdoxBC9

Join us as we explore what was once the playgrounds of all things gang and mob related on this 2.5 hour walking tour. Stroll through historic downtown neighborhoods as you peer into their dark past. Visit famous sites of killings, movies, and infamous crimes. 

Peer into New York's dark past and uncover hidden secrets when you visit places ruled by some of the city's most powerful gangs and mobs. Head to Little Italy, once the heart of a tight community of Italian immigrants, to hear stories about mob activities and visit notorious spots. You’ll also explore the little-known history of the Chinese migration to New York, and the dominance of dangerous street gangs and underground opium dens, as well as the ruthless gangs in the infamous Five Points area, and what became of them. Along the way you’ll stop to see historic sites, sample the local fare and discover hidden stories waiting to be revealed.

More info and tickets here - https://goo.gl/CnzDvk
results.name: Discover the Gangs and Mobs of Old NYC

results.description:
This week we continue our discussion of the Seven Factors of Awakening and look at the factor of Energy.  

So far we've considered Mindfulness as the foundational intention of being present for whatever shows up in life just as it is, without adding any mental embellishments, without clinging to things that are pleasant or without denying things that are unpleasant. And, last week we talked about Investigation as the discernment of wholesome or unwholesome aspects of our relationship to experiences and mind states. 

Energy, the third factor, is both the capacity for action and our ability to act. There are many nuanced aspects of energy. It is the strength we utilize to stay resolute, to persevere and to persist as we cultivate and grow in wisdom. Energy is also the courage we need to face challenges for the sake of our intended accomplishment. 

Since we use energy in all of our activities, we can be mindful as to whether we are using our energy skillfully or not. This is where we can grow in wisdom and find balance with the effort we bring to our experience. For example, if our energy is low, do we make an effort to engage or fall into inaction? Are we staying in our comfort zone and not growing in wisdom? Conversely, are we pushing too hard and our mind state is rigid and prone to self-judgment? How do we find the energy that arises naturally when we are open, balanced and at ease?"

The brief topic discussion will be followed by a guided meditation and time for discussion and Q&A.  Please note that while there is benefit in participating in regular sittings and practice, you do not have to attend every class to find value. I hope you'll join us.

Fee by donation: Suggested starting donation is $10 and your generosity is greatly appreciated.  No one is ever turned away for lack of funds.
results.name: The Seven Factors of Awakening - Energy

Joe will generously share his expertise with us.  You will want to take advantage of Joe's visit and receive cutting edge tips on how to integrate essential oils into your life.  Joe is a charismatic speaker;  you will be interested and engaged in this fun workshop. We will have plenty of time to have your questions answered.  Take away with a better understanding of essential oils, some essential oils samples, and the opportunity to win some gifts.

Are you looking for natural ways to enhance the well being of your body, mind, and spirit? Essential oils are Nature's pure, potent and powerful gifts that could:

- help to create a calmer inner and outer environment

- contribute to a restful night's sleep

- cleanse and soothe the skin, and improve appearance

- support the respiratory system

- help to ease the effects of occasional upset stomach

- take the edge off muscle soreness after exercise

Join us and learn (for FREE!) how to safely use essential oils, and about the ways in which they could lift your spirits, clear your mind, and give your body the boost it's been waiting for.

Enter our PRIZE DRAWING and you'll qualify to win an essential oil, a Wellness Consultation, and an NLP session. (These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent disease.) Call or text me when you arrive .  The workshop will be on the Terrace Outside  with a beautiful view of the Hudson River and in the Common area depending upon the weather. You must call or text when you arrive

results.description:
Howdy Benders!  Hope your week is productive.  Sending out a reminder about our session this Saturday same time same place. As the weather changes, it is the perfect opportunity to drag yourself out of bed and unto your yoga mat. When I first wake up and my bed feels so good I have trouble getting out of bed. But then I remember how stressful by my work week was and how imperative yoga is to detoxing my body and aligning my mind and spirit. We owe it to ourselves to feel great! Start investing in yourself by treating yourself right. I can't tell you how many times I didn't feel like doing yoga but how great I felt afterwards.

Think about how you have an opportunity to do yoga in a community setting, meet like-minded people, and support a local business at the same time!

I would like to continue the yoga and would love to see more benders. Please take advantage of this opportunity because it may not be here for long. See you on Saturday. Namaste.

results.description:
Hey Girl!

Join us for our Newly added event at Lowe's on Saturday September 26th, 2015, "Ladies Locker Room and Member Madness"

What is the Ladies Locker Room?  You Ask....

It's an event where Female Do It Yourselfers come together in one room and discuss a project that I am currently working on for Girls Gone DIY.  The purpose is to get the required feedback from future users of the project, like yourself so that the project can be a success.  And it cannot be a success without your input and opinions. Much like a Focus Group.

In addition you will have the opportunity to discuss a project you have or going to have yourself in the Ladies Locker Room. We too will help you and give you sound advice and discuss the opportunity of possibly helping you hands on if necessary.  Our Topic for this Locker Room event is:

http://girlsgonediy.com/Content/ArtText/12768.png?text=Closet%20Freaks&style=Site%20title%201&styleGroup=100&fn=Jura%20Medium&fs=12&sid=5872954701058566

Closet Freaks  Is a new closet organizing project for ladies who are just frustrated with figuring out what to wear day to day.  Is this you? Spending countless minutes and possibly hours looking in a closet and going no where? Trying to figure out if you wore that already less than 10 days ago? This project will end all your woes about Where, When and How when it comes to you and your closet.  When you leave you will want to hurry home and get started.  

Member Madness:

This is the fun part.  We will have a Membership Recruitment for a half hour in Lowe's Home Improvement Store. (This is a Volunteer Only activity).  In that half an hour you will assist in recruiting women who are already shopping in the store.  

You will be provided what to say and do, to peek interest and bring her in. Your efforts will be rewarded with gifts. (You can be shy, but you have to be willing) because I can teach you.  Gifts start at 1 recruit.  See the list below for rewards on Member Madness.

1 Recruit -  $10 Gift Card and T-Shirt (Varies)3 Recruits - $25 Gift Card and T-Shirt (Varies)6 Recruits - $50 Gift Card and T-Shirt (AMEX)10 or More - $100 Gift Card and T-Shirt (AMEX)*Varies can be Gas Card, Food Card, or even a Lowe's Gift Card.

So bring your sneakers, towels and master keys, because we are ready to open the Ladies Locker Room, and we want to see you there. 

[img src="" title="" alt="" width="200" height="150" border="0" align="left" >

This meeting will not only be informative, but also will be fun. 

GET READY!!

GET SET!!

HAVE FUN!! 

Refreshments will be served.  
Any Ladies Locker Room event that includes Member Madness also has a follow up after event to toast to our accomplishments.  We will drink and have fun and discuss our adventure.
results.name: Ladies Locker Room and Member Madness Event

results.description:
Learn to make tasty and healthy Japanese delicacies.

Koya tofu is said to be invented by the monks in the sacred Koya mountain in Japan. It is an important part of the Buddhist vegetarian gastronomy.  It is hearty, soft and spongy tofu that absorbs every nice flavor. And it's more nutritious than regular tofu. 


You will learn how easy it is to create tasty Japanese food without going through complicated procedures. Certain key techniques will be demonstrated.

The most important thing in my class is that you are having fun while you learn. After cooking is done, you will enjoy the dishes you cooked.

The menu:

Dashi for vegetarian

Osumashi dashi soup with seasonal vegetable

Koya tofu with shiitake mushrooms and vegetables

results.description:
Tickets: https://goo.gl/kaVmrc 

25% Off: IMPROVE25

Learn how to hand sculpt a beautiful mug. No experience needed. At this event, we'll focus on making 1 porcelain mug. Our 2-hour workshop will include: 

 -Pinching and creating various shapes 

 -Learning to score and slip to attach functional or decorative details 

-Exploring various finishing techniques like smoothing, adding a variety of textures and altering the shape through cutouts and paddling 

-Black and blue underglazes will be provided to add additional surface designs, if desired. 

-The pieces will be glazed with food safe clear, high-fired within 3 weeks. 

-Pick up coordination will be emailed out once your piece is ready

*Please remember that this Meetup listing may not have accurate information - the people who have RSVPed may not have PAID/SIGNED UP. Please check attached link for the most accurate details!

venue.name: SW corner of East 60th St and 1st Avenue

results.description:
We'll start in Manhattan, then cross the 59th St Bridge to Queens, then take the Roosevelt Island Bridge to Roosevelt Island, then the cable car back to Manhattan, then we'll walk 2 miles north along the East River to 103rd St, then take the Ward's Island Bridge to Randall's Island, then the Triborough Bridge to Astoria.

After we reach Astoria, I'll direct those who want to go home to the Astoria Blvd subway station on the N line, then those interested in dinner can follow me to my apartment near 23rd Ave and 31st St for a *PIZZA* *PARTY*, with pizza, hot wings, seafood salad, potato salad, beer, wine, and strawberry daiquiris.  The hike is free, but the pizza party costs $10 / person, whether you eat anything or not.

The walkway over the Triborough Bridge has no chain link fence guarding it, just a railing that's only 3 feet high, so if you're a tall person there is a very strong feeling of the height, much more so than on the George Washington Bridge.  And if your hat blows off, you'll never see it again -- it's recommended that you tie your hat to a shoelace around your neck.

If you're driving to this hike, it's recommended you park your car for free on the streets near 23rd Ave and 31st St in Queens, take the "N" train from Ditmars Blvd to Lexington Ave and then walk to the start point.

We should be reaching the end in Astoria around 6:00pm.  Sunset will be at 6:45pm.

Be sure to have a good breakfast before the hike, because we won't be stopping for lunch. Attendance on this hike is free, and all participants attend at their own risk. Everyone will be required to sign a release waiver that basically gives up any right whatsoever to sue, to the fullest extent possible by law. You can read the current draft of this waiver at http://bluejacket7.com/legal/WalkingWaiver.doc
results.how_to_find_us: We should be the only group there, plus I look like my picture.

group.name: The New York Afternoon Hiking Meetup

results.description:
Just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.
results.name: Saturday soccer 11:45 - 1PM 7v7.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GpKdTkVACSU

We'll be playing funk this season. Join us for a great time playing in this group. We got the funk of Stevie Wonder, James Brown, Chic, Kool&The Gang, George Clinton and more! 

Acoustic guitars, bass and ukeleles welcome. If electric bring a portable amp:)


This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play! 

To join:

• RSVP before you attend the session.

• Choose your guitar part from TAB>MORE>FILES download/print and bring it to practice to follow. (All charts will be posted by end of August) 

• Bring acoustic guitar or electric with a portable amp. 

• Have an amazing time!

Practice days are:

September 09/05, 09/12, 09/19, 09/26
October 10/03, 10/10, 10/17, 10/24, 10/31 (halloween, boo)
November 11/07, 11/14, 11/21 (skipping Thanksgiving, Happy Thanksgiving!)
December 12/05, 12/12

Season Pass

You can purchase the Season Pass (13 sessions at discount + show fee) for $340  (you save $20)

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=MWF56937BM6Q8


SONGLIST is (roughly, a song could be added or removed in a few weeks). Songs will be added over the weeks til November.

SUPERSTITION by Stevie Wonder (POSTED)

I FEEL GOOD by James Brown (POSTED)

JUNGLE BOOGIE by Kool and the Gang

GET DOWN ON IT by Kool and the Gang

SEX MACHINE by James Brown

GOOD TIMES by Chic

WE GOT THE FUNK by George Clinton&Parliament

PICK UP THE PIECES by Average White Band


Show Day is Sunday, December 13th at 2pm

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village December 13th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand (starting in October) at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

This show is going to rock!

Check out our website at http://edelage.wix.com/edge

results.description:
TASTE OF GRAMERCY TICKETS, COURTESY OF BLUE ANCHOR EVENTS!

Taste of Gramercy Neighborhood (TOGN) is one of New York City’s most famous food events, one that brings together participants from over 40 restaurants and sponsors such as Danny Meyer’s Gramercy Tavern, Mario Batali’s Casa Mono, Bedford Cheese, Morton’s Grille, and many other fine Gramercy Park restaurants and bars.  It all takes place from 11:00 am to 3:00 pm on Saturday September 26, 2015.  Location is Irving Place between 17th and 18th Streets.

Taste of Gramercy Neighborhood is hosted by Gramercy Neighborhood Associates, one of the oldest community organizations in NYC (since 1912).  TOGN proceeds benefit P.S. 40 and School of the Future, and all food not consumed is donated to The Bowery Mission to support NYC’s homeless population.

Get your early bird discount through September 10th:  6 tastings at $30, or go VIP and get full tastings at $60.  After September 10th, 6 tastings are $40 and full tastings are $70.

Purchase tickets here:  http://togn2015.eventbrite.com/?aff=lynd

Learn to draw in just two hours! Think you can’t draw a straight line? Longing to tap into your right brain? Join NYC's #1 Rated Art Class Studio in this fun and inspiring drawing class in Central Park, as YOU:

-Learn beginner's drawing techniques 
-Create your own drawings while learning about: line, shading, composition, self-expression, and more 
-Receive one-on-one expert art instruction 
-Start your weekend off with a creative escape 
-Receive the health benefits of drawing, such as deep relaxation, stress release, increased memory and focus, and of course, enjoyment! 
-Walk away feeling fulfilled with your own drawings that will make you say, "Wow, I AM creative!"

All art supplies included. Art class meets on the Upper West Side in Central Park. 
In the case of rain, students will meet at The Art Studio NY for an indoor drawing class adventure.

Join us under the umbrella tent as we try delicious homemade greek food while socializing with MEETUP members. Parking and admission is free. This event is rain or shine.

They also have food/drink vendors and flea market such as jewelry, arts, and crafts.

We will park and meet at Hawthorne Gospel Church which is located on Route 208 South between the exits of Goffle Road and Grandview Avenue. There is a free shuttle bus that takes you to the festival and back to the church all day. Don't have to worry about parking in the street.

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe. 


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 10:30AM


No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:


2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club Programs or activities.

results.description:
Secret Identity

You’ve created an identity for yourself in the Pagan community, does that identity serve you or is it an accomodation for others? What would happen if you revealed your true self to others? How important is it to have the acceptance and approval of others? If the divine told you to be your true self? Would you?

Sat, September 26 at Noon, FREE
Washington Square Park
5 Avenue, Waverly Place, West 4th and MacDougal Streets

The Meditation and Ritual Lab is a meditation class for practitioners of magic. The discipline of meditation to achieve the aims of the magician, witch or mystic. It is open to all levels of experience. There will be opportunity in each class to practice some form of structured technique such as guided meditation, visualization, breath work, AND time for quiet reflection and for simply sitting in your own skin. Importance will be placed on developing stillness, centeredness, receptivity, focus and will.
